loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. makes a living selling food and provisions, and has been in this business since 2001. She is 40 years old and lives in the town of Afro-media in Lagos State, Nigeria with her husband and three children. She has been active in LAPO Microfinance as a client for the past three years. Grace has applied for a loan of $1,200 to buy more food and provisions to sell to her customers, and wants to express her gratitude to Kiva and the people who lend to her.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and food to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience E. lives in the town of Igbelerin, in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells hair products and hair pieces for a living, and also does manicures and pedicures. She spent two years studying this trade before going into business on her own in 2006. Patience is 30 years old, married and has five children. She needs a loan of $1,200 to buy products and hairpieces to sell to her customers, and wishes to extend her thanks to Kiva and to her lenders.

loans.use: To buy more hair products to sell to her customers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory O. lives in the town of ijaniki, in Lagos State, Nigeria, where she makes a living selling juice and fruit near her house. She studied this trade for three years before going into business on her own seven years ago. Glory is 30 years old, married and has four children. She has been active in LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more juice and fruit to sell, and wishes to thank you and Kiva for your support.

loans.use: To buy more juice and fruits to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: For the past three years, Justina A. has made a living selling frozen foods like chicken and fish and other items to her customers. She has been active with LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. Justina is 38 years old and married with five children. She needs a loan of $350 to expand her business by buying more frozen food and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food and other items to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal B. is a 36-year-old farmer who has sold milk and yogurt to local people since 1992. He is married and has three sons. He lives in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. As he and his wife are unemployed, selling milk is the only one financial source in their family. Jamal would like to expand his business and purchase one milk cow for an estimated cost of $800 USD.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman A. is a 48 year old farmer who raises sheep for meat production. He has seven years of experience in this field. He lives in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced Persons Settlement and breeding sheep is the only source of income for his family. Elman applied for a 800 USD loan to purchase 10 sheep and fodder.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal B. is a 21 year old farmer who continued in his father’s business of selling milk and yoghurt to the local people. In addition to helping his father from childhood, he gained real experience in 2005, when his father become sick and he had to run the business.  Vusal lives with his parents, who receive a  pension from the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced Persons Settlement.  Vusal would like to purchase a cow to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Shakhnaz

texts.en: Shakhnaz H. is a 41 year old woman who has sold sheep for more than 20 years. She is married and has four children. She and her husband are unemployed and receive an internally displaced persons benefit, which is approximately 70 USD per month. Shakhnaz started her breeding sheep to supplement her income. As mutton is very popular among Azeris and summer is wedding season, Shakhnaz is requesting a 700 USD loan to purchase a special type of sheep which costs 70 USD each. This type of sheep grows faster and has more meat than usual sheep. She plans on purchasing 10 sheep.

loans.use: to purchase 70 sheep

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana M. is a 40 year old woman who sells milk in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced Persons Settlement. She has more than 10 years of experience selling milk. Svetlana is married and has 3 children. Beside this business, she is also working in one of the local stores as a salesperson. However, her main source of income is selling milk and her salary as a salesperson is very meager, approximately 30 USD per month. Svetlana is requesting a 700 USD loan to purchase one milk cow. Expanding her business will help Svetlana to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan Y. is a 50 year old man who has a store where he sells washing powder, soap and shampoo. He has more than 20 years of experience running his business. Elkhan is married and has five children. He is requesting a 800 USD loan to diversify the number of goods he sells.

loans.use: to diversify the goods he sells at his store

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif Q. is a 58 year old farmer who breeds calves for meat in the southern part of Azerbaijan in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field. Akif is married and has five children. He is working as a teacher at a local school but his salary is too meager to cover his family's needs. His monthly salary is about 30 USD per month. Akif is focused on expanding his livestock business. He is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase two calves at 300 USD each and 200 USD of fodder.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso Group

texts.en:
Jesucita T. is a young woman living in the community of Samaná in the Dominican Republic. Struggling to find a way to begin an income generating business, she came to Esperanza. She initially requested a loan of $150, which would allow her to buy the fruits, vegetables, and chicken that she would need for her street vending business. Currently, she lives at home with her two children (who are two and eight). She spends most of her time with them. When we asked her about her favorite meal she appropriately responded, “Rice and beans”. What else could be your favorite dish in Latin America?

Jesucita plans to reinvest her earnings into her business as it continues to grow. It is her dream, after her children are a bit older, to travel with them to a foreign country and see a bit of the world outsiD. the island of Hispaniola.

Jesucita is just one member of the 5 person bank, Nuevo Progreso. These Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the other members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

On behalf of Jesucita and the entire team at Esperanza, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty that you are helping to solve.

loans.use: To purchase chicken, vegetables, and a cart to sell her goods in the street

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en: Guloglan A. is a 58 year old farmer who has nine children! He breeds sheep in the Bilasuvar region of Azerbaijan. He is an internally displaced person and moved to Bilasuvar in 1993.  Since then, he has engaged in the sheep breeding business. As summer is a peak season for weddings, Guloglan want to take this opportunity and increase his income. For this purpose, he applied for a 800 USD loan to purchase two calves for 300 USD each and fodder for 200 USD.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Rakhman

texts.en: Rakhman H. is a 40 year old man who breeds calves in the southern region of Azerbaijan named  Bilasuvar.  Only internally displaced people live in this region. Rakhman has 18 years of experience in his business. He is married and has 3 sons. They all help him look after the  calves. Rakhman applied for a loan of 800 USD to purchase two mid-sizes calves (at 400 USD each) to increase his earnings. He believes that summer is a peak time to make money because it is the wedding season and Azeri people use meat to cook most of their meals.

loans.use: to purchase two mid-sized calves

loans.name: Asadulla

texts.en: Asadulla H. is a 47 year old man who raises and sells sheep to local bazaar traders in the Bilasuvar region of Azerbaijan. He lives with his wife and five children in the Bilasuvar internally displaced persons settlement. He has nine years of experience in sheep breeding. Asadulla applied for a loan of 800 USD to purchase more sheep for his sheep herd. He and his wife are unemployed and the sale of sheep is their only one source of income for their family.  He will purchase 10 sheep for 60 USD each and 200 USD of fodder with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Nusret

texts.en: Nusret S. is a 65 year old man who has sold milk and yoghurt to locals since 1990. He is married and has 10 children! It is very hard to raise such a large family and provide for all of their needs. He is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase one milk cow. He lives in the Bilasuvar internally displaced persons settlement. He is currently unemployed but is the main breadwinner for the family. His family is subsisting on an IDP benefit of approximately 70 USD per month.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Shemiddin

texts.en: Shemiddin A. is a 50 year old man who keeps a herd of sheep in the southern part of the Bilasuvar region in Azerbaijan. He has more than 15 years of experience in sheep breeding. He is married and has six children. He applied for 800 USD loan to purchase 10 sheep, at 60 USD each, and fodder for 200 USD.  As summer is high wedding season in Azerbaijan, selling a lot of sheep during this period will help him increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid A. is a 56 year old trader who lives and works in the Imishli region of Azerbaijan.  He has seven years of experience in managing his own store.  He works as a teacher at a local school and earns a monthly salary of approximately 40 USD per month. As he is married and has 3 children, it is very hard for him to provide for all of the needs of his family. He applied for a loan of 800 USD to purchase more goods for his store.

loans.use: to purchase more goods

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah S. sells soap as well as running a restaurant. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Hannah and her five children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.
She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Elsy

texts.en:
Elsy S. sells provisions and runs a restaurant. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Elsy and her four children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.
She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience A. sells refrigerators. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Patience and her three children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.
She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
The Conima district is the birthplace of Victoria, who left her village as a child, along with her younger brothers, in search of better opportunities. Once she had her own family she decided to dedicate herself to selling fuels and gas, merchandise that she acquires from the city of La Paz, Bolivia, and sells in the city of Juliaca, thereby earning essential income to support her family and above all the education of her beloved sons. While Victoria dedicates herself to this profession, her dear husband works providing taxi service to their community. Victoria wishes to acquire a loan that after investing will enable her to improve her income and thereby also improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El distrito de Conima es el pueblo natal de Doña Victoria, quien desde niña salió de su villa en busca de mejores oportunidades junto a sus menores hermanos, una vez que formó su familia decidió dedicarse al negocio de venta de combustibles y gas, mercadería que adquiere de la ciudad de la Paz - Bolivia y oferta en la ciudad de Juliaca obteniendo ganancias indispensables para el sustento de su familia y sobre todo para la educación de sus amados hijos.Mientras Doña Victoria se dedica a esta labor su querido esposo trabaja brindando servicio de taxi a su comunidad, el deseo de Victoria es adquirir un préstamo que luego de su inversión le permitirán mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Capital to continue her work in order to benefit her family

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
Teófila is a sweet and charming 53 year old street vendor who has been selling snacks from a small cart that she acquired to transport her products. She began with little merchandise but great enthusiasm of expanding her business and growing her income. Now she sees the importance of strategic location of her business and the necessity of acquiring a greater quantity of merchandise to stock in order to meet her customer’s demands.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Teófila, es una dulce y encantadora dama de 53 años de edad, desde hace algunos años viene dedicándose a la venta de golosinas en forma ambulatoria en una pequeña carretita que adecuó para el traslado de sus productos, inicio su labor con poca mercadería pero con gran entusiasmo de ampliarlo y mejorar sus ingresos, ahora observando el lugar estratégico de la ubicación de su negocio se ve en la necesidad de adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtirla y así cumplir con cada una de las solicitudes de sus clientes.

loans.use: Acquire snack products to sell

loans.name: Yhasmira

texts.es:
Yhasmira is a very intelligent and exemplary young woman. Not long ago she has finished her advanced studies and is already practicing as a teacher with great responsibility and professionalism. She feels very happy and proud, because with the unconditional support that her loving parents gave her, she was finally able to realize one of her greatest dreams. At this time, Yhasmira stands before you with the attempt to touch your generous hearts and request a loan with which she plans to help her parents in their business of selling logs and firewood. Thanks to this investment they can improve the quality of their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Yhasmira, es una joven muy inteligente y ejemplar, hace poco tiempo concluyó sus estudios superiores de educación y ya viene ejerciendo con gran responsabilidad y profesionalismo su labor de maestra, ella se siente muy contenta y orgullosa porque gracias al apoyo incondicional que le brindaron sus queridos padres pudo finalmente concretar uno de sus grandes sueños.En esta oportunidad Yhasmira se presenta ante vosotros para tocar vuestros corazones generosos y solicitarte un préstamo con el que tiene planeado apoyar a sus padres en su negocio de venta de troncos y leña, gracias a dicha inversión mejorarán su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Investment of money in the family business

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina, with her small but indispensable business of selling prickly pears and the beautifully woven gloves and stockings, continues to improve the life of her loved 12 year old daughter, Cristina, who has turned into the main force behind her impulses to get ahead in this hard world. Every day of the week, she takes her small wagon of prickly pears to her place of business where she offers her delicious fruit for sale. The wish of this enchanting woman is to be able to provide an advanced education for her only daughter; she is willing to put in all her efforts to achieve this goal. Your support translates into tremendous help for Mrs. Guillermina.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermina con su pequeño pero indispensable negocio de venta de tunas y tejido de hermosos y cómodos guantes y calcetines viene sacando adelante a su querida hija Cristina de 12 años de edad, quien se convirtió en el principal motor que la impulsa a progresar en este duro mundo.Todos los días de la semana saca su pequeña carretita de tunas para dirigirse al puestito de su negocio y ofrecer sus deliciosas y frescas frutas. El deseo de esta encantadora dama es brindarle sus estudios superiores a su única hija, para ello está dispuesta a poner todo su empeño en sus actividades.Vuestro aporte significa una indispensable ayuda para Doña Guillermina.

loans.use: Improve her small place of business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a 36 year old lady, her financial independence since childhood has turned her into a woman sure of herself and of what she wants to accomplish. For the last 8 years she has had a business of selling fringes and trim, and a variety of cloth at wholesale. She obtains her merchandise in La Paz, Bolivia and sells it in the capital of her country, Lima. Her main customers are the big makers of polos and t-shirts of said city; this is where a large number of her orders come from. She cannot fill their entire request due to her lack of capital and hopes that with the generous contribution that you bring she can fulfill the orders of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Juana, es una dama de 36 años de edad, su independencia económica desde niña la convirtió en una mujer segura de sí misma y de lo que está dispuesta a alcanzar, desde hace 8 años viene dedicándose al negocio de pasamanería y venta de variadas telas al por mayor, mercadería que adquiere de la ciudad de la Paz Bolivia y los vende en la ciudad capital de su país Lima.Sus principales clientes son los grandes confeccionistas de polos y poleras de dicha ciudad, es por ello que tiene gran cantidad de pedidos, pero Juana no pueda satisfacer cada uno de sus solicitudes por falta de capital, espera que con la colaboración generosa que le brindes pueda cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a larger inventory of cloth.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Mr. K. Kodjo was born the 30 of March, 1981 in Lomé. He is single and is a clothing retailer in the neighbourhood of Adidogomé in Lomé. In 2005 he opened a drycleaning store called ETS EL DORADO. He is only person to open a store in this neighbourhood. His principal clients are students and civil servants. This first loan will allow him to buy a washing machine, 60 outfits for women and 170 bags of mineral water.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Kodjo est né le 30 mars 1981 à Lomé. Il est célibataire et est un revendeur d’habits dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. En 2005 il a ouvert un magasin de lavage à sec (ETS EL DORADO). Il est le seul à ouvert ce magasin dans ce quartier et ses principaux clients sont les élèves, étudiants et fonctionnaires. Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une machine à laver, 60 habits de femmes et 170 sachets d’eau minérale.

loans.use: buying washing machine and clothing outfits

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Fofana Mariama

texts.fr:
Mrs. S. Fofana Mariama was born the 22 of April, 1953 in Sokodé, 470 km (292 miles) from Lomé. She is married and mother of 5 children. She has a business reselling plastic garbage cans, loincloths and toothpaste in the neighbourhood of Agoè. Generally she is in the habit of distributing her merchandise to her loyal clients and collects payment every 8 days. This is her second loan and she is asking for $600 (250000 FCFA) to buy 30 pieces of cloth for loincloths and 4 large plastic garbage cans. These purchases will allow her to replenish her stock.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Fofana Mariama est née le 22 avril 1953 à Sokodé à 470 kilomètres de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de seau en plastique, de pagne en bazin et des pâtes dentifrices dans le quartier d’Agoè. Généralement elle a l’habitude de distribuer ses marchandises à ses clients fidèles et procède à la collecte des fonds chaque 8 jours. Elle est à son deuxième cycle de crédit et sollicite 250000 FCFA pour acheter 30 pièces de pagne bazin et 4 grands seaux en plastique. Ces achats lui serviront pour la reconstitution du stock épuisé.

loans.use: purchase of 30 pieces of cloth for loinclothes and plastic garbage cans

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr:
Mrs F. Essohanam was born the 1st of January in 1980 in Lomé. She is married with Mr. TELOU Sodou, who is a tax agent. They have one child. Mrs. F. Essohanam raises pigs and sells them to butchers and restaurant owners in Lomé. After paying back her first loan from (microcredit group) WAGES, she acquired a telephone to create a telephone booth for her neighbourhood. Her second loan will allow her to buy 30 pigs to continue her activity.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame F. Essohanam est née le 1er janvier 1980 à Lomé. Elle s’est mariée avec Monsieur TELOU Sodou qui est un agent des Impôts. Ils ont un enfant à charge. Madame F. Essohanam élève des porcs et les vend aux propriétaires de charcuterie et aux propriétaires de restaurant de Lomé. Après remboursement du premier crédit qu’elle a obtenu au près de WAGES, elle s’est acquittée d’un téléphone pour créer une cabine téléphonique dans son quartier. Le second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir 30 porcs afin de pouvoir continuer son activité.

loans.use: purchase of 30 pigs

loans.name: Gladiz

texts.es:
Gladiz is a retired teacher. Since her income from her pension is not sufficient in Bolivia, she works in selling cosmetics and perfumes.

Her residence in located in the north part of La Paz.

This is the third time that she is requesting a loan at Impro, these loan proceeds will be used to purchase merchandise (cosmetics and perfumes).

Her work, but above all her desire to succeed allow her to qualify for this loan. She is a born fighter, with the goal of improving the quality of her life with the help that we can provide.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Gladiz es jubilada del magisterio, como sus ingresos por jubilación no son los suficientes en Bolivia, se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos y perfumes.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (cosméticos, perfumes)

Su trabajo, pero sobre todo, las ganas de superación de Amanda permiten acceder a este crédito ya que es una mujer luchadora cuyo objetivo es mejorar su calidad vida con la ayuda que le brindaremos.

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Wilmer Guillermo

texts.es:
Mr. Wilmer M. Gutiérrez and his wife (Ina Ticona Yanque) rent in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of the city of La Paz.

Wilmer works in a paint store in the city and his wife is a domestic employee in the Sopocachi area. Wilmer is in his second year studying general accounting at the Atenea Institute, thanks to a previously granted loan from IMPRO.

The current loan will be used to pay the 2008 education expenses at the Atenea Institute.

As this is the second time that he is seeking a loan with us, we can confirm that Wilmer’s application is satisfactory and approved.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Wilmer M. Gutiérrez y su esposa (Ina Ticona Yanque) viven en anticrético(una especie de arriendo/alquiler que se da en Bolivia) en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz.

Wilmer trabaja en una tienda de pinturas de la ciudad y su esposa es empleada domestica en la zona de Sopocachi. Asimismo, el cliente cursa el segundo año de la carrera de contaduría general en el Instituto Atenea, gracias a un crédito otorgado anteriormente por IMPRO.

El crédito actual tiene el propósito de cancelar las pensiones de la gestión 2008 en el mencionado instituto.

Siendo esta la segunda vez que solicita un crédito con nosotros, confirmamos satisfactoriamente la solicitud de Wilmer.

loans.use: Education

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Isabel del Carmen L. M. is a native of the city of Bluefields. She is 66 years of age and is married to Humberto García; together they have 3 adult children. Mrs. L.’s sole source of income is her small grocery store, which she has owned for the past 30 years and is situated in the main dock of the city. Among her clients are those who travel to the communities and foreign visitors who favor her thanks to the variety of products she offers (basic grains, juices, soups, sodas, natural fruit beverages, disposable diapers, paper plates and cups, among other items). The items she offers have not diminished in demand because they are of high consumption to the population.

This is the second loan that Mrs. L. has requested, and she intends to use it as follows: 3 hundredweights of rice at $45 each, 2 hundredweights of sugar at $30 each, 2 drums of oil at $44 each, 4 boxes of laundry detergent at $11 each, 2 large packages of bathroom tissue at $9 each, 2 cases of coffee at $19, 1 case of powdered milk at $60, 2 large packages of detergent at $12 each, 3 cases of juice at $11 each and 6 packages of disposable diapers at $8 each. With this investment, she will be able to increase her earnings and meet the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Isabel del Carmen L. M. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 66 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Humberto García, ambos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, cabe mencionar que el único ingreso de La Sr. L. es el de la pulpería. La Sra. L. es propietaria de una pulpería por más de 30 años ubicada en el muelle municipal de la ciudad, teniendo como clientes a las personas que viajan a las comunidades y visitantes extranjeros que la prefieren por ofrecer variedades de productos (granos básicos, jugos, sopas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, pañales descartables, vasos y platos descartables entre otras cosas), cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no a disminuido su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población.

Este es el segundo crédito que solicita la Sra. L. para comprar: 3 quintales de arroz a $ 45.00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 30.00 dólares el quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a $ 44.00 dólares el bidón, 4 cajas de lavar ropa a $ 11.00 dólares cada caja, 2 bolsones de papel higiénico a $ 9.00 dólares el bolsón, 2 cajas de café a $ 19.00 dólares cada caja, 1 caja de leche en polvo a $ 60.00 dólares la caja, 2 bolsones de detergentes a $ 12.00 dólares cada bolsón, 3 cajas de jugos a $ 11.00 dólares cada caja y 6 paquetes de pañales descartables a $ 8.00 dólares cada paquete, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, laundry detergent, bathroom tissue, coffee, powdered milk, detergent, juices and disposable diapers to sell in her grocery store.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 45.83 dólares.

loans.name: Zenaida María

texts.es:
Mrs. Zenaida María B. P. is from the city of Bluefields, Nicaragua. She is 32 years old and married to Mr. Claudio José Aguilar, who works as a security guard at an ophthalmologist’s clinic, where he earns minimum wage, but it doesn’t cover all the basic expenses. They have four children together, all of whom attend secondary school. Mrs. B. has sold used clothing for 3 years and has many passer-by customers who prefer to buy from her because of her clothing variety (children’s clothing, sheets, men’s clothing, and women’s clothing for all ages). With the income from her business, she pays for her children’s schooling. Mrs. B. has a great demand for bedding (sheets) and at the moment she doesn’t have enough capital to purchase more bales of sheets. For this reason she would like to buy one bale of sheets at $300 per bale, and with this investment she will increase her earnings and be able to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Zenaida María B. P. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Claudio José Aguilar quien trabaja como guardia de seguridad de una clínica oftalmológica el cual devenga un salario mínimo que no cubre todos los pagos de los gastos básicos, ambos tienen 4 hijos menores de edad que cursan estudios secundarios. La Sra. B. vende ropa usada hace 3 años teniendo como clientes a los transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de ropas (ropa para niños, sabanas, ropa para hombres y mujeres de todas las edades) con el ingreso de su negocio paga los estudios de sus hijos. La Sra. B. tiene mas demanda de ropa de cama (sabanas) y por el momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar mas pacas de sabanas y por esta razón quiere comprar 1 paca de sabanas a $ 300.00 dólares la paca, con esta inversión aumentara sus ganancias y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase a bale of sheets

payments.comment: La cuota real es de $ 49.78 dólares

loans.name: Bank Of Emprendedoras Group

texts.en:
Dominga is the mother of three children, all of whom are now in their twenties. She has a small business selling hair braids to her neighbors and wants to be able to expand it. She hopes to be able to proviD. for her family and better her current living situation through the profits she will earn with a larger business. She sees people around her with more amenities and luxuries, but she cannot afford them for her family. Currently, she lives in one of the poorest provinces in the Dominican Republic. Though the loan may not seem like much, it has the potential to greatly help her and her family.

Note: This is a group loan. In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To grow her business and provide for her family

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos (Firm And Blessed) Bank Group

texts.en:
Cecilia had two children. One is 37-years-old and the other passed away. She is the proud grandmother of a 21-year-old and will probably live to be a great-grandmother in the near future. Culturally, people marry very young in the Dominican Republic. Cecilia´s business consists of sewing clothes to sell. In order to do this, she needs to be able to buy fabric. With the loan money, she can buy more fabric to grow her business and take better care of herself and her family. She dreams of living a better life and helping her grandkids live better than she has.

Note: This is a group loan. In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To sew more clothes and support her grandkids

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is the mother of two children, ages 17 and 18.  Juana has a variety of businesses, which include killing/selling pork, running a little shop and selling agua dulce (sweet water) and other products.  Juana has successfully paid back four loans to Esperanza International and her businesses are doing very well.  With a fifth loan, Juana hopes to be able to own her very own house, made of cement blocks.  She also wants her two children to be able to finish their education and continue studying at the university.  Juana is currently halfway through her own bachelor’s degree at the university.

loans.use: To invest in her businesses so that she can put her kids through college

loans.name: Yeth Mek Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeth M. is the group leader of a six-member banking group in Chrok Kov Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a grocer in the village.

Previously, Mrs. Yeth M. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy fertilizer and rice seeds, and she rented a pump to water her rice field. Her business now is very much improved, so she wants to expand her business. Thus, Mrs. Yeth M. needs to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell.

Mrs. Yeth M. has three children, two of whom are enrolled in state school; the youngest is too young. Her husband, Mr.Thy Pisch, is a subsistence farmer. Last year, Mrs. Yeth M.’s youngest child got dengue fever and she had spent $50 have him treated.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her customers.

loans.name: Sambath Tep Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambath T. is the village bank president in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. This village bank consists of twenty-six members.

Mrs. Sambath T. owns a small restaurant where she sells rice and rice soup as a breakfast food. Mrs. Sambath T. obtained a loan from Amret Co.,Ltd to open her restaurant. Now, her business activity has improved, and Mrs. Sambath T. needs to expand her business, but she doesn't have enough money to buy more ingredients to cook a delicious breakfast for her customers. Thus, Mrs. Sambath T. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

She is 49 years old and the mother of foU. children, one of whom is a tailor, and another is a construction worker. The remaining two are enrolled in school. Her husband, Mr. Chantha Saom, is a construction worker.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to cook a delicious breakfast for her customers.

loans.name: Savey Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people in Preak Thom Village, Cambodia, comprise one village bank. Mrs. Savey C. is the village bank president. She sells shells in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Sam Ol Oeurk, is a motorbike-taxi driver. Mrs. Savey C. has seven children, six of whom attend a local school; the other is too young to work or study.

Previously, Mrs. Savey C. obtained a loan to buy a motorbike to start Mr. Sam Ol Oeurk’s motor-taxi business. The business now faces a small problem, because the motorbike needs to be repaired, but they do not have enough money to fix it. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Savey C., decided to take a loan to repair the motorbike. With the rest of money, she will buy more shells to re-sell them.

loans.use: To repair their motorbike and buy more shells to resell

loans.name: Doung

texts.en: Doung S., 28, is a grocery seller from her house in her village and her average income is $1.5 per day. Her husband is a farmer and can make around $1 per day. They live with two children in Chan Sery Village, Pursat Province. Now S. seeks a loan of $100 to purchase grocery stocks for her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks for her business

loans.name: Saneam Soeur Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province form one group in one Village Bank. Mrs. Saneam S. is the Village Bank President and she is a grocer in the local village.

Her business now has insufficient grocery goods for her customers so Mrs. Saneam S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products. Her husband, Mr. Yorn Ong, is a match maker who introduces the bride and groom to get to know each other in order to wed.

Mrs. Saneam S. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while one other is studying at state school. The one remaining is too yoU. to work or study. The people who are in the back of the photo are not in this Village Bank.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for customers.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en: Faizullo K. was born in 1964 in Asht, Tajikistan, and is now married with five children.  While his wife works in the yarn and milk-making business, he raises livestock and teaches his trade to his children.  With 10 years of experience, Faizullo wants to increase his business and therefore is applying for a loan of $625 for six months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.name: Kholdorboi

texts.en: Kholdorboi K. lives in Asht, Tajikistan, and is married with five children.  Like many of his fellow villagers, he raises livestock for a living.  Over the last five years, he has accumulated a herd of three cows, as well as several bulls and rams.  By trading the meat and milk, he is able to support his family and also work on the nearby collective farm.  Kholdorboi is now applying for a loan of $625 for six months in order to open his own trading outlet.

loans.use: To open a trading outlet.

loans.name: Kurbonbibi

texts.en: Kurbonbibi N. was born in 1962 in Asht, Tajikistan.  She is engaged in the family business of raising livestock, and therefore makes her living selling meat, milk-sour products, yarn, and felt.  With over ten years of experience, she has successfully grown her business while working alongside her fellow villagers.  Kurbonbibi is now applying for a loan of $825 for seven months in order to purchase computerized equipment which will help her make milk-sour products.

loans.use: To purchase computerized equipment for making milk-sour products.

loans.name: Saidahon

texts.en: Saidahon S. is 35 years old and is married with two children.  She has successfully repaid previous loans, which were applied towards developing her business of yarn making and sock manufacturing.  Having experienced success in this field for the last ten years, Saidahon has developed strong business skills and is now applying for a loan of $925 for seven months to purchase an advanced , computerized yarn making machine.

loans.use: To purchase an advanced yarn making machine.

loans.name: Ganijon

texts.en: Ganijon T. lives in Asht, Tajikistan, and raises livestock alongside his fellow villagers.  Having extensive experience in this field, Ganijon now owns two cows and one bull, and trades both the meat and milk from his animals.  Ganijon also works as a carpenter and contributes to his community's collective farms.  He is now applying for a $825 loan for six months to open a trading outlet in the market so that he can sell his meat and milk more effectively.

loans.use: To open a trade outlet to sell meat.

loans.name: Siphat Yang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. SiP. Y. is the Village Bank President in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. This Village Bank consists of thirty members. Mrs. SiP. Y. is a vegetable seller and fruit seller. She is a widow mother of one child who is attending a local school.

Mrs. SiP. Y. is in poor condition because she is trying to generate enough money to support the family. In order to make her family live in better circumstances, Mrs. SiP. Y. wants to expand her business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy additional fruits to re-sell for an income. She would like to use the remaining money to buy a bike for her child to transport to school.

Several of the people who are standing at the back is not a part of the Village Bank members.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more different fruits to re-sell for an income.

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en: Gulom D. is 23 years old and lives in Asht, Tajikistan.  His father was a schoolteacher, and Gulom hopes that his son will also one day be a schoolteacher.  Gulom was unable to train as a teacher, however, because he served in the army and then started a livestock business when he returned, about three years ago.  Having repaid a previous loan which allowed him to buy milk cows and rams and thereby start his business Gulom is now applying for a loan of $825 for eight months to purchase a bull.

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Chon Erm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people in Preak Thom Village make up one Village Bank and Mrs. Chon E. is the Village Bank President. She grows different kinds of vegetables in the village.

Her plantation business activity now is not performing very well because the field is infertile. In order to make her plantation crop more productive, Mrs. Chon E. would like to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field.

Her husband, Mr. Yang Sam, is a vegetable farmer. Mrs. Chon E. is the mother of two children, both of whom are attending a local school. Mrs. Chon E. now has a swollen leg and she spends unforeseen expenses. People who stand at the right are not in these Village Bank members.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en: Alijon R. is 38 years old and is married with five children.  His wife trades in the local bazaar, and he is engaged in the raising of livestock.  Alijon has been working with livestock for eight years, and now is the owner of two cows and one bull.  In order to break into the business of trading rams and other animals, Alijon is applying for a loan of $625 for six months.

loans.use: To purchase new rams.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam S. lives in Asht, Tajikistan, and works alongside his fellow villages as a keeper of livestock.  He has cows and bulls, and also trades milk, and has been working in this field for five years.  Rustam also occasionally works in the collective farms, and has developed carpentry skills which supplement his income.  He is now applying for a loan of $825 for six months to open a trading station.

loans.use: To open a trading station.

loans.name: Krut

texts.en: Krut Y is a grocery seller in her village in the Chamkarchek Choeung Village, Pursat Province. She is a widow and lives with five children, three of whom are working as road construction workers. One is studying to be a hairdresser and one other is attending school. Desiring to start a new karaoke business, now she is seeking a loan to purchase karaoke materials for her new business and use the remainder of the loan to purchase her grocery stocks.

loans.use: To purchase karaoke materials for her new business and purchase grocery stocks

loans.name: At

texts.en:
Mrs. At K., 62, and her husband, Mr. Roeun Dul, 74, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They have been married for thirty years and have nine children, seven daughters and two sons. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home. The other five children live with them and some of the children weave silk at home.

Mrs. At has been a silk weaver since she was thirteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Dul stays at home.

She is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase silk materials for her and her children's weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Navy Orm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy O. is the Village Bank President in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. The Village Bank consists of twenty members. Mrs. Navy O. is a pig breeder in the local village. She is 44 years old and the widow of three children, one of whom is sewing shoes in the village while the two others are studying in state school.

Through Mrs. Navy O. business activity, she wishes to buy more pigs for breeding. Thus, Mrs. Navy O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more pigs to raise. She will use the rest of money to buy pig food to feed them.

The two women who sit at the back of the photo are not in this Village Bank and a woman who stands at the back of the photo is also not in this Village Bank.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise and the rest of money she would use to buy pig food to feed them.

loans.name: Malin

texts.en:
Mrs. Malin K., 26, and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Sek, 29, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 2002 and have three children; one is in school and the other two stay at home.

Mrs. Malin has been a cleaner for over five years at a restaurant in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Sopheap has been a security guard for over five years at a restaurant in Phnom Penh as well. Both of them travel to work on their old motorbike.  Now they need to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one.

So, Malin is requesting a loan of US$500 to add to her own money for purchasing a new motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: For purchasing a motorbike to drive to work

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum L., 28, and her husband, Mr. Klang Soeun, 35, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1995 and have three sons, all of whom are in local schools.

Mrs. Sarum has been a silk weaver since she was twelve years old, having learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.  Mr. Klang has been a silk weaver for eleven years, a skill he learned from his wife. He is a bicycle repairer as well.

Now Sarum is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk materials for her and her husband's weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Fanta S. is 50 years old, widowed with 12 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Manguiline Santhiaba in Bignona for 7 years. She would like to strengthen her business selling cosmetics (creams, perfumes, etc.). With her income, she takes care of the family expenses and supports her household. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Fanta S., 50 ans, veuve, 12 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona depuis 7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de produits cosmétiques(crèmes, parfums etc.). Avec ses revenus elle prend en charge les dépenses de la famille et entretien la maison. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell cosmetics

loans.name: Erasto Jose

texts.en:
Erasto is 47 years old and is originally from Vundica in the district of Moamba, Maputo Province. Erasto is married and the father of 4 children: 2 girls and 2 boys. The oldest is 13 years old and the youngest is 11 months. Besides his children, Erasto also supports 2 stepsons who live with him.

Erasto just studied until 4th grade because he lost his parents when he was quite young. In 1981, he moved to his mother’s region, Matutuine, to serve the obligatory military service. When he retired in 1992, he decided to stay in the region. In 1993, Erasto started to work for the Mozambican railway company as a temporary employee. In his spare time, he would work at the family’s “machamba,” a small agricultural field.

In 1997, Erasto was hired as a permanent employee at the railway company in the department of maintenance and repair, where he still works today. He has a monthly salary of MZN 3,000, which he uses to pay the household expenses and sometimes saves a bit. Erasto’s wife works at the machamba, and she gets between half to one ton of corn every 4 months which helps to increase the household income.

As Erasto already has stable businesses, he decided to start a new business in the family: raising cattle. With Erasto’s third loan with Hluvuku of MZN 14,000, he intends to buy 2 cows for MZN 8,000 each. He will cover the difference between the loan and the cost of the cows with own funds. Erasto used his first loan to buy consumer goods such as a sofa and a fridge, and he used the second loan to buy seeds and other products for the machamba.

In the future, Erasto would like to build a conventional house made of bricks. The picture shows Erasto at his current house.

loans.use: Buy 2 cows

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mr. Sophat L., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Sophary Keang, 35, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1994 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. All of them are in local schools.

Mr. Sophat has been a mechanic since 1991. He repairs all kinds of vehicles in his village and nearby villages, while Mrs. Sophary stays at home to take care of the children.

Now Sophat is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorcycle to use in the family and to buy spare parts for his business of repairing vehicles.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use in the family and buy spare parts for business of repairing vehicles.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mr. Chantha L. and his wife, Mrs. Hoeun Lao, who live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1999 and have three children, two sons and one daughter.  Two of their children are in school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mr. Chantha started his business of producing fresh noodles and selling them to the local market in 1995. Now he has become a Khmer noodle wholesaler. He learned his business from his neighbor, while Mrs. Hoeun sells other food produce and also assists him with producing fresh noodles as well. 

Now Chantha is requesting a loan of US$1000 to expand his business of selling fresh noodles.

loans.use: For expanding business of Khmer noodle wholesale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat M., 38, and her husband, Mr. Channy Trok, 38, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1993 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. All of them are in local schools.

Mrs. Sinat has been selling sugar cane juice, soft drinks and plastic covers for books in front of one high school in Phnom Penh for ten years, while Mr. Channy has been a motor taxi driver for over ten years. Both of them earned for living about US$8.67 per day. Now Sinat wants to create another business selling cell phone prepaid cards. She will buy cell phone prepaid cards from the mobile phone company to resell at her shop.

So, she is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase cell phone prepaid cards and some amount for repairing her house.

loans.use: To purchase cell phone’s prepaid card for resale and repair her house.

loans.name: Ugiljon

texts.en: Ugiljon T. lives in  Asht, Tajikistan, and is married with three children.  Her husband works in Russia, and so Ugiljon works alone in the family business of livestock trading.  With five years of experience in this field, she is able to support her family and also manage their collective farm.  Ugiljon is now applying for a loan of $625 for six months to purchase a milk cow and thereby begin to take part in the milk production business.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Yory

texts.en:
Mrs. Yory M., 50, and her husband, Mr. Sean Kroch, 75, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1976 and have six children, one son and five daughters. Two of their daughters are married and live outside the family home. Their son is a construction worker.  Two of the other daughters weave silk at home and the fifth daughter works in a restaurant.

Mrs. Yory has been a silk weaver since 1970, having learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Sean has been a carpenter since he was twenty-four years old.

Now Yory is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk materials for her daughters' weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sevara

texts.en: Sevara M. is 20 years old and married.  Sevara has been an active client of  MicroInvest since 2007, and has had no problems with loan repayments.  Her business provides her with income stability, which thereby allows her to return loans.  Sevara is engaged in her family's business of raising livestock. She has ten years of experience in this  business and developed the necessary  professional skills.  Sevara is now applying for a loan of $775 for eight months to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase another milk cow.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa B. is 36 years old, widowed with 3 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Colobane Fass in Ziguinchor for 2 and a half years. She has always respected her obligations. She would like to buy oil, salt, and other products to make traditional hand-made soap in Ziguinchor for resale at the weekly market in Yarang. Her income will allow her to support her family. Awa is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Awa B., 36 ans, veuve 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Colobane Fass à Ziguinchor depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle respecte ses engagements. Elle veut acheter de l'huile, du sel et autres produits pour préparer du savon artisanal à Ziguinchor et revendre au marché hebdomadaire de Yarang. Ses revenus lui permettent d'entretenir sa famille.Awa sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To produce and sell traditional hand-crafted soap

loans.name: Saro

texts.en:
Mrs. Saro U., 35, and her husband, Mr. Chhengheng Im, 38, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They have been married for sixteen years and have two daughters; one is a silk weaver and the other is in school. 

Mrs. Saro has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Chhengheng has been a carpenter since 2005.

Saro is requesting a loan of US$400 to add to her own money for repairing her house.

loans.use: For repairing her house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy P., 44, and her husband, Mr. Vannoun Moeung, 46, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1986 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Two of their children weave silk at home and the other two are in local schools.

Mrs. Savy has been a silk weaver since 1980, having learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Vannoun has been a policeman since 1989.

Now Savy is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun P., 55, and her husband, Mr. Thaung You, 59, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1970 and have seven children, four sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Two of their children have full time employment. Of the other four children, two are in school and two weave silk at home. They have two looms in the family.

Mrs. Yoeun has been a silk weaver since she was young but now she has stopped weaving and transferred her looms to her daughters (one is shown in the photo), who continue the business of silk production. Now Yoeun sells fish in her village and a nearby village, while Mr. Thaung has been a fisherman since he was seventeen years old.

Now she is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase silk materials for her daughters' weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr:
Oumy Kouyaté is 43 years old, married with 6 children and one other family member in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Colobane Fass in Ziguinchor for 4 years. She runs a business selling thioub (dyed cloth). She supplies herself in Mali and sells her goods in Ziguinchor. With her income, she supports her family and ensures the education of her children. Oumy is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Oumy Kouyaté, 43 ans, mariée, 06 enfants et un autre membre de sa famille en charge est membre du banc villageois de Colobane Fass à Ziguinchor depuis 4 ans. Elle mène une activité de vente de thioub (tissus teintés) .Elle s'approvisionne au Mali pour vendre à Ziguinchor. Avec ses revenus elle entretien sa famille et assure la scolarité des enfants. Oumy sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell dyed cloth

loans.name: Sokkhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokkhoeun S., 44, and her husband, live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1986 and have four children, one son and three daughters. All of their children are in local school. Besides her children, Sokkhoeun's youngest sister lives with her.  Her sister, shown in the photo with her, is a silk weaver. 

Mrs. Sokkhoeun has been a silk weaver for four years, a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while her husband is a policeman in Phnom Penh.

Now she is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk materials for her sister’s loom and hers.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhum S. and her husband, Mr. Thary Dem, live across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2001 and have one daughter. 

Mrs. Sokhum has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Thary has been a carpenter for four years. Now the couple wants to create another business:  purchasing recycling material at their house for resale in Phnom Penh.

So, Sokhum is requesting a loan of US$800 to purchase silk materials for weaving and to buy recycling material for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and buy recycling material for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhum T., 47, and her husband, Mr. Vi Vet, 48, who live across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. All of their children are in school.

Mrs. Sokhum has been selling vegetable and doing farming for eighteen years, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells vegetables at the market in Phnom Penh, which she buys from farmers in her village and some from her own farm. Mr. Vi has been a farmer for eighteen years. He grows papayas, cucumbers, and other kinds of vegetable in his farm a bit far from house. Beside of farming, he also raises cows as well.

Now Sokhum is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase vegetable from farmer in contract and repairing and improving her house.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable from farmer in contract and repairing and improving her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Rose O. is 33 years old and married with one child. She lives in Benin City, where she runs a business selling food and drinks. She studied this trade with her elder sister for two years before opening her own business in 2000. She is requesting a loan  of $450 to buy more food items to cook and sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more food items to cook and sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella A. A. is 30 years old and married with two children. She lives in Benin City, where she makes a living sell food items.  She studied this business for 12 months before opening her store in 2001. She has been active in LAPO for the past five years, and has applied for a loan of $350 to buy more provisions to sell from her store.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell to her customers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria E. is a 50-year-old widow with seven children who lives in Benin City. She has made a living selling firewood since 1980. She buys logs and hires workers to chop them into pieces before selling it as firewood to her customers. She has applied for a loan of $275 to buy more logs to cut up and sell. She has been in LAPO Microfinance customer for five years, and is a dedicated participant in our organization.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience E. is 35 years old and married with six children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria, where she makes a living selling food, drinks and soup. She studied this business for six months before opening her own company in 2002. She has applied for the loan of $450 to buy more provisions, drinks and soup to sell to her her customers. She has been a LAPO client for the last five years.

loans.use: To buy food, drinks and soup to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Mr. M. is a single man who lives in the Som neighborhood in Thies with his parents. His business consists of the purchase and retail sale of spare parts. With this loan, he would like to purchase a large quantity of products to increase his supplies in order to better satisfy his customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr M. est un celibataire qui vit au quartier SOM à THIES chez ses parents. Son activité principale consiste à acheter et revendre au détail des pièces détachées. Avec ce pret il veut acheter des marchandises en quantité pour renforcer son stock pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of spare parts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 48 years old and married with eight children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria, where she has made a living selling firewood since 1984. She learned this trade from her mother. Mary needs a loan of $450 to buy more fire wood to sell. She has been a LAPO client for five years, and wishes to thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more fire wood to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. is 45 years old, married with six children and lives in Benin City, where she owns a restaurant. She studied this business for six months before starting her own company in 1994, and is very dedicated to her work. She has been a LAPO client for nine years, and needs a loan of  $875 to buy more food items and drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more food and drinks to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate E. is 40 years old, married with two children and lives in Benin City, Nigeria, where she makes a living selling groceries. She studied this business for 12 months before opening her store in 1999. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more supplies to sell. She has been a LAPO client for six years.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel O. is 30 years old and married with one child. He lives in Benin City with his family, and has been in the business of selling garri, a popular food, since 2003. He trained in this business for 12 months, and needs a loan of $600 to buy more garri to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more garri, a popular food made from cassava tubers, to sell

loans.name: Mano Amiga Group

texts.en:
Juliana Calcaño is a young mother of two children, ages 7 and 9. In order to spend time with her children while continuing to earn a living, she has opened a small salon in her home. In the Dominican Republic, the women go the salon once a week for a hair wash and straightening. Juliana provides hair services, manicures, and different skin treatments. She sought out Esperanza to acquire a small loan that will allow her to buy more shampoos, conditioners, and nail products. As her business continues to grow, she hopes to employ several other young women to work in her salon alongsiD. her. In her free time, Juliana loves to cook and says that cake is definitely her specialty.

Juliana Calcaño is just one member of the 20 person bank, Mano Amigo. These Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them access to funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the othe members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

On behalf of Juliana, the Mano Amigo group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty that you are helping to solve.

loans.use: To buy more shampoo, conditioner, and nail products for her small salon.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
Elisa is a talented and dynamic young woman with two children, ages two and eight. She lives in the beautiful town of Samana. Elisa wants to start a business selling clothes and shoes with this loan. Elisa is excited to start maK. an income to support her family, and wants to continue expanding her business in the future. With profits from this loan she will be able to buy abetter quality of food for her children and will also have the ability to buy medicine when they are ill. Elisa told us that she loves visiting her church, and her favorite food is “sancocho”, a very popular Dominican soup.

This loan will also go to help fund the businesses of the other group members. In a group loan, each member helps to support and guarantee the loans of the other members.

Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Danialou

texts.fr:
Mr. D. Danialou was born the 31 of december, 1981 in Bafilo in the prefecture of Assoli. He is single and is a tailor and embroderer in the Hédzranawoé, one of the most animated neighbourhoods in Lomé. His main activity is dressmaking and embrodery and the sale of clothing. In his sewing shop called "TOUBA", he welcomes many clients and makes them loyal customers with the new styles he creates regularly. This is his first loan and it will allow him to buy a sewing machine and 23 pieces of cloth.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur D. Danialou est né le 31 décembre 1981 à Bafilo dans la préfecture d’Assoli. Il est célibataire et est un tailleur brodeur dans le quartier Hédzranawoé, l’un des quartiers les plus animés de Lomé. Son activité principale est la couture, la broderie et la vente des habits cousus et brodés. Dans son atelier de couture « TOUBA », il accueille beaucoup de clients et les fidélise avec ses nouvelles modes qu’il crée régulièrement. Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une machine à coudre et 23 pièces de pagne bazin.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine and pieces of cloth

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.en:
Agueda has lived in Samana her entire life. She has two children, ages 6 and 11, and a husband whom she looks after and supports. She already has a small business selling clothing, but she hopes to increase her profits with this loan. She hopes it will proviD. the capital to purchase a larger selection of clothes. She will use this loan to buy pants, skirts, blouses, and other clothing that she knows are in high demand. When Agueda is not working, she attends church services or her weekly bible study. One day she hopes to own a large successful clothing store, and she wants to start making repairs to her home as soon as she makes more money.

This is a group loan. The loan will go to support the business of each person in the group. The members help to guarantee the loan for one another.

Thank you for supporting this group!

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Oasis Group

texts.en:
Angelina T. lives in a small community on the outskirts of Samana, Dominican Republic with her one son Noberto. A seamstress by traD., she sells a combination of clothes that she has maD. herself as well as pre-manufactured clothing to the people in her community. With this loan, she plans to increase her clothing inventory of shirts, pants, skirts, and dresses. Every Thursday, Angelina takes a bus to Santiago, one of the largest cities in the Dominican Republic, where she is able to purchase clothes in bulk for a very good price. When she is not selling clothes, Angelina said that she is usually sewing and enjoying her favorite meal, fish and rice.

Angelina T. is just one member of the 10 person micro-bank, Oasis. These Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access to funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the other members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

On behalf of Angelina, the Oasis group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, pants, skirts, dresses, and sewing materials for her clothing business.

loans.name: Bamba

texts.fr:
Bamba D. is a young husband with no children who lives in the Ablaye Yakhine neighborhood in Thies. He manages a sheet metal workshop, and he earns his living from this business. With this loan, he would like to purchase the materials necessary to properly run his business.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Bamba D. est un jeune marié sans enfant qui vit au quartier Ablaye Yakhine de THIES. Il gère un atelier de tolerie et ses revenus lui permettent de gagner sa vie. Avec ce pret il va acheter du matériel pour mener ses activités correctement.

loans.use: Sheet metal manufacture

loans.name: Mouhamadou Aliou

texts.fr:
Mr. D. is a poultry farmer who lives in the Cite Lamy neighborhood in Thies. He is married and has two children. His business consists of buying chicks that he raises for two months before selling them at the local market. His customers are primarily local restaurants.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

mr D. est un aviculteur qui vit au quartier CITE LAMY à THIES .il est marié et père de deux enfants .son activité consiste à acheter des poussins qu'il élève pendant deux mois avant de les revendre sur le marché local .sa clientèle de base est constituée des restaurants de la place .

loans.use: Poultry farming

loans.name: Jacques Bignane

texts.fr:
Jacques is a young pig farmer who lives in Peycouck Serere, a village located a few kilometers from the city of Thies. He is married and has three children. With this loan, he would like to purchase a few pigs that he will then sell for profit.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Jacques est un jeune éleveur de porc qui vit à PEYCOUCK SERERE dans un village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville de THIES. Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Avec ce pret il veut acheter quelques porcs qu'il va revendre pour réaliser des bénéfices.

loans.use: Pig farming

loans.name: Seydina Oumar

texts.fr:
Seydina is a young businessman who manages a shop in the Medina Falls neighborhood of Thies. He is single and lives with his parents. With this loan, he would like to purchase products to increase his supplies and better meet the demand of his main customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Seydina est jeune commerçant qui gère une boutique au quartier Medina Falls de THIES. Il est célibataire et vit chez ses parents. Avec ce pret il veut acheter des marchandises pour renforcer ses stocks et satisfaire davantage la demande de ses principaux clients.

loans.use: Purchase of products for his store

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Mr. S. is a young metalworker who lives in the HLM Thially housing projects in Thies. He is married but does not yet have any children. With the loan he is requesting, he would like to purchase raw materials to make doors, which he will then sell for a profit.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr S. est un jeune menuisier métallique qui vit au quartier HLM THIALLY à THIES. Il est marié mais n'a pas encore d'enfant. Avec le pret qu'il demande il veut acheter des matières premières pour faire des portes qu'il va revendre afin de réaliser des marges bénéficiaires.

loans.use: Metalwork

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr:
Anna D. is a woman who lives in the HLM Thialy housing projects in Thies. She is married and has three children. In order to increase her income, she is engaged in small-time sales near her home. With this loan, she would like to purchase a large quantity of vegetables that she will then sell to her neighbors for profit.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Anna D. est une femme qui habite au quartier des HLM THIALY à THIES. Elle est mariée et est mère de trois enfants. C'est dans le but d'améliorer ses revenus qu'elle fait du petit commerce près de chez elle. Avec ce pret elle veut acheter des légumes en quantité qu'elle va revendre à ses voisines dans le but de réaliser des bénéfices.

loans.use: Purchase and retail sale of vegetables

loans.name: Mayoro

texts.fr:
Mr. F. is a young businessman who manages a spare parts shop at the bus station in Thies. He is from the Medina Falls neighborhood in Thies. He is married and has one child. He has been a loyal client of the loan association since 2004. In order to increase his income, he is requesting a loan to buy large quantities of spare parts.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr F. est un jeune commerçant qui gère un magasin de pièces détachées à la gare routière de THIES. Il est originaire du quartier MEDINA FALLS de THIES. Il est marié et père d'un enfant. C'est un fidèle client de la mutuelle depuis l'an 2004. C'est dans le but d'améliorer ses revenus qu'il contracte des prets pour acheter des quantités importantes de pièces détachées.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of spare parts

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr:
Mr F. Mawussi was born in 1980 in Lomé. He is married and the father of three children. He sells frozen foods by profession and opened a store for the sale of frozen products in Adétikopé, a village situated 16 Km (10 miles) from Lomé. In this village, the points of sale for this type of product are rare and Mr. F. Mawussi is the first person since 2004 to open this type of store in his village. He has already obtained one loan from the (microcredit group) WAGES and is now asking for his second loan. It will actually allow him to purchase 20 boxes of frozen fish and chickens.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur F. Mawussi est né en 1980 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants. Il est frigoriste de profession et a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits congelés à Adétikopé un village situé à 16 Km de Lomé. Dans ce village les points de vente de ces genres de produits sont rares et monsieur F. Mawussi est la première personne a ouvert ce magasin dans sa localité depuis 2004. Il a une fois obtenu un prêts au près de WAGES et est a son second cycle. Le crédit qu’il sollicite actuellement lui permettra d’acheter 20 cartons de produits congelés (Poissons et poulets).

loans.use: Purchase 20 boxes of frozen foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 40 grams of gold, 40 grams of silver, 10 stones for ladies’ rings, and 20 stones for graduation rings

payments.comment: la  cuota real  es de $ 63.58 dólares

loans.name: Norma Damaris

texts.es:
Young Norma G. E. is 19 years old, is a native of Bluefields, Nicaragua, and is single. For a year has been making a living selling perfumes and other beauty products from the Selsa company.
