This business functions as follows: based on orders, a Selsa company representative sends beauty products to young G. on credit and she is responsible to sell these and to pay for the products, for which they pay her a commission of 30% on the sales. In this way young Norma G. takes home this pay to help with the expenses of the house of her mother, who is a single parent. Nonetheless her main problem is that her clients who are mainly women, buy these products on payment terms (in two and three twice-monthly or monthly payments), thus although G. is selling a lot of products, her commission is small. It should be mentioned that young G. only sells these products since the orders that she makes out are for products ordered in advance and she only needs to deliver them once they are sent to her. It is for this that she needs a loan in order to buy these products which will permit her to make a profit of 60% on each item. She wants to buy: 4 bottles of Ferratt perfume at $10 each, 4 bottles of Mistery perfume at $50 each, 4 bottles of Esse perfume at $15 each, 4 bottles of papaya shampoo at $10 each, 6 containers of hair gel at $13 each, 4 dandruff shampoo at $11 each, 6 ladies’ deodorants at $4 each, and 3 acne lotions at $13 each.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La joven Norma G. E. tiene 19 años de edad, es originaria de Bluefields, es soltera y desde un hace un año se dedica a venderle perfumes y otros productos de belleza a la empresa Selsa. Este negocio funciona de la siguientes manera, una representante de la empresa Selsa le envia en base a solicitud productos de belleza a la joven G. al credito y esta se encarga de venderlo y cobrar el producto por lo cual le pagan una comision del 30 % sobre las ventas. De esta manera la joven Norma G. lleva este pago a su casa para ayudar en los gastos de la casa a su mama que es madre soltera. Sin embargo su problema principale es que sus clientes que son mas del genero femenino le compran estos productos con facilidades de pago (en dos y tres cuotas de pago quincenal y mensual), por lo que aun que vende bastantes productos, su comision es poca. Cabe mencionar que la joven G. vende estos productos ya que los pedidos que realiza son por encargos y solamente tiene que entregarlos una vez que se los envian. Es por esto que requiere de un financiamiento para poder comprar estos productos de los cuales les permite obtener una ganancia hasta del 60% por cada uno. Quiere comprar: 4 perfumes Ferratt a US$ 10 dolares cada uno, 4 perfumes Mistery a US$ 50 dolares cada uno, 4 perfumes Esse a US$ 15 dolares cada uno, 4 shampoo papaya a US$ 10 dolares cada uno, 6 gel para el cabello a US$ 13 dolares cada uno, 4 shampoo para la caspa a US$ 11 dolares cada uno, 6 desodorante para mujeres a US$ 4 dolares cada uno y 3 lociones Acne a US$ 13 dolares cada uno.

loans.use: Purchase 4 bottles of Ferratt perfume, 4 bottles of Mistery perfume, 4 bottles of Esse perfume, 4 bottles of papaya shampoo, 6 containers of hair gel, 4 bottles of dandruff shampoo, 6 ladies’ deodorants, and 3 acne lotions

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 43.75 dólares

loans.name: Yuber

texts.es:
For 16 years, Yuber worked in a restaurant she had in her home. But ever since she was a little girl, she had always wanted to study cosmetology and start up a beauty salon. In 2003, her dream became a reality, and she was able to install a small salon in her house. Even before opening the salon, however, she had clients who sought her out for her services.

Yuber has applied for a loan to buy the supplies she needs for her salon and to buy perfumes and cosmetics which she also offers to the public.

She would like to study physiotherapy and massage therapy, so she can expand her beauty salon into a spa.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Yuber trabajó por 16 años en el restaurante que tenía en su casa. Pero desde que era niña, ella siempre quiso estudiar cosmetología y poner un salón de belleza. Fue así que en el 2003 su sueño se hizo realidad, y pudo instalar una pequeña estética en su casa. Sin embargo, ella tenía clientes que la buscaban por sus servicios antes que abriera la peluquería.

Yuber ha solicitado préstamos para la compra de los materiales que necesita en su peluquería, y para adquirir los perfumes y cosméticos que ella también ofrece a su público.

A ella le gustaría estudiar fisioterapia y masoterapia, para así ampliar su salón de belleza a la categoría de spa.

loans.use: Buy supplies for use in her beauty salon.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
For the past 5 years, Isabel has sold products from the EBEL cosmetics line. Her clients are friends and mothers of children from the school where she works; Isabel is a teacher at the primarly education level. She also places her products in the beauty salon her mother has in her home.

The loans she has requested have been used to buy more products from EBEL.

Isabel´s mother has a beauty salon in her home, and Isabel would like to start up another salon in partnership with her.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel vende productos de la marca de cosméticos EBEL desde hace 5 años. Sus cientes son sus amigos y las madres de familia del colegio donde ella trabaja, ya que Isabel es profesora de Educación Primaria. También coloca sus productos en la peluquería que su mamá tiene en la casa.

Los préstamos que ha pedido han servido para comprar más productos EBEL.

La mamá de Isabel tiene una peluquería en su casa, por lo que a ella le gustaría poner otra peluquería más, en asociación con ella.

loans.use: Purchase more products from the EBEL cosmetics line.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
Obdulia sells clothing by request in the different provinces. Her family is in Huaral and she receives the orders through them. When she travels to distribute the order, she takes advantage of the trip to bring small animals, such as ducks and guinea pigs, back to Lima. Obdulia has worked at this type of business her entire life.

For the past 3 years, she has also been a partner in a computer supplies business that her sister has in central Lima.

The loans she has requested have been used for working capital for her sister´s business and to buy the clothing she sells. Obdulia would like to open a store close to where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Obdulia se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos a provincia. Ella tiene familia en Huaral, por medio de ellos recibe los pedidos. Cuando viaja a repartir los pedidos, ella aprovecha y trae a Lima animales como patos o cuyes. Obdulia ha trabajado toda la vida en este tipo de negocio.

También es socia capitalista del negocio de artículos informáticos que su hermana tiene en el Centro de Lima, desde hace 3 años.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para poner el capital del negocio de su hermana, y para la compra de la ropa que ofrece. A Obdulia le gustaría abrir una tienda cerca de su casa.

loans.use: For working capital and to buy clothing to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela has a sister who for the past 2 years has worked making labels for CDs and DVDs and then selling them wholesale.

She is requesting a loan so that her sister can invest in her business.

Mariela is studying banking administration, and in the future would like to work in a position related to this.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Mariela tiene una hermana que se dedica a mandar a hacer carátulas de CDs y DVDs y venderlas al por mayor, desde hace 2 años.

Ella ha pedido los préstamos para que su hermana pueda invertirlo en su negocio.

Mariela está estudiando administración bancaria, por lo que más adelante le gustaría trabajar en algún negocio referido a su profesión.

loans.use: To invest in a business making labels for CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
For more than 13 years, Marcelina worked at making shoes. There was a lot of competition however, and she had to give up this business.

Three years ago, together with her daughter, she decided to sell music CDs and DVDs as well as to make labels for their storage cases, and to sell these wholesale.

She currently has two sales points in central Lima. Her daughter is in charge of delivering the labels, and she also sends requests to the provinces. The loans she has applied for have been used to pay for printing costs for the labels.

Marcelina would like to have a computer store, which her brother-in-law has told her can be a profitable business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Marcelina trabajó por más de 13 años haciendo zapatos. Sin embargo, había mucha competencia, por lo que tuvo que abandonar ese negocio.

Fue así que hace 3 años, junto con su hija, decidió vender CDs y DVDs de música, así como mandar a hacer las carátulas de los cases de los CDs y ofrecerlos al por mayor.

En la actualidad tiene 2 puestos de venta en el Centro de Lima. Su hija se encarga del reparto de las carátulas. También mandan pedidos a provincia. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para pagar los gastos de imprenta que las carátulas demandan.

A Marcelina le gustaría tener una tienda de computadoras, puesto que su cuñado e ha dicho que es un negocio rentable.

loans.use: Pay for printing expenses for CD and DVD labels.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.en:
Ingrid has one twelve year-old daughter. To support her family, Ingrid owns and works in a small shop selling clothing, shoes and perfume. She struggles with being able to pay the bills because her customers purchase items on credit and then don´t pay her back. She then has to track them down and get the money from them, but sometimes they don´t have enough. Because of this, Ingrid has to take out loans and stay in debt.

Ingrid has had one loan with Esperanza International and successfully paid it back. She is thankful to Esperanza for the opportunity to borrow money at a low interest rate and also to save some money. With the next loan, she hopes her business will one day be debt-free. She aspires to provide her daughter with a great education so that she can become a successful professional. With a proud smile on her face, she said her daughter is a good student.

loans.use: To grow her business and provide for her daughter

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
For the past 20 years, Georgina has sold bread on a corner located near her home. The bread is brought to her house at 5 in the morning and she sells until 10 in the morning.

However, for the past 3 years, Georgina has also sold propane gas from her house. Her clients are her neighbors. Also, about a year ago a friend inspired her to sell natural products from China, which she sells to friends.

The loans she has applied for are for buying the tanks of propane gas which she sells as well as to help out with maintenance costs for the motorcycle taxi her husband works.

Georgina would like to set up a shop for selling the propane gas tanks as she currently works only from home and only with a small quantity of tanks.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Georgina vende pan en una esquina cerca de su casa desde hace 20 años. A las 5 de la mañana le llevan el pan a su casa y ella los vende hasta las 10 de la mañana.

No obstante, hace 3 años Georgina vende gas propano en su casa. Sus clientes son sus vecinos. Asimismo, hace 1 año una amiga la motivó a vender productos naturales chinos, los cuales ofrece a sus amistades.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado han sido para comprar los balones de gas que vende y para ayudar en el mantenimiento mecánico de la mototaxi que su esposo trabaja.

A Georgina le gustaría poner una tienda de balones de gas propano, ya que sólo trabaja en su casa a puerta cerrada y con poca cantidad de balones.

loans.use: To purchase tanks of propane gas for resale and to pay for maintenance costs for a motorcycle taxi.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en: Argentina is the mother of 3 children and several grandchildren.  She owns and operates a beauty salon in her community.  She is diabetic and struggles with getting the medical attention she needs.  She dreams of one day adding a second story to her house.  With the loan money, Argentina plans to grow her business so that she can better take care of herself and pursue her dreams.

loans.use: To grow her beauty salon business and support her family

loans.name: Rossi

texts.es:
Three years ago, Rossi started buying and repairing bedspreads, children´s clothing and sandals. It was her husband who motivated her to start this business. However, she became ill and had to close down the business.

Later on, she began to work for others. Currently Rossi sews backpacks for someone who orders these. She does not sell directly; she only provides this service to the seller.

The loans she is applying for are for her husband, who is a mechanic, so that he can buy auto parts and resell them at his workshop.

Rossi would like to return to doing her business selling and repairing bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Hace tres años, Rossi empezó a dedicarse a la compra y reparto de colchas, ropa para niños y sandalias. Fue su esposo quien le animó a comenzar esta actividad. Sin embargo, ella enfermó por lo que tuvo que dejar este negocio.

Luego, empezó a trabajar para terceras personas. Es así que ahora Rossi cose mochilas que otra persona le encarga hacer. No es vendedora directa, solo ofrece sus servicios al vendedor.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para que su esposo, quién es mecánico, pueda comprar repuestos y venderlos en su taller.

Rossi quisiera regresar al negocio de la venta y reparto de colchas.

loans.use: To buy auto parts for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Two years ago, Josefina learned to make macrame bracelets when a friend showed her how. Even before, she managed to earn money from making similar products; she used to make "binchas" and "correas" (accessories usually worn on the arm or head). Josefina makes 300 macrame bracelets a week. She also orders bracelets from friends who she pays for the work. At the end of the week, Josefina collects 800 to 1000 bracelets which she then delivers to another friend who sells them in Ecuador, Chile and Venezuela.

The loans that Josefina has requested have been used to buy yarn that she's used to make the bracelets. She's also used them to help her husband who sells sneakers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hace dos años, Josefina aprendió a hacer pulseras de hilo porque una amiga le enseñó. Sin embargo, ella siempre se ha dedicado a las manualidades, ya que antes tejía binchas y correas a crochet. Josefina teje 300 pulseras de hilo de macramé a la semana. Pero, ella manda a hacer más pulseras a sus amigas, a quien les paga por esta labor. Al final de la semana, Josefina junta alrededor de 800 y 1000 pulseras, que son entregadas a una amiga quien las vende en Ecuador, Chile y Venezuela.

Los préstamos que Josefina ha pedido le han servido para comprar el hilo que utiliza en la elaboración de las pulseras. Asimismo, para ayudar a su esposo, quien vende zapatillas.

loans.use: Buy materials to make bracelets for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Four years ago, Rosa learned to make macrame bracelets. Now a lady orders 400 bracelets a week from her. She gets the material and sets to work. Rosa used to make a living making and selling bracelets directly, some of which she ordered from her friends, but that didn't work out and she decided to work for someone else.

The loans that she's requested have been used to cover personal expenses such as medicines. Rosa would like to set up a food business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hace 4 años, Rosa aprendió a tejer pulseras de hilo macramé. En la actualidad, una señora le manda a hacer 400 pulseras a la semana. Ella recibe el material y solo pone la mano de obra. Antes Rosa se dedicaba a tejer y vender pulseras al por mayor, por lo que mandaba a hacer pulseras a sus amigas, pero no le fue bien, así que decidió trabajar para terceras personas.

Los préstamos solicitados le han servido para cubrir necesidades personales, como gastos en medicinas. Rosa quisiera instalar un negocio de comida.

loans.use: Cover personal expenses such as medicines.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
For 2 years, Dina has made a living selling Lima-style deserts such as "mazamorras" (a jelly-like desert) and rice pudding. Dina makes the deserts at home every day and then carries them to her small stand in central Lima. She sells to passers-by there from 4 in the afternoon to 11 at night. She used to sell clothes but she switched to selling deserts because the work hours are more flexible and she can more easily care for her family.

The loans that she's received have been used to buy ingredients for the deserts that she makes. Dina would like to have a shop with a kitchen where she could make her deserts and offer a wider variety.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Dina se dedica a la venta de postres limeños, como mazamorras y arroz con leche desde hace 2 años. Todos los días, Dina prepara los postres en su casa, luego se moviliza hasta su pequeño puesto ubicado en el centro de Lima. Allí vende al público transeúnte desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche. Antes ella vendía ropa, pero se animó a vender estos postres debido al horario de trabajo, que es más flexible, y para poder así atender a su familia.

Los préstamos recibidos le han servido para la compra de ingredientes de los postres que prepara. A Dina le gustaría tener un local con cocina donde pueda preparar sus postres y así ofrecer más variedades.

loans.use: Buy materials for sweets business.

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en: Valelia is a very active woman who puts all of her abilities towards her business, because it is her family's major source of income. She decided to her loan partly for business equipment, such as chemicals, fertilizer and a sprayer, and partly for her home repairs and tools, including an axe, bricks, cement, nails and a hammer.

loans.use: To buy farming and home-repair supplies

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
For 3 years, Mercedes has worked as a street vendor selling snacks in central Lima. She used to make a living making macrame bracelets at home, but she began working as a street vendor because it provided her with a daily income. She works from 9 in the morning to 9 at night. Even so, she still makes her bracelets late at night or on days that she doesn't go out to work as a street vendor. She makes 50 bracelets a day.

The loans that she has requested have gone to buying the snacks that she resells or for thread that she uses to make the bracelets. Mercedes would like to set up a snackbar in her house but she wants to continue making bracelets, as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 3 años, Mercedes vende golosinas en el centro de Lima de forma ambulatoria. Antes de dedicaba íntegramente al tejido de pulseras de macramé en su casa, sin embargo, empezó a vender en las calles, ya que esta actividad le da ganancias diarias. Trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. No obstante, Mercedes aún continúa tejiendo sus pulseras por las noches, o los días que no sale a vender. Diariamente teje 50 pulseras.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar más golosinas e hilo para tejer las pulseras. A Mercedes le gustaría poner una bodega en su casa, pero sin descuidar el tejido de pulseras.

loans.use: Buy snacks for resale and materials for making products for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga sell herbs, spices and home-made "guisantes en pasta" (a local pasta dish made with peas). She used to work as a street vendor selling sandwiches. A friend showed her how to make guisantes en pasta and, for the last year, she's been making and selling it in a market near her house. She works from 8 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon.

The loans that she's applied for have helped her set up her business. Dominga would like to expand the business and offer new products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Dominga vende hierbas, especias y guisantes en pasta hechos de forma casera. Antes, ella vendía sándwiches de forma ambulatoria. Pero una amiga le enseñó a hacer los guisantes en pasta, por lo que desde hace 1 año vende estos productos en el mercado que está cerca de su casa. Trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para implementar su puesto. A Dominga le gustaría aumentar el stock de ventas y ofrecer nuevos productos.

loans.use: Develop food business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.es:
Years ago, Gerarda made weird and wonderful earrings which she then sold. Her business ultimately failed, however, which led her to look at other ways to make a living. That's how she came, 10 years ago, to setting up a business making clothing for kids. She has two sewing machines and a "remalladora" (a specialist sewing machine) at her house. She sells the clothes that she makes in a market near her house. She also makes wool hats.

Her husband lives in Cajamarca and he still has a machine for making earrings. Gerarda sends materials for making earrings to him there and he turns them into products that he ultimately sells. Gerarda also goes once a month to Pucalipa where she sells second hand merchandise--cookware, toys, etc.--that she buys in Lima. She's been doing this for 8 years.

The loan that Gerarda has requested will be used to buy materials that her husband needs to make earrings. Gerarda would also like to have a "recubridora" (a specialist sewing machine) to improve her clothes-making business. She'd also like to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hace 16 años, Gerarda fabricaba aretes de fantasía por mayor. Sin embargo, el negocio no fue bien y quebró, por lo que tuvo que evaluar nuevas posibilidades de trabajo. Fue así que Gerarda desde hace 10 años se dedica a la costura de ropa de niños. Ella tiene dos máquinas de coser y una remalladora en su casa. La ropa que fabrica la vende en el mercado que está cerca de su casa. También teje sombreros de lana.

Su esposo vive en Cajamarca y él aún conserva una máquina que suelda aretes, por lo que Gerarda le manda los materiales allá y él se encarga de soldarlos y venderlos. Asimismo, Gerarda viaja una vez al mes a Pucallpa a vender cosas de segunda mano, como ollas, muñecas, etc. que compra en Lima. Desde hace 8 meses se dedica a esta actividad.

Los préstamos que ella ha pedido le han servido para comprar los materiales que su esposo necesita en la elaboración de los aretes. Gerarda quisiera tener una máquina recubridora para perfeccionar sus costuras. También, le gustaría mejorar su casa.

loans.use: Buy materials to make earrings.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sinaua

texts.en: Sinaua is a 25-year-old woman from the village of Afega. She is experienced in Samoan elei printing, which she does to help her family earn more money to afford food. She enjoys this creative hobby of hers, which is now turning into a profit-making business. She is glad to get the financial help, with which she will buy the supplies needed (paints, raw materials and carved wood designs) to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy printing supplies

loans.name: Feoonuu

texts.en: Feoonuu is an experienced businesswoman. She has fully engaged in running her business so that she will meet the needs of the customers everyday. The business is her major financial support. She will use the loan to buy a freezer, plus sugar, rice, salt, lamp chops and chicken thighs.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and more food stock

loans.name: Faamanu

texts.en: Faamanu is on her fourth loan now. This goes to show that she is a determined woman who is working hard to try and earn more money to take care of her family. She will use her loan partly for home repairs (by purchasing nails, iron and cement) and partly to improve her business by purchasing barbed wire and seeds for tomatoes, cabbages and pumpkins.

loans.use: To buy seeds and make home repairs

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun T., 54, and her husband, Mr. Khum Moun, 55, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1972 and have seven children, three sons and four daughters. Five of their children are married, four of whom live outside the family home. Of the other two children, one weaves silk at home and the other is a construction worker.

Mrs. Sokhoeun has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old, a skill she learned from her aunty. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Khum has been growing rice since 1980.

Now Sokhoeun is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Sady

texts.en:
Mrs. Sady U., 58, is a widow with five children and lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Of the other four children, two weave silk at home, one is a construction worker, and the other one attends a local school.

Mrs. Sady has been a silk weaver since 1965, having acquired the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthea U., 44, is a widow with one son and three daughters, who lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. The other three children live under her custody, in school or assisting her in doing farming.

Mrs. Kunthea has been farming since 1998. She grows jasmine flowers and bananas on the farm near her home. Beside doing farming, she also sells jasmine flowers and bananas at the market in Phnom Penh. Some she buys from farmers in the village for resale; some are from her own farm.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 500 to purchase jasmine flowers from farmers on contract. She needs to pay money to the farmers first before the harvest season.

loans.use: To purchase jasmine flowers from farmers on contract

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sam-Ul

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-ul U., 46, and her husband, Mr. Chouheang Chum, 58, who live on an island in the Mekong River aboU. fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have eight children, four sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Of the other five children, four are in local schools and the other is a security guard in Phnom Penh.

Sam-ul has been a silk weaver since 1996, a skill she learned from her sister-in-law. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Chouheang has been doing farming since 1979. He grows ginger and corn in the farm not far from their home.

Now Sam-ul is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov Y., 50, and her second husband, Mr. Hoy Hai, 54, who live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1992 and have three children, one son and two daughters. Two of their children are in local school and the eldest daughter is the commune’s secretary.

Nov has been selling sesame for five years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She buys sesame from farmers in her village for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. Mr. Hoy has been a motor taxi driver for fifteen years.

Now Nov is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase sesame from farmers for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sesame for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hai Gam A 2021-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Leya S.. She is currently in the business of selling beans and Irish potatoes to a hotel and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Leya is 38 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has 2 children ranging from age 5 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Leya makes approximately 75 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Leya is joined in her small group by Lucia A., Flora J., Margret J., and Veronica P.. Lucia A. has a business in selling bread and wants to expand her business. Flora J. is currently operating a business in selling bamboo at the market and wants a loan to stock more bamboo. Margret J. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to initiate a bar for beer. Victoria P. is currently in the business of selling charcaol and is requesting a loan to build a shop.

loans.use: Expand her food selling business

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhim Y. and her husband, Mr. Mit Mao,  who live across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for twenty years and have six children, one son and five daughters. Their oldest daughter is a garment worker and the other five children are in local schools. 

Sokhim has been selling rice for ten years.  She buys rice from the market for resale in her village. Mr. Mao is a carpenter. The couple hopes that their business will be able to support their children to study up to as high a level as possible.

So, Sokhim is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase rice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun T., 29, and her husband, Mr. Sek Nao, 32, who live across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have one daughter, who is in local school.

Sokhoeun has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned from a villager, and Mr. Sek is a silk weaver as well, a skill he learned from his wife. The couple sells their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Now Sokhoeun is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mr. Hai H., 51, and his wife, Mrs. Nary Mai, 51, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have eight children, four sons and four daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home. The other three children are in local school.

Hai has been in the business of wooden house building for two years. It’s a skill he learned from his neighbor. Before doing this business, he was a mason. His wife was a craft weaver, but now she is a housewife and takes care of the children.

Hai is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a construction crane for use in his business.

loans.use: To purchase a construction crane for use in the business of wooden home building

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Mr. Sokheang K., 27, and his wife, Mrs. Nara Sem, 37, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have two sons, who are in school.

Sokheang has been raising pigs since 2005, a skill he learned from his neighbor. Besides raising pigs, he also does construction work. His wife Nara has been a silk weaver since 2000, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Sokheang is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase feed for raising pigs.

loans.use: To purchase feed for raising pigs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mr. Yorn L., 35, and his wife, Mrs. Ros Seng, were married in 2002. They have one son, who is in school. The family lives along National Road Number Five about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Yorn has been in the business of renting out his motor remorque and musical instruments for six years. A remorque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back. He rents his motor remorque to his nephew to use as a taxi and rents out musical instruments to villagers in his village and the nearby province. His wife, Ros, has been selling vegetables at Prek Phnao market since 1981.

Now Yorn is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to repair his motor remorque and purchase some musical instruments to rent to villagers.

loans.use: To repair his Motor Remorque taxi and purchase musical instruments to rent out to villagers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mr. Socheat S., 26, and his wife, Mrs. Sokha Bou, were married in 2004. They have one daughter. The couple lives with their parents along National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Socheat has been a motor remorque driver for two years. A remorque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back. Before he started this business, he was a security guard. He carries people from his village to Phnom Penh, while his wife Sokha has been a garment worker for four years.

Socheat is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a new trailer to replace the old one for his motor remorque taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer to replace his old one for his Motor Remorque taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorn T. is a divorcee who lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has five children, two sons and three daughters. Four of her children are married; two of them live outside the family home and other two live with her. The youngest one is in school.

Mrs. Lorn has been employed doing farming for ten years. She is employed growing rice and planting vegetables in the farms around her village. Now, she is requesting a loan of US$ 150 to purchase a bicycle for her son to ride to school.

loans.use: To purchase a bicycle for her son to ride to school

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sam-Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-un E. and her husband, Mr. Dara Los, who live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1989 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives in the family home. Of the other three children, two are in school and one is a garment worker.

Mrs. Sam-un and her husband have been selling fish for many years. They buy fish from the village market to sell at Takmao market, traveling by motorcycle. Now their motorcycle is very old and they are short some money to buy a new motorcycle to replace the old one, so Sam-un is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 900 to purchase a new motorcycle to transport their fish to market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use to sell fish

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kimhoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimhoun C., 57, and her husband, Mr. Vandy Ou, 67, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1960 and have six children, one son and five daughters. Two of their children are married; one of these lives in the family home, selling French sandwiches and soft drinks in front of the house. Of the other four children, two weave silk at home, one has full-time employment in Phnom Penh, and other one is a hairdresser.

Mrs. Kimhoun has been a silk weaver for ten years, having acquired this skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business and for her daughter to expand her business selling French sandwiches and soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and expand business selling French sandwiches and soft drinks

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio A. Mollinedo lives with his wife, Anastacia León, in his own home in the Sopocachi zone in the city of La Paz. Eusebio works for a construction company in the city and his wife has a general store in their home.

With prior loans, he built the foundation and main part of his home, and currently he is finishing some of the rooms as well as a small store for the property. The loan he is requesting is to build and finish two rooms on the second floor.

This is the fifth loan he has applied for and the second through Kiva. An analysis rates the loan request favorably.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Eusebio A. Mollinedo vive en casa propia, en la zona de Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Anastacia León. El señor Eusebio es empleado en una empresa constructora de la ciudad y su esposa tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio.

Con anteriores créditos realizó la construcción de su vivienda en obra gruesa y actualmente realiza la construcción de las habitaciones en obra fina, así como la tiendita de su propiedad. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de dos habitaciones en planta alta.

Esta es la quinta vez que solicita préstamo y será la segunda vez a través de Kiva. El análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Build 2 rooms on the second floor of his home.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy C. lives with his wife, Simona Cuppi, and their two children in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. Freddy is a public transportation driver in La Paz and his wife sews children´s clothing which she sells in the market.

With his prior loans, he built a retaining wall in front of his home, as required by the city government in order to make improvements to the neighborhood.

The loan he is requesting will be for building a room to be used as a general store, which will generate extra income for the family. This is the sixth time he has applied for a loan and the second time through Kiva. An analysis has favorably rated this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Freddy C. vive en casa propia, en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Simona Cuppi y sus dos hijos. El señor Freddy es chofer del transporte publico de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa es costurera realizando ropa de niños que vende en las ferias populares

Con anteriores créditos realizó la construcción de muro de contención en la parte frontal

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación que será utilizada como tienda para generar un ingreso mas para su familia. Esta es la sexta vez que solicita préstamo y la segunda a través de Kiva. El análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Build a room to be used as a grocery store in order to increase his income.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Lupe S. lives in her own home in the Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband, Mario Chavarria, and their three children. Lupe is a domestic employee and works in a private home and her husband works for the local government .

The family is going through a difficult situation and are recovering from the death of their oldest daughter from illness, for which there were medical expenses.

The loan she is requesting will be used to build stairs to access the two levels of her home, as currently there are only very weak wooden steps.

This is the third time she has asked for a loan and an analysis has rated her request favorably.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lupe S. vive en casa propia en la zona de Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Mario Chavarria y sus tres hijos. La señora Lupe es empleada domestica en un domicilio particular y su esposo trabaja en la administración publica del departamento.

La familia atraviesa una situación delicada ya que se reponen del fallecimiento de su hija mayor por enfermedad, lo que ocasionó gastos médicos.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de gradas para el acceso a dos niveles en su domicilio, ya que cuentan solo con gradas precarias de madera.

Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Build stairs to be able to access the 2 floors of her home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda opened her general store 10 years ago. At first she only sold beer and soft drinks. Later on she began expanding her stock. Now her general store offers candy, supplies, fruit, and decorations, in addition to other basic products. She also makes bracelets and earrings, which she offers at her store.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more goods for her business.

Nilda would like to acquire a new display case so she can increase her selection of goods and sell gifts at the store.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Nilda abrió su bodega hace 10 años. Al comienzo, solo ofrecía cervezas y gaseosas, luego fue ampliando su stock de ventas. Ahora tiene una bodega surtida donde vende golosinas, víveres, frutas, adornos, entre otros productos básicos. Ella también hace pulseras y aretes a mano, los cuales ofrece al público en su tienda.

Ha solicitado préstamos para poder invertir en la compra de más mercadería para el negocio.

A Nilda le gustaría adquirir una nueva vitrina para poder aumentar su oferta y vender regalos en su tienda.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Group members would like to purchase seeds, fertilizers and hire labor to assist in the farm.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds and hire labour

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.es:
Vidalina, Julia and Glendise belong to the Tulips Communal Bank.

Vidalina is a single mother. She is 34 years old and has 2 children. Vidalina sells clothes on credit. She carries out her sales with friends and family. Vidalina plans to partner with her sister to make articles of clothing. Sometimes Vidalina works in the country at harvest time.

On the other hand, Julia is a single mother and she is 52 years old. Julia sells chicha de jora (a traditional beverage made from corn) and chicha de 7 semillas (a traditional beverage made from diverse grains). She sells her product in the doorway of her home. In addition Julia sells delicacies.

Meanwhile Glendise is married. She is 37 years old and has 3 children. Glendise travels to the different open-air markets of the region 2 times a week where she buys grains and cheeses that she sells door to door.

Vidalina, Julia and Glendise need a loan of 1000 soles each, money that will be invested in the purchase of fabrics, rubber bands, delicacies, cheese, grains and 2 showcases for their products.

The dreams of Vidalina, Julia and Glendise are to build their own houses, to have a stable store and to expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Vidalina, Julia y Glendise pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tulipanes.

Vidalina es madre soltera, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Vidalina vende ropa a crédito, sus ventas los realiza a amigos y familiares, Vidalina tiene proyectado asociarse con su hermana para confeccionar prendas de vestir. Algunas veces Vidalina trabaja en el campo en época de cosecha.

Por otro lado Julia es madre soltera y tiene 52 años, Julia vende chicha de jora (bebida típica elaborada de maíz) y chicha de 7 semillas (bebida típica elaborada de diversos cereales), sus ventas los realiza en la puerta de su vivienda, además Julia vende golosinas.

Mientras que Glendise es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Glendise viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 2 veces por semana de donde compra cereales, quesos que vende de casa en casa.

Vidalina, Julia y Glendise necesitan un préstamo de 1000 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas, ligas, golosinas, queso, cereales y 2 exhibidores para sus productos.

Los sueños de Vidalina, Julia y Glendise son construir su casa, tener una tienda estable y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, rubber bands, sweets, cheese and grains as well as 2 showcases for their products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rosas Group

texts.es:
The Banco Comunal Rosas is a group that was recently started with 26 associates.

The group's members run different kinds of businesses such as selling groceries, cheese, drinks, clothing, candy, food, vegetables, arts and crafts, hardware, juices and young animals. They sell their wares from their homes or by traveling door-to-door.

The members need different loan amounts: some of 300 soles, 600 soles, 1,000 soles, making a total loan of 13,600 soles.

These loans will be invested in the purchases of rice, sugar, oil, meat, fruit, gas, pants, sweaters, cassocks, cheeses, tomatoes, onions, cookies, chocolates, and crafts.

The members' dreams are to build houses, establish businesses, proviD. an education to their children, and be professional.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Rosas, es un Banco que recién inicia con 26 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como venta D. abarrotes, quesos, bebidas, ropa, golosinas, comida, verduras, artesanía, artículos D. ferretería, elaboración D. jugos y animales menores. Sus ventas lo realizan en sus domicilios, ambulatoriamente y reparten a domicilio.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 13,600 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, carne, frutas, gaseosas, pantalones, chompas, casacas, quesos, tomate, cebolla, galletas, chocolates y artesanías.

Los sueños D. las socias son construir su casa, establecer su negocio, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y sean profesionales.

loans.use: These loans will be invested in the purchases of rice, sugar, oil, meat, fruit, gas, pants, sweaters, cassocks, cheeses, tomatoes, onions, cookies, chocolates, and crafts.

loans.name: Lilliam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lilliam U. is 28 years old and lives in Ticuantepe in the city of Managua. This area is characterized as being one of the greatest pineapple and pitahya (a cactus fruit) producing regions. For ten years, Lilliam has been one of the many people dedicated to the cultivation of pineapples. Lilliam is married and her husband works in a chicken farm. She has two school-age children. The other commercial activity that she is dedicated to is tortilla making. She has one and half blocks of land of pineapple, to which she needs to give the necessary attention. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase agricultural inputs so that she may enjoy a good harvest. She hopes that, one day, she will be able to obtain enough income to improve her production as much in quality as in quantity.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Lilliam U. tiene 28 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, de la ciudad de Managua. Este municipio se caracteriza por ser uno de los mayores productores de piña y pitahya del país. Lilliam es una de las tantas personas que se dedica a la cultivación de piñas des de hace 10 años. Lilliam es casada su esposo trabaja en una empresa productora de pollo, tiene 2 hijos los cuáles están en edad escolar. La otra actividad comercial a la que se dedica es a la elaboración de tortillas . Tiene una y media manzana de tierra de piñas, a las cuales necesita darle el mantenimiento necesario, por loq ue solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para poder obtener su cosecha en buen estado. Espera algun día poder obtener los ingresos suficientes para poder mejorar su producción tanto en calidad, como en cantidad.

loans.use: Acquire agricultural inputs for her harvest.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
Maria Lecrecia is 40 years old. Seven years ago, she started selling different products such as clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She sells these items on credit as well as for cash by going door-to-door. She also sells out of her home. She started the business with clothing, however, gradually she increased her product variety. Maria Lucrecia lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She is married and has one 11-year-old child. Her husband is a carpenter and together they bear the responsibility of getting their family ahead. The plans that she has for her family are to improve their housing conditions. She needs a loan in order to increase her sales volume and generate more income which will allow her to improve her home in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria Lucrecia tiene 40 años de edad, desde hace 7 años se dedica a la comercialización de diversos productos como lo son ropa, zapatos, cosméticos. Los cuales los vende al crédito y también al contado, de forma ambulante y también otra parte la tiene en su casa de habitación. El negocio lo inició con la venta de ropa, pero poco a poco fue incrementando la variedad de productos que oferta. Doña Maria Lucrecia habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada y tiene un hijo de 11 años. Su esposo es carpintero y juntos llevan la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a su familia. Los planes que ella tiene para su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. El préstamo lo requiere para incrementar el volumen de sus ventas y así generar más ganacias, que le permitan en un fufturo crecano poder mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shoes to sell to her customers.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo is 46 years old and lives in the Jonathan Gonzalez neighborhood. He is married and has three children, only one of whom is independent while the others are in his care. His wife washes and irons clothes so that she can help her husband with the living expenses. Leonardo has five years experience working as a security guard for a private company. His dream is to be able to give his children a better quality of life, as well as provide them with a university education, which they will need. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase construction materials to build a wall behind his home, which will provide greater security to his belongings.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Leonardo tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Jonathan González, es casado y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales uno es independiente a ellos, y tiene a su cargo a los dos menores. Su esposa se dedica a lavar y planchar ropa, para poder apoyar a su marido en los gastos del hogar. Don Leonardo tiene 5 años de desempeñarse como guarda de seguridad en una empresa privada. Sus sueño es poder darle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos, así como también poder darles la educación universitaria que van a necesitar. Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro, necesario para la parte delantera de su vivienda, para darle mayor seguridad a sus pertenencias.

loans.use: Build a wall behind his home.

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.es:
Bertha E. has dedicated herself, with much sacrifice, to her small mom-and-pop shop. She has owned this San Rafael del Sur business for four years and she enthusiastically attends to her customers.

Her store is the only fountain of income that she has to support her two school-age children. For this reason, upon exhausting her inventory, she is looking for support from Ceprodel so she can be the beneficiary of a loan and stock up. Today, it should be noted that thanks to the support of Ceprodel she has been able to improve her business having acquired merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bertha E. se dedica con mucho sacrificio a su pequeño negocio de pulpería el cual posee desde hace cuatro años en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur donde atiende con mucho entusiasmo a sus clientes.

Su pulpería es la única fuente de ingreso que ella posee con el cual mantener a sus dos hijos en edad escolar es por este motivo que al estar agotándose el inventario busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería. Hoy en día es necesario destacar que gracias al apoyo proporcionado por Ceprodel ha logrado mejorar su negocio habiendo adquirido su mercadería.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Felipe Antonio

texts.es:
Felipe V. lives in the 3-80 neighborhood in the city of Managua. He is 45 years old and is married with three daughters, all of whom are young. His wife is in charge of taking care of the home and of his daughters. Felipe is a taxi driver. Previously, he was a taxi driver, however, he worked for another person. Gradually, he saved money until he could obtain his own vehicle which he now uses for his job. Felipe's dream is one day to estalish a "mom-and-pop" store in his house, which would be managed by his wife. But first, he needs to establish the necessary conditions for this to happen. He needs a loan so that he can raise the roof of his house to a higher height.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Felipe V. habita en el barrio 3-80 de la ciudad de Managua. Tiene 45 años, es casado, con 3 hijas, todas menores de edad. Su esposa es quien se encarga el cuido de su casa y de sus tres hijas. Don Felipe es taxista, anteriormente era chofer de taxi, es decir que laboraba para otra perosna, pero poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta que pudo obtener su propio vehículo el cual utiliza para su trabajo. El sueño de Don Felipe es poder algún dia poner una pulpería en su casa de habiatción para que esta pueda ser administrada por su esposa, pero primero dará las condiciones necesarias para qeu esto suceda. Requiere el préstamo para poderseguir levantando a una mayor altura el techo de su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Increase the height of his house's roof.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos P. is a gentleman whose business is carpentry. He has been dedicated to this work for eight years during which he has acquired enough experience that he can create all types of furniture, such as beds, wardrobes, doors, cradles, etc.

Currently, Mr. P. is father to three school-age children who have benefited from their studies thanks to their hard work and desire to get ahead. Today, the Pichardos are looking for a way to improve their economic situation and the business needs an investment in more wood so that Carlos can make more furniture. For this reason, he has applied to Ceprodel for a loan so that he may purchase raw materials and continue his work as always.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos P. es un caballero cuyo negocio es la carpintería el cual se dedica a esta labor desde hace ocho años habiendo adquirido basta experiencia en esta labor ya que realiza todo tipo de muebles como camas, roperos, puertas, cunas de niños, etc.

Actualmente el caballero P. es padre de tres hijos en edades escolares los cuales ha beneficiado con los estudios gracias a su arduo trabajo y ganas de salir adelante. Hoy en día ha buscado la manera de mejorar su situación económica y el negocio requiere la inversión en madera para realizar los muebles. Es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de su materia prima y así continuar en su labor como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.

loans.use: Purchase wood.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Freddy Salvador

texts.es:
Fredy O. is a gentleman from the municipality of San Rafael del Sur and owns a carpentry business, which he runs from his home where his clients visit him. He specializes in woodwork, and has created a name for himself by making different kinds of fine furniture as well as any other type of wooden items requested by his clients.

He has been carrying out this activity with the sole purpose of subsisting and maintaining his family which consists of his wife and two children, whom he must support. Currently, he is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to purchase lumber as the prime material for his business. It is necessary to point out that to date, he has received a total of four loans, all of which have been repaid in timely fashion and in the manner established by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Fredy O. es un caballero del municipio de San Rafael del Sur el cual se dedica al negocio de la carpintería el cual atiende en su propia casa de habitación a sus clientes que le visitan. Él es especialista en el trabajo con la madera y se ha destacado por hacer diferentes tipos de muebles finos y además cualquier otro tipo de artículo de madera solicitado por el cliente.

Se ha desempeñado a esta labor con el único fin de subsistir y además de mantener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos a los que tiene el deber de mantener. Actualmente solicita crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de la madera como materia prima para el negocio. Es necesario destacar que hasta hoy posee un total de cuatro créditos todos pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido con la institución.

loans.use: Purchase lumber for his carpentry business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria M. L. is a native of the municipality of San Rafael del Sur and owns a small grocery store, which she runs from her humble home to support her three small children, whom she has to maintain being that they are still minors.

Her dreams since she started the grocery store have been to improve her social status and project her business to the community, and for this reason she has been investing through the years in improving her locale. Today, as her inventory diminishes, she looks for support in Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will enable the purchase of merchandise to stock her shelves and sell them in her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Gloria M. L. es originaria del municipio de San Rafael del Sur y se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en su humilde casa de habitación en apoyo de sus tres pequeños hijos los cuales ella tiene la obligación de mantener por ser menores de edad.

Sus sueños desde que inició el negocio de la pulpería han sido mejorar su status social y proyectar su negocio a la comunidad, es por ello que a través de los años ha venido invirtiendo para mejorar su local. Hoy en día al estar agotándose su inventario busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de la mercadería para surtir sus estantes y así comercializarlos en su negocio de pulpería.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio E. owns a small grocery store, which he runs from his own home in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. For a long time now, this gentleman has been working with great effort to make his business succeed and manage to survive to take this welfare to his humble home.

For this reason, his concern has always been in finding a way to make his business successful, and thus has received loans from Ceprodel that have helped him in the improvement of his business.

Today, he trustingly waits to receive this loan so he may continue to offer his family the best living conditions possible.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor José Antonio E. es un caballero que se dedica al negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur donde posee su establecimiento. Es una caballero que por mucho tiempo se ha venido esforzando grandemente para salir adelante en su negocio y lograr sobrevivir para llevar el bienestar a su humilde hogar de habitación.

Por este motivo es que su preocupación siempre ha sido buscar la manera de cómo salir adelante en el negocio y por dicha razón ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel los cuales le han ayudado en el mejoramiento de su negocio.

Hoy en día espera confiadamente en que su crédito sea otorgado para así continuar brindándole las mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Luis José

texts.es:
For16 years in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in the city of Managua Señor Luis A. has been dedicated to his vehicles workshop business in his own location where he attends very kindly to his clients that visit him in their sector. He is a very industrious gentleman that seeks the way to do well in his business, to offer better conditions for study to his three small children that need him so much.

At present, he has applied to Ceprodel to obtain the necessary loan for the improvement of his business through the purchase of tools and the improvement of the work location. For this reason he has applied to Ceprodel to obtain the loan in order to get ahead in his business that so much needs an immediate investment.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 16 años en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en la ciudad de Managua el señor Luis A. se dedica a su negocio de taller de vehículos en su propia localidad el cual atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que le visitan en su sector. El es un caballero muy esforzado que busca la manera de salir adelante en su negocio para brindarle las mejores condiciones de estudio a sus tres pequeños hijos que tanto necesitan de él.

Actualmente, ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la mejora de su negocio por medio de la compra de herramientas y mejora del local de trabajo. Por esta razón es que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión inmediata.

loans.use: To buy tools for his mechanic shop and to improve his workshop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
The sale of shellfish is the activity to which señora Maria del Socorro Gómez is very vigorously dedicated. She lives in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, Nicaragua. She has carried out her sales for over eight years and this has permitted her to maintain her family nucleus composed of herself and her two small children of school age.

It is very important to emphasize that since she start her business she has sold on foot along the streets of her community, but as time has elapsed she managed to improve her business by obtaining a cooler where she stores her shellfish. This achievement has been thanks to the support of Ceprodel, which has supplied her with loans which she has utilized for the improvement of her business. Currently she requests one more loan for the purchase of shellfish such as fish, shrimp, crabs, etc. in order to market them.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de mariscos es la actividad a la que muy esforzadamente se dedica la señora Maria del Socorro Gómez en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua Nicaragua. Su actividad la realiza desde hace más de ocho años y esta le ha permitido mantener su núcleo familiar compuesto por ella y sus dos pequeños hijos en edades escolares.

Es de mucha importancia destacar que ella desde que inicio su negocio vendía ambulante por las calles de su comunidad pero a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido ella logró mejorar obteniendo una mantenedora donde almacena sus mariscos. Estos logros los ha tenido gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel el cual le ha proporcionado créditos los cuales los ha utilizado para la mejora de su negocio. Hoy en día solicita una vez mas para la compra de los mariscos como peces, camarones, cangrejos, etc. para comercializarlos.

loans.use: To buy shellfish for resale.

loans.name: Mariluz Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mariluz Sánchez is a lady that is dedicated to her clothes sale business in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. She sells all kinds of clothes for ladies, gentlemen and children in all sizes, offering pants, shirts, blouses, etc.

She is a lady with the responsibility for maintaining her two children, offering them the necessary conditions so that they can study. Since her business was initiated, she has always sought the way to get ahead and in this she has been supported by Ceprodel which has offered her loans which she has invested in the purchase of merchandise to market in her business. Once more today she requests a loan for the purchase of clothes in order to offer them to the clients that visit her.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariluz Sánchez es una dama que se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur. Vende todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños en todas las medidas, ofreciendo pantalones, camisas, blusas, etc.

Es una dama con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos brindándoles las condiciones necesarias para que puedan estudiar. Desde que su negocio fue iniciado, siempre ha buscado la manera de cómo salir adelante y para ello se ha apoyado de Ceprodel el cual le ha otorgado créditos los cuales los ha invertido en la compra de la mercadería para comercializarla en su negocio. Una vez más hoy solicita un crédito para la compra de la ropa y así ofrecerla a sus clientes que le visiten.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maura Del Carmen

texts.es:
Señora Maura Sánchez has been characterized as being a lady that for several years has been dedicated to the making of bread. She attends a small bakery in the house where she lives,where she makes loaves of bread in small quantities to manage to maintain her small children, ensuring that they do not lack for food or education.

As every developing business, the small bakery business of Señora Maura requires investment in the purchase of merchandise. It is for this reason that Ceprodel has supported her for the purchase of her commodities for baking of the bread. At this time she once more applies to request a loan for the purchase of materials and in this manner to continue maintaining her children that so much need their beloved mother.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maura Sánchez se ha caracterizado por ser una dama que desde hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración de pan en su casa de habitación donde atiende una pequeña panadería el cual elabora panes en pocas cantidades para lograr mantener a sus pequeños hijos procurando que no les falte el alimento ni los estudios.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, el negocio de la pequeña panadería de la señora Maura requiere de inversión en la compra de su mercadería es por esta razón que Ceprodel le ha apoyado para la compra de su materia prima para elaboración del pan. Hoy en día una vez mas acude para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la materia prima y de esta manera continuar manteniendo a sus hijos que tanto necesitan de su querida madre.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making bread.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mevis Nubia

texts.es:
Mevis G. is a lady that several years ago, upon seeing the economic need that she faced, decided to invest her own savings in the purchase of products in small quantities to market in the home where she lives in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua.

Nowadays, several years have elapsed and she has gone on improving the condition of her business. She has sought the support of Ceprodel through loans to manage to acquire her merchandise to market in the sector where she lives in her small store. It is necessary to mention that this is the only living by which she is supported - both to subsist and also for maintaining the humble house where she lives. At present her credit record includes six loans with Ceprodel, all having been repaid without delay.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Mevis G. es una dama que desde hace varios años al ver la necesidad económica que atravesaba decidió invertir sus propios ahorros en la compra de productos en pequeñas cantidades para comercializarlos en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.

Hoy en día al haber transcurrido los años y haber ido mejorando la condición de su negocio, ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel por medio de los créditos para lograr adquirir su mercadería para comercializarla en su sector de habitación en su pequeña pulpería. Es menester mencionar que este es el único sustento con el cual ella se apoya para subsistir y además para el sustento de su humilde casa de habitación. Actualmente su record crediticio es de seis créditos con Ceprodel habiendo sido todos cancelados sin ningún atraso en sus cuotas.

loans.use: To buy merchendise for her store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ronald Efrain

texts.es:
Ronald C. is a gentleman who runs a general store from his home in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. Ever since he started his business nine years ago, he has managed to improve the store’s condition, having invested in shelving and a refrigerator in which to store the beverages he sells.

He has excelled as a good entrepreneur who always attends to his customers, offering them a wide selection of products. He reached these achievements ever since he started working with Ceprodel, which has invested in his business by providing him with loans. Once again, he is seeking financial support in order to purchase merchandise to sell in his general store, thus continuing to maintain his household.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ronald C. es un caballero que se dedica al negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur. Desde hace nueve años que inició el negocio ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio habiendo invertido en la compra de estantes y de un refrigerador donde almacena las bebidas que comercializa.

Se ha destacado por ser un buen comerciante que en todo momento atiende a sus clientes ofreciéndoles gran variedad de productos. Estos logros los ha alcanzado desde que inició a trabajar con Ceprodel el cual al darle créditos los ha invertido en el negocio directamente. Hoy en día una vez mas busca el apoyo crediticio para la compra de su mercadería para ofrecerla en su pulpería y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Shirley José

texts.es:
With great effort, Mrs. Shirley E. sells clothing for a living in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur with the aim of supporting her young, school age daughter, who needs her mother’s care and support now more than ever. Shirley’s business has grown thanks to the fact that she has the desire to better herself, which is why she is hoping to be one of the best entrepreneurs in the area.

Despite having experienced financial difficulties, she will continue to do her best until realizing her dream of improving her economic status. She is currently requesting a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase clothing from her supplies and sell it to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de ropa es el negocio el cual muy esforzadamente se dedica la señora Shirley E. en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur con el objetivo de mantener a su pequeña hija en edad escolar el cual hoy mas que nunca necesita del apoyo y del calor fraternal de su madre. El negocio ha crecido gracias a que ella posee un gran espíritu de superación y es por esto que espera ser una de las mejores comerciantes en su sector.

A pesar de que ha atravesado situaciones adversas económicamente, esto no le ha impedido para continuar dando lo mejor de si hasta ver desarrollado su sueño de mejorar por completo su situación económica. Soy solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de la ropa a sus proveedores y así ofrecerlas a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Victoria Del Socorro

texts.es:
For several years now, Mrs. Victoria C. has been selling all types of products in her general store, located in her house in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua.

Thanks to the loans with which Ceprodel has provided her, she has been able to get ahead by filling her stockroom and shelves with a wider selection of products. It is of the utmost importance to note that she is once again turning to Ceprodel so that she can obtain yet another loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise for her business. She has stood out as a faithful customer who has repaid all her loans in a timely manner, according to the rules set forth by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Victoria C. se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de venta de diferentes tipos de productos los cuales los comercializa en su pulpería la cual posee en su casa de habitación en Managua específicamente en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur.

Gracias a los créditos que Ceprodel le ha proporcionado ella ha logrado salir adelante habiendo aumentado sus almacenes y llenado sus estantes con mayores cantidades de productos. Es de suma necesidad de igual manera destacar que hoy en día una vez mas acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de su mercadería para su respectiva comercialización en el negocio. Actualmente ella se ha destacado como fiel cliente habiendo cancelado todos sus créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por la institución.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of tablecloths, cushions, and ornamental plants to retail in her community

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of natural medicines to sell in her community

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of a wide range of products for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business making and selling tablecloths, cushions, and window curtains.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima P., 47, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years' experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the village community and Fugalei market 3 days per week. She has previous loans with SPBD.

Tima expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about US$ 104). SPBD loans are Tima’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She used to support her kids at school by paying for their school expenses for second term and also for home improvement. Her husband helped her in running their business and that is by planning everything for the betterment of their project.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, back sprayer, bush knives, shovel

loans.name: Salote

texts.en:
Salote S., 59, is married with 5 children. She has 5 years' experience in the grocery business. She sells to the village people and general public 7 days per week.

Salote has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about US$ 125). SPBD loans are Salote’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Education and home improvement and also her church activities are important to her.

Her husband used to be a successful businessman and he originally started the business. Her kids help her with a lot of the hard work. Her children who live overseas also send money and supplies for the business.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice, flour, sugar, salt, snacks, canned food,  etc.

loans.name: Vitalina

texts.en:
Vitalina T., 34, is married with 3 children. She has many years' experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to the village people and general public 3 days per week.
