SPBD loans are Mataifono’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be able to utilise to improve her business

loans.use: fabrics, cotton threads, sewing machine, etc

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Uk N. and her husband are farmers. They work very hard to support their family. They grow some vegetables like pumpkin. Pumpkin is one of the favorite fruits, and most people often eat it for their meal. This couple has four children and all of them are students.

Depending only on rain to water their plants is not good. They are requesting a loan to purchase a water pump to help during dry spells. They also plan to buy a cow to help plow the land. (Uk N.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Nuufou

texts.en: Nuufou C., 28, is married with 2 children.  She has had many years of experience in the banana plantation business. She sells to the village communities and relatives 2 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $125 USD).  SPBD loans are Nuufou’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Nuufou will use part of her loan to assist  with her children's school needs,and the rest for the labor to replace equipment in her market. Her husband does all the farming and also recruits young men from  the village to help out with their plantation.

loans.use: To pay for the labor to replace equipment in her market

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Thi Nguyen, though only 26 years old, is praised by the local people for her very keen business sense. She joined the Fund in 2002. She and her husband boldly borrowed from the Fund to raise pigs; after many rounds of funding and the livestock business going well they have been able to save a decent amount of money. With this money and supplemental loans from family they have been able to buy an automobile with the goal of offering freight service to people in need. Because of these bold business ventures the family’s finances are relatively good compared to local standards. Both of their children are school-aged and they are very obedient and are doing well in school. In this round of funding, the couple is asking for 9,000,000 VND to continue investing in raising livestock. Their average revenue is 4,000,000-5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị N., 26 tuổi mặc dù tuổi đời còn rất trẻ nhưng chị được mọi người điạ phương rất ca ngợi là người có đầu óc làm kinh tế, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2002, vợ chồng anh chị mạnh giạn vay vốn của Quỹ để chăn nuôi lợn, sau nhiều vòng vốn vay của Quỹ cùng với việc chăn nuôi thuận lợi, anh chị đã dành dụm được 1 số tiền khá khá, kết hợp với việc vay thêm của anh em họ hàng, gia đình anh chị đã mua được 1 chiếc ô tô với mục đích chở vật liệu thuê cho những nguời có nhu cầu. Từ những việc mạnh giạn làm đó đến nay kinh tế gia đình anh chị thuộc diện khá tại địa phương, 2 con anh chị đang trọng độ tuổi ăn học, các con anh chị rất ngoan và học giỏi. Vòng vốn này anh chị xịn vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ ->5.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: invest in raising pigs

loans.name: Olita

texts.en: Olita P., 48, is married with 4 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the Ice cake business. She sells to the school children and village people 6 days per week. She has 5 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Olita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All will be use to start the business. Husband  also had a job at the Ministry of Transport to support her business.

loans.use: Purchase To finance what is needed for her new project.

loans.name: Maelega

texts.en: Maelega S.'s  lawn mowing  business is running  successfully. She has received 2 prior loans that she has repaid.  She will use this loan to renovate her family home and also to buy another lawn mower for her business.

loans.use: To renovate her home and to buy a lawn mower for her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Rình joins the TYM Fund in 2003. It is typical among members of her group, she takes out loans to invest in her livestock. Her first loan was 2,000,000VND. Since then the family’s economy gradually improves. She has better facility now and also manages some savings. Her son is working with a salary of 3,000,000VND a month. She gets an income of 4,000,000 VND a month. She would like to apply for a loan of 16,000,000 VND to invest in her livestock business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2003, chị Nguyễn Thị Rình cũng như bao thành viên khác trong cụm vay vốn chăn nuôi lợn, gà, vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị vay 2.000.000đ, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều vay với mức cao và cũng đầu tư vào chăn nuôi đến nay gia đình chị đã có những khoản tiền tiết kiệm từ việc chăn nuôi, tới đây gia đình chị có kế hoạch sữa chữa công trình phụ và chuồng trại để cho việc chăn nuôi thuận lợi hơn, gia đình chị bàn bạc và xin vay mức vốn 16.000.000đ nuôi lợn, gà. Nguồn hoàn trả tiền tuần được lấy từ việc chăn nuôi và con trai chị đi làm thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Thu nhập của gia đình bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Nuutupu

texts.en: Nuutupu S., 37, is married with 5 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the pork cake business. She sells to the village people  6 days per week. She has 6 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $208 USD.  SPBD loans are Nuutupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband is also working hard as a fisherman to support her pork cake business.

loans.use: To provide capital for her pork cake business.

loans.name: Sua

texts.en: Sua A., 44, is married with 3 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to the village people  4 days per week. She has had 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $250 USD.  SPBD loans are Sua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for her children's educational needs. Her husband does all the farming.

loans.use: To finance equipment needed for her business

loans.name: Hanrietta

texts.en: Hanrietta S., 25, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 year(s) of experience in the pan cake business. She sells to the villagers/public 2 days per week. She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).  SPBD loans are Hanrietta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will help assist her in buying equipment and ingredients for her business.

loans.use: sack of flour, sugar, frying pan, stove and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: Faaiuga F., 45, is married with 2 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the pork cakes business. She sells to the school children and village people 6 days per week. She has had 6 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $208 USD.  SPBD loans are Faaiuga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to pay for her children's school fees and the rest to  make improvements in her business. Her husband helps in operating  the business in order to support the family.

loans.use: to make improvements in her canteen business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thúy, an active, quick and trustworthy woman, joins the TYM Fund in 2002. She uses funds from her loans to raise livestock and invest in her general stand. Her stand is popular. Some says she has her charm in trading. The family’s economy improves gradually. Life is better and her children have more for their education. Loan repayments are simple since she has income from the stand everyday. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 10,000,000 VND for her fish stand. The monthly income is 5,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Năm 2002 tham gia vào Quỹ, Chị Nguyễn Thị Thúy là người phụ nữ năng động, vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán nhỏ, với bản tính nhanh nhẹn, thật thà nên công việc buôn bán của chị rất thuận lợi, khách hàng đến mua hàng của chị chỉ một lần là nhớ mãi, có một số người đánh giá chị là người có duyên bán hàng, măc dù công việc bán hàng của chị rất bận rộn nhưng chị cùng chồng vẫn chăn nuôi lợn tại nhà, cứ như vậy vòng vốn này qua vòng vốn khác anh chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán, mô hình ngày càng mở rộng dần theo hàng năm. Kinh tế phát triển, các con đều được đi học, Việc trả vốn đối với Quỹ cũng thật giản đơn với gia đình anh chị, chị bán hàng thu nhập đều đặn hàng ngày. Vòng vốn này gia đình xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư thêm vào hàng cá. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Fish sale

loans.name: Fuamatala

texts.en: Fuamatala P., 42, is married with 5 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the food stall business. She sells to the village people and the public 5 days per week. She has had 5 previous loans  with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $166 USD.  SPBD loans are Fuamatala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be use to build a food stall shelter by the road.

loans.use: To build a shelter on the roadside to sell food

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Hiểu, from a traditional farming family, joins the TYM Fund in 2003. She and her husband discuss about using funds from the loans to invest in raising livestock. The economy improves gradually and the facility is also expands. Children are well in their education. Her husband works as a laborer, brings home 2,000,000 VND a month. Income from her livestock is about 4,000,000 VND a year. She is applying for a loan of 9,000,000 VND to by breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, chị Phạm Thị Hiểu xuất phát từ gia đình nhà nông đến khi lấy chồng, gia đình chị thu nhập chủ yếu trông vào nông nghiệp. Thấy rằng việc tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn và phát triển kinh tế, anh chị đã bàn bạc tham gia Quỹ vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà, cá, với việc chăn nuôi đó kinh tế gia đình chị ngày một phát triển, trải qua từng vòng vốn mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị ngày được mở rộng hơn, ngoài ra chồng chị thường đi làm thuê thu nhập bình quân 2.000.000đ/ tháng. 2 con của anh chị vẫn được ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị bàn bạc và xin vay 9.000.000đ mua lợn giống . Thu nhập bình quân từ chăn nuôi lợn, gà, cá 4.000.000đ/ năm

loans.use: buy breeding pigs

loans.name: Palolo

texts.en: Palolo T., 33, is married with 2 children.  She has many year(s) of experience in the fresh fish business. She sells to the villagers/public 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).  SPBD loans are Palolo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. To assist in her fishery bvusiness and to buy a canoe and to complete with her home renovation.

loans.use: fishing spear, fishing boots

loans.name: Mewinasso Group

texts.fr:
The MWEINASSO Association was created in July of 2007. It brings together seven energetic women who lead various income-generating activities. The president opened a shop selling basic goods, others do business in grains, cell phone credit cards, and vegetables. This group is well-supervised by the president who understands management. MWINASSO group’s members' first objective is to make profit through business, and secondly, mutual aid. Usually they buy their merchandise at the main market before taking it to local markets for retail. The first loan that they are seeking will allow them to buy some cartons of soap, two cartons of milk, some cell phone credit cards, toothpaste, and grains. This loan will support their business activities and they will also be able to participate in their respective family’s spending with the profits they will earn.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

L’Association MEWINASSO est crée en juillet 2007. Elle regroupe sept (7) femmes dynamiques qui mènent des activités génératrices de revenus variées. La présidente a ouvert une boutique de vente des produits de premières nécessités, les autres c’est le commerce de céréales, de cartes de recharge et des légumes. Ce groupe est bien encadré par la présidente qui a les notions de gestion. Les membres du groupement MEWINASSO ont pour objectif premier la recherche du profit à travers l’exercice d’une activité et en second l’entraide mutuelle. Généralement elles achètent leurs marchandises au grand marché avant de procéder à la vente dans les marchés locaux. Le premier crédit qu’elles sollicitent leur permettra d’acheter des cartons de savons, 2 cartons de lait, des cartes de recharges, des pâtes dentifrices et des céréales. Ce prêt viendra en appui a leur activité et elles pourront aussi participer aux dépenses de leurs familles respectives par le bénéfices qu’elles auront à dégager.

loans.use: Retail of basic goods and grains

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en: Faapaia P., 31, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 year(s) of experience in the pan cake business. She sells to the villagers/public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).  SPBD loans are Faapaia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. to assist in buying equipment used in her pan cake business.

loans.use: flour, vegetable oil, bakery bowder and sugar

loans.name: Marata

texts.en: Marata T., 50, is married with 2 children.  She has 4 year(s) of experience in the Mens and womens outfit business. She sells to the villagers/public 3 days per week. She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Marata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. to help her in buying new materials for her business

loans.use: fabrics, cotton threads, sewing machine, etc

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a 45-year-old former banker, now retired into private business and agriculture. He runs a farm where he grows fruits and vegetables which he sells in Dar Es Salaam.  Joshua is now in need of a loan to help buy special packaging materials for the vegetables as well as fertilizers and machinery for farming.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Chanthu

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthu T. is a fisherman in Kampong Svay Village in Kandal Province. His wife, Mrs. Tren Long, is a subsistence farmer who cultivates her crop on a small piece of field. They have two children and both of them are too young to work or study.

Mr. Chanthu T. and his family now live in an old house. He and his wife try to earn more money to build a new house but they still have insufficient funds to build it. Thus, Mr. Chanthu T. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Last year, Mr. Chanthu T.’s youngest child got a dengue fever and he spent $100 to get cured. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.name: Sida

texts.en:
Mrs. Sida T. lives in Kampong Svay Village in Kandal Province. She is a subsistence farmer and her husband, Mr. Heng Kim, is a fisherman. Mrs. Sida T. is 19 years old and the mother of one child who is too young to work or attend school. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

In Mr. Heng Kim’s business activity, he has faced a number of small problems because he does not have enough money to buy a boat and boat machine. Thus, Mrs. Sida T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy them in order to make her husband’s business more improved.

loans.use: To buy a boat and boat machine in order to fish the fish.

loans.name: Ramadhani

texts.en:
Ramadhani is a 50-year-old father of three who runs a company that supplies food and related goods mainly to hospitals, schools and other institutions. He buys his stock from Dar es Salaam's nearby regions, and then transports it to Dar Es Salaam, where he conducts his business.
He is now in need of a loan to help him expand his business.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Sam Art

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam Art M. is a fish seller in the local market, located in Kampong Svay Village in Kandal Province. She is 47 years old and a widow of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, one who is studying in state school and one who stays at home.

Mrs. Sam Art M.’s business is more improved now so she wants to expand her business. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to re-sell. Previously, Mrs. Sam Art M. obtained a loan from Prasac Co., Ltd to start her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoes, curtains, and two embroidery machines.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Action Now: Kenya (ANK) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina I. is forty-six years old.  She is a widow with four children.  She lives in Edo State, Nigeria.  She owns a poultry farm were she rears chickens and hens.  She does this for commercial purposes (i.e. selling them to people in her community).  She has been in business since 2004.  She needs the loan amount of  $875 to buy more chicks to rear, and also to buy bird feed.

loans.use: To buy  more bird feed and chicks to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a freezer for his ice making business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Action Now: Kenya (ANK) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: George

texts.en: George O. is 45 years old and is married with 4 children.  He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  George is involved in the sales of provisions and drinks.  He needs the loan amount of $525 to buy more provisions and soft drinks to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To buy  more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba S. sells fish. She is a single mother with two children, yet the income she generates from her fish-selling business is insufficient to pay for her family's living expenses.

At the same time, there is high demand for Aba's goods, so she is now looking to capitalize on such high demand by expanding her business in order to generate an increase in her profits. Consequently, she is seeking additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama D. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is insufficient to support their daily living expenses.

Nevertheless, there is high demand for Ama's goods, so she is looking to capitalize on such high demand by expanding her business in order to generate greater profits. Therefore, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for the fish she sells by expanding her business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. sells bulk fish. She is married and has three children, but her husband's income from his farming operations is insufficient to meet the needs of and to support their family.

However, there is high demand for Esi's goods, so she is looking to capitalize on such high demand by expanding her business in order to generate greater profits. As a result, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for the fish she sells by expanding her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth and other sewing accessories.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Action Now: Kenya (ANK) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hair products to expand her salon.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Action Now: Kenya (ANK) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. sells fish. She is single, and the income she generates from her fish-selling business is insufficient to pay for her living expenses.

Even so, there is high demand for her goods, so she is looking to capitalize on such high demand by expanding her business in order to generate an increase in her profits. Accordingly, she is seeking additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for the fish she sells by expanding her business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua T. sells provisions at her grocery store. She is married and has three children, but her husband's income as a fisherman is insufficient to cover the family's living expenses.

Nevertheless, there is high demand for Efua's goods, so she is looking to capitalize on such high demand by expanding her business to generate an increase in profits. Thus, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for her goods by expanding her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional scratch cards and telephone accessories to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Action Now: Kenya (ANK) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort W. sells various provisions and firewood. She is married and has two children, but her husband's income from his job as a taxi driver is insufficient to meet the needs of and to support their family.

Even so, there is high demand for Comfort's goods, so she is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to generate greater profits. Therefore, she is seeking additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose U. is 35 years old and is married with 3 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.  She sells notebooks and text books in her community.  She has been in this business since the year 2004.  She is requesting a loan amount of $450 to buy more books to sell.  This, she hopes, will help her serve her customers better.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more books to sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Azizgul

texts.en:
Azizgul H. is a 55-year-old woman who breeds calves for meat production in a small village within the Saatli region. She has more than fifteen years of experience in this field. Azizgul is married and has five children.

Breeding calves is the only source of income for the family. Azizgul has applied for a loan to purchase three calves and fodder to speed up the growing process. Summer is high season for wedding parties and meat is the most popular meal. Azizgul could earn more money during this period by adding three calves to her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Ayaz

texts.en:
Ayaz A. is a 52-year-old man who owns dairy cows for milk and yogurt sales. He lives in a small village in the Saatli region. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field. He is married and ha three children.

Ayaz works as a teacher in the local school, but his salary is so low that it can't cover basic family needs. His second and more profitable source of funding is selling milk and yogurt. Demand is very high and owning one cow does not satisfy the needs of the local people. Ayaza is requesting a loan to expand his business and purchase two additional dairy cows to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz A., 51, has been a dairy and cattle farmer for more than twenty years. He is married and has three sons. They all live in a small village in the Saatli region.

He is requesting a loan to purchase two calves and one dairy cow. Eyvaz believes this purchase will help him make more money during the summer as it is high season for weddings, and meals from meat is very popular at these events.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and one dairy cow

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en:
Fikret A. is a 40-year-old trader who owns a retail store. He is married and has two daughters and one son. This store is the only source of income for their family,

He opened his business in 2002 with a strategy of offering many different types of goods in one store. Fikret states that when people enter the store they find clothes which they purchase and then they need some shoes to coordinate with the clothing. That is the benefit of his store. He also sells housewares such as tablecloths and dishes.

Fikret is requesting a loan to expand the number and diversity of goods he sells in the store. He is focused on purchasing more summer clothes, because summer is 'wedding season' and women shop in his store more frequently to purchase special dresses for weddings.

loans.use: To expand the number and diversity of goods available for resale

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara G., 38 , is married and has three daughters.She and her family live in a small village in the Saatli region.

Gulnara owns dairy cows and sells milk and yogurt. This is the only source of income for their family. She has decided to expand her business and start raising calves for meat production. Gulnara has applied for a loan to purchase three calves and fodder to speed up the growth process. As summer is high season for weddings, she would like to concentrate on breeding the calves to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase three calves for meat production

loans.name: Nabikhan

texts.en:
Nabikhan I.,46, has been raising and selling sheep for meat since 1985. He lives with his family in the small refugee village of Varkhankend in the Saatli region.

He sells sheep to the local bazaar traders and other people in the village. This is the only source of income for his family. He would like a loan to purchase twenty sheep which will then increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase twenty sheep for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Osas

texts.en: A. Osas sells food, drinks and provisions.  She is forty-one years old and married with four children.  She has been in business since 1999.  She hails from Edo State, Nigeria and is a LAPO client.  She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, food stuffs and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. sells beer and other drinks and foodstuffs. She is a single mother of three children, and her income is insufficient to support her family's daily living expenses.

However, there is high demand for her goods, so she is now looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to increase her profits. As such, she is requested additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila S., 42, is married and has three children. The family lives in the small refugee village of Varkhankend which situated in the Saatli region.

She owns dairy cows and has been selling milk and yogurt to the local people for more than twenty years. Nazila also works as a school teacher in the local school, but her salary is very low and is not enough to feed her family. To improve their living conditions, she is requesting a loan to purchase two dairy cows and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena P. sells various foods, including maize, yams, and beans. She is married and has two children, but her husband's income from his job with the Cape Coast Information Services is insufficient to support the family's living expenses.

Fortunately, there is high demand for her goods, so she is now looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to generate greater profits. Consequently, she is seeking additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en:
Fikret A. is a 41-year-old man who breeds calves for meat production in a small village near the Saatli region. He is married and has three children.

Fikret is requesting a loan to purchase four baby calves. Summer is the high season for wedding parties, and Fikret believes that breeding his calves and selling them in this time period will be very beneficial to his sales.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Latyr

texts.fr:
LATYR N. is a grower and is married and the father of eight. To improve his income, he raises sheep. The income earned from his business enables him to send his children to school and to feed his family. He has already benefited from two loans of 200,000 francs CFA for strengthening his business.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

LATYR N. est un cultivateur ,marié et pére de 08 enfants .Pour amelliore ses revenus,il éléve des moutons .les revenus tirés de son activité lui permet la scolarité des enfants et nouriture pour la famille.il a déjà bénéficié de 2 prets de 200000F CFA pour renforcer son activité

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim A. is a 39-year-old farmer who breeds calves for meat production and owns one dairy cow to generate dairy products for his family. He lives with his wife and three sons in a small village within the Saatli region.

Salim's dream is to have a big farm. He is teaching his sons how to properly look after livestock. To get closer to his goal, Salim has requested a loan to purchase four baby calves and fodder to speed up the growing process.

loans.use: To purchase four calves and fodder

loans.name: Melikhanum

texts.en:
Melikhanum T., 25, is married and has two sons. For the past nine years, she has been selling milk and yogurt to the local factory.

She has applied for a loan to purchase one additional dairy cow and fodder. This will increase her output and generate more sales to the factory.

loans.use: To purchase an additional dairy cow and fodder

loans.name: Edilov

texts.en:
Edilov Q., 57, owns dairy cows and sells milk to the local milk factory. He also drives tractors for local farmers, especially during the harvesting seasons. He is married and has six children.

Mr. Q. is requesting a loan to purchase two more dairy cows. This will increase the volume of milk he can sell to the local factory, thus increasing his sales and profit to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows to increase milk production

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
Nadir S., 47, has been breeding calves and selling milk for nine years. He lives in small village situated in the Saatli region. He is married and has three daughters.

Nadir has applied for a loan to purchase one dairy cow and two calves. He is focused on both businesses because a new cow will increase the amount of milk he can sell to the local milk factory.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow and two calves

loans.name: Antoine

texts.fr:
Mr. Antoine G. was born January 28th, 1981 in Avrankou, Benin. He is single and opened his embroidery workshop called “BRODEUR FARO FARO” in the Bè neighborhood of Lomé in 2000. After sewing and embroidering clothing, he delivers part of his stock to wholesalers and displays the rest in his workshop. He engages three tailors and three embroiderers. The energy of his work team and his own determination have made him a renowned embroiderer in the neighborhood. He has already obtained and successfully repaid one loan from WAGES. The second loan for 300,000 Francs CFA that he is seeking will allow him to buy fabric, jacard, and haberdashery items.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur G. Antoine est né le 28 janvier 1981 à AVRANKOU au Bénin. Il est célibataire et a ouvert son atelier de broderie dénommé « BRODEUR FARO FARO » dans le quartier de Bè à Lomé en l’an 2000. Après avoir cousu et brodé les habits, il livre une partie aux grossistes et expose la seconde partie dans son atelier. Il a trois (3) tailleurs et trois (3) brodeurs. Le dynamisme de son équipe de travail et sa propre détermination font de lui un brodeur reconnu dans le quartier. Il a une fois obtenu un crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé. Le second crédit d’un montant de 300.000FCFA qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des tissus, bazin et des articles de mercerie.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and haberdashery items

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose and his family are dairy farmers and they also dedicate themselves to agriculture in order to feed themselves. Jose is also the manager of the milk producers of the province of The Andes. His main source of income with which he maintains his family (his wife and 3 kids) comes from selling milk to the PIL Andina factory.

He lives in the community of Huayrocondo-Batallas which is in the province of The Andes in the state of La Paz (two hours from the city of El Alto).

He needs this credit in order to buy a medium quality milk-producing cow so that he can increase milk production and thereby improve his familiy's economic income.

This is his second credit with Impro and his good behaviour with regards to loan repayments means that he qualifies to make another loan application.

Translated form Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

José y su familia, son productores de leche y se dedican a la agricultura solo para su alimentación y él también trabaja como dirigente de los productores de leche de la Provincia los Andes. Sus ingresos principales con los que mantiene a la familia (3 hijos y esposa) provienen de la venta de leche a la Fábrica PIL Andina. Vive en la Comunidad Huayrocondo – Batallas de la Provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito requiere para comprar una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, de esa forma incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para su familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: To buy a medium quality milk-producing cow to increase milk production/Compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para incrementar su produccion de leche.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys works as a math teacher and she lives with her daughter and grandson in her own house, located in Villa Mercedario in the city of El Alto. This is a zone on the outskirts of the city where there are a lot of new buildings.

The credit will go towards buying construction materials as she needs to make and finish off many home improvements; in this way she will have a home of a reasonable quailty which will be more comfortable for her whole family.

This is her second credit with Impro and her good track record with regards to payments means that she qualifies to make another loan application.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Gladys, trabaja en el magisterio como profesora de matemáticas, vive con su hija y su nieto en su casa propia, ubicada en la Villa Mercedario de la Ciudad de El Alto, zona alejada de la Ciudad de El Alto donde existen muchas construcciones nuevas. El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia de construcción, pues le falta mucha mejoras a su vivienda que poco a poco la está concluyendo; de esa forma contará con una vivienda de mediana calidad que les de más confort a toda la familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro y el buen comportamiento de pago la califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: To buy building materials to make some home improvements and thereby offer her family a better quality of life/Compra de materiales de construccion para efectuar mejoras a su vivienda y poder ofrecer  mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.name: Aizotou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aïzotou K. was born May 14th, 1970 in Sokodé. She is married to Mr. Biraïma BATCHA who is a taxi driver. They have four children. She is a retailer of cosmetic products in the Agoè neighborhood. In 2006, she opened her store and achieves good sales turnover. The first loan she is seeking will allow her to buy six cartons of lotion and 6 cartons of perfumes.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Aïzotou est née le 14 mai 1970 à Sokodé. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur BATCHA Biraïma qui est un chauffeur de taxis. Ils ont 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse des produits cosmétiques dans le quartier d’Agoè. Depuis 2006, elle a ouvert son magasin et réalise de bon chiffre d’affaires. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 6 cartons de crème et 6 cartons de parfums.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Anatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Anatou Y. was born January 14th, 1971 in Lomé. She is a retailer of basic goods and is married to Mr. Katchirikou TCHAGODOMOU who is a taxi driver. They have four children who are attending school. On her shelves one can find rice, oil, and tomatoes. This first loan she is seeking will allow her to purchase one bag of rice, two drums of oil, and two cartons of tomatoes.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Y. Anatou est née le 14 janvier 1971 à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités et s’est mariée à Monsieur TCHAGODOMOU Katchirikou qui est un chauffeur de taxis. Ils ont 4 enfants qui vont à l’école. Sur son étalage, on peut trouver du riz, d’huile, tomate. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 1 sac de riz, 2 bidons et 2 cartons de tomates.

loans.use: Purchase of basic goods merchandise

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina C. is a member of the Village Bank Orquídeas.

Delfina is married, is 33 years old, and has 2 children. Delfina and her husband sell natural medicines for different illnesses. They make the medicines themselves and do this as a type of out-patient clinic using a wheelbarrow in the Nery García market. Delfina sells the best natural products that can be bought in Lima.

Delfina needs a loan of 3000 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of capsules, herbs, and sugar.

Delfina's dreams are to have a well-established store and that her children become professionals in some field.

loans.use: To purchase capsules, herbs, and sugar.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis A. is a hard-working man dedicated to his tailoring business that he runs out his home in the Sandino City neighborhood in Managua. This business immensely helps him provide for his family, his spouse and two school-age children. It's important to note that since Luis started the business with few resources and today he has greatly improved it thanks to the support of Kiva partner Ceprodel, which has given him loan that have helped him purchase supplies like thread, buttones, fabric, etc. Today, he is requesting another loan to purchase more of these materials, and is confident Ceprodel will support him once again carry on his work.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Luis A. es un caballero muy trabajador puesto que se dedica al negocio de la sastrería donde atiende a sus clientes en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua. Este negocio le ha ayudado grandemente a mantener a su familia que consta de su cónyuge y dos hijos en edades escolares.

Es importante destacar que desde que inició en el negocio de la sastrería con pocos recursos hoy en día ha venido mejorando grandemente gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel el cual le ha proporcionado créditos los cuales han sido utilizados para la compra de sus materiales de trabajo como hilos, botones, telas, etc. Hoy en día solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de los materiales y una vez mas confía en que Ceprodel le apoyará para llevar a cabo esta labor.

loans.use: Purchase thread, buttons, fabric, etc. / Compra de materiales para trabajo

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Josefa Elba

texts.es:
Josefa L. is a native of the Sandino City neighborhood in beautiful Managua. She has dedicated her self arduously to her business of making mattresses and pillows, which she then sells out her home. With two children to provide for and the responsibility to tend to all of her home's necessities, Josefa works buying supplies to make her products and once they are made she sells them to customers. It's necessary to point out that she has wisely sought the help of Kiva partner Ceprodel by means of loan, which she used to great benefit for her business. Today she's requesting another loan to purchase materials. She is very confident her request will be granted and her economic condition will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Josefa L. es originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la bella ciudad de Managua en Nicaragua. Ella se ha dedicado arduamente al negocio de la elaboración y venta de colchones y almohadas los cuales son comercializados en su propia casa de habitación.

Con dos hijos que mantener y con la responsabilidad de atender todas las necesidades de su hogar, ella trabaja en el negocio comprando materiales para elaborar los colchones y las almohadas y una vez que estos son elaborados procede a comercializarlos a los clientes. Es necesario destacar que muy sabiamente ella ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel por medio de los créditos los cuales le han servido de mucho beneficio para sus compras. Hoy solicita el crédito para la compra de los materiales y está muy confiada de que le será otorgado y así mejorará su condición económica.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make mattresses and pillows / Compra de materiales

loans.name: María Hercilda

texts.es:
Hercilda R. is a merchant at a small market in the Sandino City neighborhood of Managua, where she dedicates herself to selling fruits and vegetables at her post. She has been dedicated to selling perishable goods for seven years, and it is her only source of income to provide for her two small children. It's important to mention that Hercilda is known for being a very hard-working woman, which has helped be able to supply her business with different types of fruits and vegetables. Today, she looks for the support of Kiva partner Ceprodel to obtain a loan so she can purchase her goods. She is confident that her request will be granted and she will thus be able to keep making headway with her business that is in dire needs of funds.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Hercilda R. es una comerciante del mercadito de Ciudad Sandino el cual se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en su establecimiento. Desde hace siete años se dedica a esta labor de venta de perecederos y es este su único ingreso con el cual sustenta su hogar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos.

Es menester mencionar que ella se ha caracterizado por ser una dama muy trabajadora el cual ha logrado surtir su negocio de diferentes tipos de frutas y verduras. Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de sus perecederos. Ella confía en que su crédito será otorgado y de esta manera saldrá adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión inmediata.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables / Compra de las frutas y verduras

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa O. runs her own auto repair shop out of her home in the Sandino City neighborhood in Managua, where she tends to her customers in a large room with stabilization space for the vehicles. Since she started her business more than eight years ago, Josefa has had the support of her husband, who works as the mechanic. By means of this business they are able to support their two children, a girl and a young man, and provide them necessities. It's for this reason Josefa is looking for support from Kiva partner Ceprodel. With the loan she will purchase much-needed tools.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino, la señora Josefa O. posee su propio taller de reparación de vehículos en su propia casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes en un terreno amplio con espacio para estacionarse.

Desde que inició su negocio hace mas de ocho años, ha tenido el apoyo de su esposo el cual se dedica a la labor de la mecánica. Por medio de este negocio ella apoya a sus dos hijas (una niña y una joven) supliendo sus necesidades. Por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar herramientas de trabajo que le son de mucha necesidad.

loans.use: Purchase much-needed tools / Compra de herramientas

loans.name: Magda Victoria

texts.es:
Magda Gonzáles dedicates herself arduously to her seamstress business in the Sandino City neighborhood of Managua, where she tends to clients out of her home. Magda is a single mother of two whom she cares for as a mother and father at the same time. Her main goal is to expand her business and thus improve the economic conditions of her humble household. Today she looks for financial support from Kiva partner Ceprodel with the hope of purchasing sewing supplies such as fabrics, thread, needles, etc. The loan will benefit her children as much as her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua la señora Magda Gonzáles se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de costurería donde atiende a sus clientes en su propia casa de habitación donde atiende su negocio.

Actualmente es madre soltera y con dos hijos que mantener por lo que lleva a cabo el papel de padre y madre a la vez. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su costurería para así mejorar las condiciones económicas de su humilde hogar. Hoy en día busca un apoyo financiero en Ceprodel con el propósito de comprar los materiales de trabajo para la costurería como lo es la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, etc. Con el crédito se beneficia tanto ella como sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies (fabrics, thread, needles, etc.) / Compra de materiales para el trabajo

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Columba

texts.es:
Columba is an honest, hardworking, enterprising woman who is 63 years old. She started her own business because her husband did not earn enough income working as a security guard. She started out selling different products in order to help out with the household expenses. After her husband starting having heart problems and could no longer work, they decided to build some business spaces so that they could earn a living by renting them out.

It all started 20 years ago, when her husband’s friend offered them a plot of land near their home at a good price. Having their future in mind, they purchased it because her husband had been laid off due to his heart condition. They first built one business space, and with the money earned from renting it out, they started building more spaces one by one. They currently have 4 business spaces, but they need to give them some maintenance, such as a paint job, new flooring, replace old pipes, and install a new toilet and sink in one of the business spaces.

She needs a loan of $700.00 USD, which will be repaid in 6 months, so that she can remodel and give maintenance to her business spaces, as well as build a restroom in one of the spaces that needs it. With your help, Columba will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Columba es una mujer de 63 años, honesta, trabajadora y emprendedora. Inició su negocio porqué el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba ya que el trabajaba como vigilante, fue por eso que ella emprendió su negocio, primeramente en la venta de diferentes productos para ayudarlo con los gastos de la casa. Después su esposo enfermó del corazón y como ya no podía trabajar decidieron construir unos locales comerciales para vivir de la renta de los mismos.

Todo comenzó hace 20 años, un amigo de su esposo les ofreció en venta un terreno cerca de donde vivíamos en un buen precio, y pensando en el futuro lo adquirieron, ya que a su esposo lo habían liquidado de su trabajo por una enfermedad del corazón. Primero construyeron un local, y con la renta que cobraban del mismo fueron construyendo uno por uno y en la actualidad ya tienen 4 locales, pero necesita darles mantenimiento como pintura, ponerles piso nuevo, cambiar algunas tuberías que ya están viejas y además ponerle taza y lavabo nuevo a uno de los locales.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $ 700 que pagara en 6 meses que le permitirá remodelar y darle mantenimiento a los locales, así como construir el baño a uno de los locales que le hace falta. Con tu apoyo Columba saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Maintenance of business spaces

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda started her own business in order to earn extra money to help her husband with the household expenses. They wanted to advance financially and give their children—Eric Armando, a 9-year-old elementary school student, and Alejandra Guadalupe, a 5-year-old preschool student—a good education and a better standard of living.

Amanda started in September of 2002, when her neighbor invited her to join a group of cosmetics promoters. She started selling those products from home to her family, friends, and neighbors. Ever since then, her business has prospered and she has been able to get ahead.

She currently needs a loan of $700.00 USD, which will be repaid in 6 months, so that she can purchase beauty products and offer her customers a greater selection, thus increasing her income. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Amanda inició el negocio para obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y juntos progresar económicamente para darle a sus hijos Eric Armando de 9 años, estudiante de primara y Alejandra Guadalupe de 5 años asiste al Pre-escolar, una buena educación y un mejor nivel de vida.

Comenzó en Septiembre de 2002 cuando una vecina la invito a formar parte del grupo de promotoras de los productos cosmeticos, así inicio vendiendo los productos en su casa entre familiares, vecinas y amistades y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien y ha podido salir adelante.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $700 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar artículos de belleza para poder tener un mejor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar los ingresos. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco began working as a taxi driver because the company for which he previously worked decided to downsize, so they had to lay him off. He then had difficulty finding another job due to his age. He needed to help his family get ahead, so after he received the opportunity to get a car, he decided to offer taxi cab services.

He now needs a loan of $700.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to invest in vehicle maintenance and help his family move forward. This will be possible with your support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco se inicio como taxista debido a que la empresa en la que trabajaba realizo un reajuste de personal por lo que fue despedido de su anterior empleo, y al tener dificultades para encontrar otro empleo debido a su edad, no tenia muchas ofertas de trabajo. El tenia la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, posteriormente surgio la oportunidad de un carro y decidio dedicarse a prestar este servicio.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $700 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir en el mantenimiento de su carro, y poder sacar adelante a su familia. con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Taxi cab maintenance

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores started her business because she has always liked to cook and her family would always tell her that she has a knack for it. She realized that cooking is a good business. Since she needed to earn extra money without leaving the home or neglecting her family, she decided to sell food approximately 10 years ago. She initially opened only and Saturdays and Sundays, but her customers asked her to open everyday, so she did.

She is requesting a loan of $250.00 USD, which will be repaid in 6 months, in order to remodel her kitchen and business space so that it will be more appealing and she can offer her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

María Dolores inició el negocio porque siempre le ha gustado cocinar y sus familiares siempre le decían que tenia muy buen sazón y descubrió que era buen negocio. Ella necesitaba ofrecer otro ingreso a su familia y con la comodidad de no salir de casa y no desatender a mi familia. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 10 años vendiendo solo sábado y domingo, pero la misma gente le pedía que vendiera todos los días y así es ahora.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses, el cual le ayudara a arreglar la cocina y el local y esto dará mejor aspecto al negocio, y podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes.

loans.use: Kitchen remodeling

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe works as a security guard in the mayor's office in La Paz. He also works as a cross-province driver. His wife works selling children's clothes (their main source of income) and it is with all these occupations that they support their three kids; an eleven year old and 2 and a half year old twins. The family lives in San Jose de Yunguyo in the city of El Alto.

They will use this credit to buy construction materials to fortify their front wall.

This is their first loan with Impro and the results of their evaluation mean that the company approve of their loan application.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Felipe trabaja como en Gendarme en la Alcaldía de La Paz, igualmente, tiene otro trabajo como transportista interprovincial. Su esposa es comerciante de ropa de niños (su principal fuente de ingresos), con dichas ocupaciones mantienen a sus tres hijos de 11 años de edad y una parejita de gemelos de 2 años y medio. La familia vive en San José de Yunguyo de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito será destinado para comprar materiales de construcción para edificar una muralla frontal. Este es su primer crédito con Impro, los resultados de la evaluación nos permiten aprobar esta solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: To buy construction materials/ADQUISICIÓN DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCIÓN

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana makes ponchos and shawls which she sells from her own shop which is in zone 16 de julio in the city of El Alto. She lives in the Ballivan zone of this same city with her two sons who are 12 and 2 years old.

She would like a loan to be able to buy raw materials (cloth and thread) and in this way she will increase her earnings.

This is her first credit with Impro and the evaluation carried out allows them to approve this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Ana es confeccionista de mantas y polleras, las cuales vende en una tienda de su propiedad ubicada en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Su domicilio es en la zona Ballivián de la misma ciudad, vive con sus dos hijos de 12 y 2 años de edad. La clienta solicita crédito para comprar materia prima (tela e hilos), de esa forma incrementará su producción y sus ingresos. Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada nos permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Ana.

loans.use: To earn more capital from her work/CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Asai

texts.en:
Asai A. K., 46, is married with 6 children. She has 5 years of experience in the Food Stall business. She sells to the general public and villagers 5 days per week. Her husband and children help with the business. Asai expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (about US $62).

Asai has had 6 previous loans with SPBD. These loans are her only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of this loan will be used for the children's education and to pay for electricity and water.

loans.use: Purchase more cooking equipment and ingredients.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria S., 52, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in retail sales. She and her husband sell to the villagers 6 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about US $208).

Maria has had 5 previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Malia’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to renovate her house and for her children's educational fees.

loans.use: Purchase building materials and inventory.

loans.name: Yeabu Oliver

texts.en: Yeabu is very grateful to all Kiva lenders, who transformed her family life. Yeabu said that with the loan, she diversified her business and was able to sell wholesale, allowing her to generate a good income. With the profit, she was able to send her daughter to a teachers' training college, to complete construction of the family house, and to take care of other family expenses. She is now able to bring her mother from the village to stay with her so that she can take care of her. She is very grateful to Kiva and would like to continue borrowing to expand her wholesale business. She sells rice, sugar, salt, pepper, palm oil, etc. Yeabu is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 3,426,000.

loans.use: To increase inventory and diversify her business for more income

loans.name: Silivia

texts.en:
Silivia N., 50, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in producing and selling taro and bananas. She and her husband work the plantation and sell to the villagers 3 days per week and also at the market during peak season. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about US $104).

SPBD loans are Silivia’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase equipment (bushknife ,shovel ,axe ,wheelbarrow ,spade) as well as pesticides and other agricultural chemicals.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for a taro and banana plantation

loans.name: Fanny Eva

texts.es:
Fanny C. is 28 years old and lives in the zone of Tembladerani in La Paz. She is single, has one daughter, and is financially independent in that she doesn't need to take money from her parents. Fanny works in the office of an architecture firm in the city.

The loan will be used to buy materials so that she can prepare plans and property registration procedures herself and avoid delays.

The social and economic analysis shows that she is a good candidate for this loan and will be able to repay the it.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Fanny Chávez (28 años) vive en la zona de Tembladerani (La Paz), es soltera y económicamente independiente (no cuenta con ayuda de sus padres y tiene una hija). Fanny trabaja en una oficina de Arquitectura de nuestra ciudad.

El crédito destinado para comprar material y así poder elaborar planos y trámites catastrales, lo que permitirá que desarrolle su trabajo sin las presentes demoras

El análisis social y económico realizado en esta clienta demuestra que esta en aptas condiciones para hacer los pagos del crédito.

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS NEEDED TO PREPARE PROPERTY REGISTRATION DOCUMENTS

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Encarnación

texts.es:
Encarnacion has a bakery which she runs from her house in the zone of Las Lomas, in the city of La Paz. She works together with her husband. This is the second loan she has received from Impro, and she will use it to purchase flour, salt, sugar and other necessary ingredients. Her hard work and impeccable payment history makes her well qualified for this loan.

Encarnación tiene una panadería en su domicilio (zona D. Las Lomas, ladera oeste, ciudad D. La Paz) y trabaja con su esposo donD. realizan pan D. batalla y pan especial. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, por el incremento D. los productos en nuestra ciudad su capital se ha visto mermado, el crédito será destinado para la compra D. insumos (Harina, Sal, Azúcar, y otros). Su trabajo, responsabilidad e impecable historial la califican como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento excelente en el pago D. las cuotas. Por lo que su acceso al crédito no se constituye un peligro.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To invest in the bakery she runs with her husband from their house.  She will purchase flour, salt, sugar and other necessary ingredients.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Lucho Luciano

texts.es:
Lucho works as an electrician and also teaches guitar. He lives in a house located in the zone of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz. In order to build his business as an electrician, he needs to purchase more tools. This is the 10th loan he has received from Impro. His hard work and efforts qualify him to receive this credit. He would like to have his own shop one day.

Lucho realiza trabajos de electricista y también es instructor de guitarra. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. Aún no cuenta con las herramientas necesarias para poder desarrollar su primera ocupación, por lo que necesita dinero para comprar las herramientas de electricidad. Es la décima segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su trabajo y las ganas de superación de Lucho le permiten acceder a este crédito, ya que su objetivo es ser propietario de un taller.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To invest in his business as an electrician, he needs to buy more tools.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel M. P. is 70 years old. He lives alone in his own house, in the zone of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. Daniel works as a bricklayer, working on different construction projects in the city.

In the zone where he lives, the mayors office is helping local residents to install plumbing. The residents must construct bathrooms and provide the connecting pipes. The requested loan is to comply with the city ordinance and construct a bathroom. This is the 9th loan that Daniel has received and the analysis shows he qualifies for this credit.

El señor Daniel M. P. tiene 70 años y vive solo en casa propia, la cuál esta ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz. El empleo de Daniel es la albañilería, trabaja en diferentes construcciones de dicha ciudad. En la zona de su vivienda, la Alcaldía Municipal esta ayudando a los vecinos a la instalación de baños. Se les otorgaron los artefactos sanitarios pero a condición de que los propietarios manden construir el baño y coloquen las tuberías de agua y alcantarillado. El crédito solicitado será destinado para cumplir con la ordenanza municipal (instalación de baño, así como el alcantarillado). Este es el noveno préstamo de Daniel, el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: TO COMPLY WITH THE CITY ORDINANCE TO CONSTRUCT A BATHROOM AND LOCATE PIPES SO HE CAN HAVE ACCESS TO THE NEW CITY PLUMBING

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia V. works in a shop and lives with her parents in the zone of Pura Pura in the city of La Paz. The requested loan will be used to build a room which will be used as a kitchen. This is the 4th loan she has received and the socioeconomic analysis shows that she qualifies to receive this loan.

La señora Claudia C. V. es empleada en un puesto de venta, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pura Pura de la Ciudad de La Paz.. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación que será utilizada como cocina. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente, por lo que puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To construct a new room to be used as a kitchen

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, a native of the province of Azángaro, decided to emigrate to the city of Juliaca when she married Vicente, her inseparable and hardworking husband. They moved in search of better opportunities for their family. Since then, with perseverance and dedication they have succeeded in building a small home to shelter their two adorable children with warmth and love.

After getting settled in her home, Julia was finally able to set aside a space in their home and opened a small grocery store. She began to work with just a small amount of merchandise, but that didn’t stop her customers from visiting her store daily. With the earnings she made, she was able to increase the variety of products, making her store one of the most popular in the area, all thanks to her diligence.

The hope of this determined woman is to obtain a loan that will allow her to increase her products, improve service, and complete every order of her customers. Your generous heart will allow her to carry out her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy, a Kiva volunteer.

Julia, es natural de la provincia de Azángaro, desde que formó su hogar junto a Vicente, su inseparable y trabajador esposo, decidió emigrar hacia la ciudad de Juliaca en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia. Desde entonces con constancia y dedicación han podido construir su pequeña casita para cobijar a sus dos adorables niños bajo el calor y amor de su hogar.Doña Julia, luego de estabilizarse pudo finalmente adecuar un espacio de su vivienda para abrir una tiendita de abarrotes e inició su labor con poca mercadería pero eso no fue razón para que sus clientes dejaran de visitarla a diario con las ganancias que obtuvo pudo aumentar la variedad de sus productos convirtiéndose en una de las bodeguitas más populares de su localidad, todo esto gracias a la buena atención que en todo momento brindó.El deseo de esta perseverante dama es obtener un préstamo que le permita incrementar sus productos, mejorar la atención y cumplir con cada solicitud de sus clientes.Tu generoso corazón permitirá concretar sus planes.

loans.use: Increase of capital to acquire a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Jovana

texts.es:
The sale of CDs, DVDs, and MP3s has turned into a very profitable business for Jovana and her family. Since starting a family she has placed most of her energy on their interests and activities, working toward their success so that she could enjoy peace together with her dear children and her husband, who is musically talented and dreams of one day sharing a stage with his children.

Jovana begins her work at 4:00 pm and finishes at 10:00 pm and in the mornings she makes beautiful knit sweaters and vests with the goal of selling them and generating extra income for her household. She would like to obtain a loan in order to increase the variety of her merchandise so that she can improve sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy, a Kiva volunteer.

La venta de CD, DVD y MP3 se ha convertido en un negocio muy rentable para Jovana y su familia. Desde que formó su familia puso su mayor esfuerzo en todas las actividades a las que se dedicó, con el fin de salir siempre airosa y así gozar de tranquilidad junto a sus amados hijos y esposo quien tiene cualidades especiales para la música y sueña algún día compartir el escenario con sus hijos.Jovana inicia su labor a las 4:00 de la tarde para culminarla a las 10:00 de la noche y por las mañanas confecciona hermosas chompas y chalecos con el objetivo de venderlos y generar ingresos extras para el sustento de su hogar.En esta oportunidad desea obtener un préstamo para aumentar la variedad de su mercadería con el que pretende también mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Increase of capital to elevate production and the sale of articles.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar S. is very thankful to Kiva for the previous loan that has helped him expand and diversify his business. He purchased a second-hand refrigerator and was able to sell cold drinks to the public, especially during the summer. He generated a good income and purchased a desktop computer for keeping records for his business. Abubakar was also able to pay his distance-learning course in business management. With more income, he purchased a photocopier to provide photocopying services to schools around Kabala town. Abubakar now has many customers both for drinks and for photocopying services, but he cannot cope with the demand. He is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 3,426,000 to purchase one more photocopier and reams of A4 papers.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier and reams of A4 papers

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Verónica is a hardworking lady and loving mother of a ten-month-old little boy. Since the birth of Rubén, she has not turned down any work nor has her desire diminished to put forth her best efforts with the goal in mind of providing stability and security for her family. She started out selling a wide variety of fruits during festival days in small nearby towns, always accompanied by her dear little boy, however, due to the discomfort and weariness of her baby she decided to make a change. She is now selling beauty products/cosmetics by order. Thanks to the gift she has for salesmanship and the large number of friendships that she is able to rely on, this business is allowing her to cover all of the necessities of her home. She is now requesting a loan so that she is able to use the capital to keep more beauty products in stock in order to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Kristy.

Verónica es una laboriosa dama y amorosa madre de un pequeño de diez meses. Desde que le concedió el don de la vida a Rubén no ha desestimado ninguna labor ni ha disminuido el deseo de poner su mayor esfuerzo con el fin de ofrecerle estabilidad y seguridad a su familia.Se inició vendiendo una amplia variedad de frutas, los días de feria en los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca, siempre acompañado de su querido niño, pero viendo la incomodidad y cansancio de su bebé decidió cambiar de oficio. Actualmente viene incursionando en la venta de cosméticos de belleza por pedidos, gracias al don de persuasión que tiene para las ventas y a la gran cantidad de amistades con la que cuenta, este negocio le esta permitiendo cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar y el deseo de contar con mayor capital que le permita tener productos de belleza en stock para incrementar sus ganancias la conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase in capital in order to offer a greater selection of cosmetics.

loans.name: Brasilia

texts.es:
Brasilia is an example of perseverance and love. As she goes about her work, she never tires. This diligent mother leaves her home Monday through Friday very early in the morning in order to responsibly complete her daily routine as a cleaning person in the town of Juliaca. On weekends Brasilia puts all of her energy into her business of selling children’s clothing, which she sells inside the San José Market. However, due to the competition that exists in this area and the low demand for these products, she has decided to change her business. She is sure that with your support she will carry out her project of selling wholesale groceries from the facilities in her modest home. With this investment she is sure that her economic returns will improve as will her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Kristy.

Brasilia es un ejemplo de constancia y amor, para ella no existe cansancio cuando desarrolla su labor. Ésta diligente madre de lunes a viernes desde muy temprano abandona su hogar para dirigirse a cumplir responsablemente su jornada del día, debido a que trabaja como personal de limpieza en la municipalidad provincial de Juliaca.Y los fines de semana Brasilia pone su mayor esfuerzo, en su negocio de venta de ropa para niños, mercadería que ofrece al interior del mercado San José de dicha ciudad, pero viendo la competencia que existe en este rubro y la poca demanda por estos productos ha decidido cambiar de negocio, está segura que recibiendo vuestro apoyo concretará su proyecto de vender abarrotes al por mayor desde las instalaciones de su modesto hogar, con esta inversión está segura que mejorarán sus ingresos económicos y la de su amada familia.

loans.use: Introduction of capital in order to develop a new home-based business activity.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is very grateful to Kiva for the last loan of $3,050. She was able to purchase enough palm oil and caustic soda for continuous production. With the income, she assisted her husband to complete construction of the family house and established a grocery shop. Because she can purchase sufficient materials for soap making, she hired more youth and trained them in soap making and earned income from the training. She is thankful to all her lenders who have improved her soap-making business, and she has become one of the major soap wholesalers in Kabala town and the surrounding villages. Musu is requesting more loans to purchase palm oil and store it for use during the off season. This will enable Musu to continue production. She needs Le. 3,426,000.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil for soap production during the off season

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.es:
Mrs. Jacoba is requesting a loan that she will use to do improvements in her home such tiling and the construction of a room. She has worked as a teacher at the School Alfonso Cortés for the past 10 years. She is a hard-working honest and responsible woman who has worked for the good of the community; she has to travel every day in order to teach the children in the rural region of La Ceiba (Nueva Guinea). She has 4 children, the oldest is 18 years old, at present she is studying the first year at the URACCAN University, the second is 15 years old and she is studying fifth year of middle school, the third is 13 years old and he studies first year of middle school and the youngest girl is 10 years old, she is studying fourth year of elementary school. Mrs. Jacoba has the support of her husband, he works as a cabdriver in the urban area Nueva Guinea, they both share the family expenses, her dream is to have a house suited for her family and labor stability this way to help his family, since they are a low income family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Jacoba está solicitando refinanciamiento de su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es embaldosado y construcción de una habitación. Trabaja como docente en la Escuela Alfonso Cortés, desde hace 10 años. Es una mujer trabajadora honesta y responsable que ha trabajado para el bien de la comunidad, tiene que viajar todos los dias a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de comarca La Ceiba (Nueva Guinea). Tiene 4 hijos, la mayor tiene 18 años de edad, actualmente está estudiando I año en la Universidad URACCAN, una de 15 años está estudiando 5to año de educación secundaria, el hijo varón tiene 13 años y estudia 1er año de educación secundaria y su niña menor de 10 años de edad estudia 4to grado de educación primaria. Doña Jacoba cuenta con la ayuda de su marido, el trabaja como taxista en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea, ambos comparte los gastos familiares, su sueño es tener una vivienda con mas condiciones y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia, ya que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos.

loans.use: Tiling and build a room in her house.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Upon deciding to settle in the city of Juliaca with her family, Lidia has fought to make progress and provide peace and education to her three beloved children. This exemplary mother and her husband, Aurelio, have, little by little, established a small workshop, where they transform metal into beautiful doors and windows for orders. At present, they live in the home of her in-laws, where they were able to set aside a space to establish their workshop, but seeing the discomfort and the little space that they have, they long for the day that they have their own premises. With this goal in mind, this diligent family works with determination. In addition to this work, Lidia wants to enter the handicrafts trade. She is sure that knitting and selling her beautiful pieces of clothing will significantly help with her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca junto a su familia Doña Lidia ha luchado por progresar y ofrecerles tranquilidad y educación a sus tres queridos hijos; esta ejemplar madre y su esposo, Aurelio, poco a poco con esfuerzo han implementado un tallercito de transformación de metal en donde fabrican hermosas puertas y ventanas por pedidos.Actualmente viven en el domicilio de sus suegros en donde pudieron adecuar un espacio para instalar su tallercito, pero viendo la incomodidad y el poco espacio con el que cuentan anhelan algún día tener su propio local, con este objetivo en mente ésta diligente familia trabaja perseverantemente y adicionalmente a esta labor Doña Lidia desea incursionar en el oficio de la artesanía, está segura que tejiendo y vendiendo sus hermosas prendas de vestir apoyará considerablemente con los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: To raise capital to enter the handicrafts industry

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa Idalia is requesting her eighth loan that she will invest in improvements in her house. She is adding a new room. She is a teacher of Middle School at the Institute Rubén Darío. She has two children: the oldest is 18 years old and he is studying his fifth year of middle school and a 14-year-old younger daughter who studies 2nd year in the Institute Rubén Darío. In spite that she is single, she is a very responsible and a model mother with her children.
