Mrs. Rosa Idalia is very thankful with AFODENIC since with all the loan granted by the institution she has been able to improve little by little her house. At present she is studying a Bachelor’s Degree at the URACCAN University. Her dream is to be a working professional with a lot of experience, she wants to have labor stability and have a house with all the conditions so her two children can keep on studying.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Idalia está solicitando su octavo refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es la construcción de una habitación. Trabaja como docente de Educación Secundaria en el Instituto Rubén Darío. Tiene dos hijos: el mayor de 18 años de edad el cual esta estudiando su quinto año de educación secundaria y la hija menor de 14 años estudia 2do año en el Instituto Rubén Darío, a pesar que es una madre soltera es una madre ejemplar y muy responsable con sus hijos. Doña Rosa Idalia se siente agradecida con AFODENIC ya que con los créditos otorgados por la institución ha ido poco a poco mejorando su vivienda, actualmente está estudiando una licenciatura en la Univesidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea, su sueño es ser una profesional con mucha experiencia, estabilidad laboral, tener una casa con las todas las condiciones y que sus dos hijos sigan estudiando.

loans.use: Build a bedroom in her house.

loans.name: Marcelina Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs Marcelina Antonia is requesting her second loan that she will invest in improvements in her house. She is changing the roof and a door of her home. She obtains her revenue from her local grocery store. She is a hard-working woman who has the support of her husband. He is a cattle merchant and a bricklayer, and he supports the family expenses every month. She has a young child who is in elementary school. She works every day with lots of effort and love to be able to fulfill her dream, which is to obtain better life conditions and to have better options in society. This lady has an enterprising spirit with her life and family. Her family is very humble and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marcelina Antonia esta solicitando su segundo refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda para poder realizar el cambio del techo y de una puerta de su vivienda, esta clienta obtiene ingreso de su pulperia, es trabajadora, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que es comerciante de ganado y albañil, quien mensualmente aporta para los gastos familiares; tiene un niño menor de edad que estudia educación primaria en la colonia San Juan, realiza su actividad con mucho cariño y amor para poder cumplir su sueñor que es obtener mejores condiciones de vida y tener mejores opciones en la sociedad, esta señora tiene espíritu de emprededora con su vida y su familia, su familia es muy humilde y responsable.

loans.use: Change the roof and a door in her house.

loans.name: Jose Fabian

texts.es:
Mr. Fabian R. is a 29-year-old hard-working young man, he sells soft drinks, stuffed tortillas, tacos and cheese in order to obtain the income to be able to support his partner and his 2 children, 4 and 2 years old respectively. He lives in the city of Juigalpa of the department of Chontales. Mr. R. works hard to improve the condition of his house and the loan money will be use to improve his home. He will be changing the roof in order to avoid the disadvantages of the winter arrival.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Fabian R. es un joven trabajador de 29 años de edad, el se dedica a la venta de refrescos, enchiladas, tacos y quesillos con el fin de obtener ingresos que le ayudan a alimentar a su compañera de vida y a sus 2 hijos, uno de 4 y 2 años respectivamente. Habita en la ciudad de Juigalpa del departamento de Chontales. El Sr. R. lucha por acondicionar su casa y el dinero que reciba lo utilizará para mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo de la misma y asi evitar inconvenientes con la llegada del invierno.

loans.use: Change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng T. makes around $4 per day renting out rooms in her house. Her husband is a soldier with an average income of $1.40 per day. They have two children, one of whom is married and one who works as an electrician. T. lives in Kamkor Village, Battambang Province.

T. is seeking a loan to purchase tools to construct more rooms in her house, as well as decorate the existing room to meet greater demands from tenants. This loan will help her expand her business and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase tools to construct more rooms and decorate existing rooms.

loans.name: Seleisa

texts.en: Seleisa F., 25, is married with 1 children.  She has 4 year(s) of experience in the keke puaa business. She sells to the villagers/public 3 days per week. She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Seleisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. to help for her business needs

loans.use: flour, vegetable oil, bakery powder and sugar, mutton flaps, onion

loans.name: Youb

texts.en:
Youb S., 44, is a widowed farmer who supplements her income selling used clothes in her village and earns around $3 per day. She lives with one child in Pealnhek I Village, Pursat Province. Her child attends primary school.

S. is seeking a loan to purchase fertilizer for her farming business and use the remainder of the loan to purchase more used clothes to sell. These funds will help sustain and expand her businesses to meet growing local demand. She hopes that the Kiva loan will allow her to increase her income and thereby improve living conditions for her and her child.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farming business as well as used clothes for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Vin R., 37, earns approximately $3 per day growing vegetables and rice on her farmland. Her husband, Mr. Chab Han, 44, is a fisherman who earns $2 per day. They live with five young children, all of whom attend school.

Vin R. desires to expand her business in order to support her large family better. Mrs. R. seeks a loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable crop and will use the remainder of the loan to buy piglets to raise. The loan will her sustain and improve her businesses and improve her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable crop as well as buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Gulbibi

texts.ru:
Gulbibi is a widow, she is 46 years old and has two children. Her oldest son is working in Russia and sends money home from time to time. She works in a convenience store. Just this year she has married off her daughter. She used all the money from the business towards the wedding, to buy gifts and organize the event. Right now she is alone and with no help from anyone, she has turned to MicroInvest to help grow her business. She is satisfied with the loan terms and will be able to save money made from her business for any unforeseen expenses in the future.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гулбиби вдова, ей 46 лет у нее двое детей. Старший сын находиться в России на заработке , он время от времени присылает ей деньги , она торгует в магазине продовольственными товарами. В этом году она выдала дочь замуж. С бизнеса то что, было, использовала на свадьбу дочери: покупка приданного, проведение мероприятий. Теперь, когда она одна и не кому ей помочь, она обратилась в «Микроинвест» для восстановления бизнеса, ей понравились условия кредитования и в будущем она может отложить с бизнеса на «черный день» и другие не предвиденные расходы.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the village of Boyuk Bahmanli. Elchin is married and has 3 children. He was born in 1968. He has 5 years of experience in the taxi business. He needs a loan of $975 to buy spare parts for his tax business.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for his tax business

loans.name: Lachin

texts.en: Lachin was born in 1978. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. She is now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the village of Ahmadalilar. Lachin is single. Four years ago she started a business. She needs a loan of $975 to buy goods to improve her business.

loans.use: Buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Saidbek

texts.en:
Saidbek is 28 years old. He is married and has 3 children of school age. All is he doing is for the well-being of his children. Saidbek’s wife is a housekeeper, and she’s taking care of their children. Saidbek’s business is the main source of income for his family. Saidbek started his own business over 10 years ago when he was young, renting a stall in an open-air market of Khujand.

First he began selling the foods on the market. As time went by, he decided to change his business because he was married and the business did not generate enough income to support his family. He began to sell white salt.

He purchases the white salt wholesale from his suppliers. Over seven years of working in this business, Saidbek already has had enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him. Today Saidbek requests 900 $ US Dollars for increasing the stock of goods. Saidbek would like to thank everybody for supporting him, and promises that he will repay the loan in 10 months promptly.

loans.use: Purchasing white salt to increase stock.

loans.name: Allahveran

texts.en: Allahveran was born in 1955. He is married and has 4 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from an Armenian-occupied Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region. He has been in the dairy business for 10 years. He needs a loan of $975 to buy a cow to improve his dairy business.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase machines, materials, threads, and needles.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Action Now: Kenya (ANK) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sadorat

texts.en:
A. Sadorat is 43 is years old. She is a widow and has three children. Sadorat has been running her own small business for 6 years already. After the death of her husband, she was in a difficult situation and had problem with finances. She decided to apply to IMON for a loan.

After receiving the loan she opened a small store near her house. Now her business is stable and is the main source of income for her family. In her store, Sadorat is selling groceries such as sweets, sugar, canning products, soap, washing powder, shampoo, toothpaste and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m.

She is doing all the best to ensure her children the best future and to help them be well-educated. Her daughter helps her in the store registering the stock and serving the clients. Now she requests for a loan of 700 $ US Dollars. Sadorat is planning to spend the loan for purchasing more goods, thus increasing the range of the goods. She promises to repay her loan within 12 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increase the variety of goods.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
A. Alisher is 26 years old. He is married and has a wonderful daughter who was born six month ago. His wife is a housekeeper and she is taking care of their daughter. Alisher is a farmer. He has been farming since he was a young boy. He has eight years of experience, and has been able to support his family by learning how to take care and manage his crops in the short growing season.

He is producing such crops as wheat, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumber and others. Each year he is growing the yield sufficient for the family consumption and for selling. The business is the main source of income, and requires considerable funding. Thus, now Alisher shall need to purchase mineral fertilizer and seeds for planting. He’s asking for a loan of $700. Alisher would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and for improving production. This would increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale. The loan will be repaid in 12 months. With your help, he will get ahead. He thanks all supporting him and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
B. Gulbahor is 40 years old. She is married. Gulbahor is the loving mother of three adorable children. Her husband is a teacher. The profit of her husband was not enough for the family expenses that is why Gulbahor decided to open her own business. She began three years ago selling the footwear. Her elder son Daler helps her with the business. Together with her son they are traveling for the neighboring country Kyrgyzstan, Bishkek city for the wholesale purchasing of the new goods. Only her business allows Gulbahor to support her family. Gulbahor is working hard in order to keep her children satisfied from the life and to ensure them with the best future.
Today she requests the loan in the size of 950 $ US Dollars as she is planning to expand her business and to improve her family budget. Gulbahor promises to pay the loan in 10 months and expresses her gratitude to everyone who trusting and supporting her. Let’s support this brave and selfless woman.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new goods for expanding the business.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
B. Gulbahor is 40 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of three adorable children. Her husband is a teacher. The income of her husband was not enough for the family expenses, so Gulbahor decided to open her own business. She began three years ago selling footwear.

Her elder son Daler helps her with the business. He is pictured in the photo. Together with her son, they are traveling to the neighboring country Kyrgyzstan, Bishkek city, to purchase new goods for wholesale prices. Her business allows Gulbahor to support her family. Gulbahor is working hard to keep her children satisfied and to give them the best future.

Today she requests a loan of 950 $ US Dollars as she is planning to expand her business and to improve her family budget. Gulbahor promises to pay the loan in 10 months and expresses her gratitude to everyone who trusts her and is supporting her. Let’s support this brave and selfless woman.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for expanding the business.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
G. Alisher is 27 years old. He is married and has two adorable kids. He is working hard to ensure them the best future. Alisher has 2 years' experience preparing and selling cookies. He began working with a friend delivering bread. With the money he saved, he decided to buy an oven and now his goal is to work as an independent with his wife.

He works daily from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. selling goods, and from 6 p.m. to 2 a.m. preparing it. The business is successful, generating a stable income, allowing Alisher to support his family. Alisher wants the Kiva loan so he can buy products and necessary equipment to prepare extra cookies, because at this time he is only supplying part of his demand.

With this loan, he wants to expand his business to supply all of his customers goods, and also to create better conditions in the business. With this purpose, he requests 3400 Somoni (1000 $ US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Alisher would like to thank everyone for supporting him, and promises to repay the loan on time. They are greatful this loan will contribute to the well-being of this family. Help them by contributing to the growth of his business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing new equipment for better conditions in the business.

loans.name: Khayri

texts.en:
H. Khayri is 53 years old. She is married with two children. Both of her children are married. Khayri has been running her business for more than five years. She started her business to be able to support her husband and family, as her husband’s income was not enough for the family needs. She rents a place at the market.

She sells shoes for kids. First, she purchased goods from suppliers but now her son is traveling to the neighboring country to purchase new goods. Khayri is trying to purchase goods of good quality and the prices acceptable for the clients with an average level of income.

Being a very nice and friendly woman by her nature, Khayri is working hard and trying to serve her clients so they have a positive experience and want to come back. Now Khayri is planning to purchase new summer shoes for kids in order to increase the variety of goods to sell. With this purpose, she requests 950 $ US Dollars for the term of 10 months. Having a positive credit history, Khayri promises to repay the current loan promptly. She has gratitude for everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for kids in order to increase the variety of goods for selling.

loans.name: Elmir

texts.en: Elmir is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the village of Kayidish, which was built for IDPs. He was born in 1965. Elmir is married and has 3 children. He has run a sheep breeding business for 10 years. He needs a loan of $975 to buy 9 sheep to improve his sheep breeding.

loans.use: Buy 9 sheep.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
H. Shavkat is 34 years old. He is married and the loving father of five children. Shavkat is a farmer. Shavkat is a strong physical and spiritual man. He plows the land to the best of his abilities. Thanks to his energy and high spirit, he has been able to support his family for 10 years and to offer them an education as well. Shavkat sows potatoes, onions, carrots, and tomatoes.

Each year he is growing sufficient crops to feed his family and the rest to sell. At the same time, Shavkat is raises cattle. He buys cattle on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. Now that the business is stable, Shavkat believes it shall be the main income for his family in the future as his dearest children are growing up, and accordingly the expenses are raising.

Today Shavkat requests 600 $ US Dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. Shavkat thanks everyone who trusted him and supports him today. He promises to pay the loan in a timely manner. Be an important part of the growth of Shavkat’s business. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
K. Mohira is 32 years old. She and her husband have raised three children. Now all of her children are studying at school. Her husband has a taxi service.

To improve her family position, Mohira started her business two years ago. She bakes lepeshka, the national bread. She has lots of customers and sells the majority of her products from her own place. However, she also has a trading place in the central local market for selling lepeshka.

Now Mohira requests 2000 Somoni (600 $ US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. She is planning to purchase wholesale flour for her business. From the profit of her business, Mohira wants to send her children to a better school, as she dreams of her children to be well educated. With your help this will be possible. Mohira is grateful for everyone supporting her and promises to manage the loan responsibly.

loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka.”

loans.name: Buston

texts.en:
Kamolov Shavkat is 43 years old. He’s married and the father of five children. His wife is a housekeeper. Thus, Shavkat’s business is the main source of income. Shavkat works hard on the farm in order to make his children happy and to give them a good education. His business includes growing and selling agricultural such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cucumbers, and carrots.

He has worked in agriculture for ten years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. With the beginning of the sowing season, Shavkat is planning to sow onion, potato, and carrot. That is why he wants to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds. He needs a loan of 850 $ US Dollars for the term of 12 months. After gathering his yield, he wants to sell his goods to local inhabitants for lower prices than in the market. Shavkat is promising to be timely in paying the loan. Shavkat is counting on your help. He expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Kamandar

texts.en: Kamandar was born in 1980. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region. Kamandar is single. Five years ago he started a dairy business. He needs a loan of $975 to buy a cow.

loans.use: Buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is a 40-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Souad owns a store that sells products for the home. This is the second time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Jinane

texts.en: Jinane is a 33-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Jinane is in the commerce business. She sells sanitation products and accessories. This is the second time she has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne is a 41-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Suzanne makes handicrafts. This is the first time she is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 41-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Jamila makes handicrafts and accessories. This is the first time she is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en: Tahani is a 32-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Tahani makes handicrafts and accessories. This is the first time she is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en: Fayza is a 40-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Fayza sells gold. This is the first time she is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik has run a dairy business for 10 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region. Malik was born in 1956. He is married and has 2 children. He needs a loan of $750 to buy a cow.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Darine

texts.en: Darine is a 28-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Darine sells fruit juices. She has partnered with two friends to establish her business. This is the first time she is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua. She needs to buy provisions to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Hadya

texts.en: Hadya is a 35-year-old mother of four. She lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Hadya sells clothes in her house. This is the first time she is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 37-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. She owns a grocery store. This is the fifth time she has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Los Angel 2022-11 Group

texts.en:
Joice J., the group leader, has a business selling tea at a restaurant and has applied for this loan in order to expand her business. Joice is 40 years old and is a widow. She has 3 children between the ages of 10 and 27; the children of school age go to school. Each week, Joice makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Joice is joined in her small group by Joise Y., Cilian P., Yunise E., and Perina Lombero. Joise Y. has a business selling rice and fried eggs at a hotel and wants to expand her business. Cilian P. is currently operating a business selling charcoal at home and has applied for this loan in order to build a house for rent. Yunise E. operates a business selling beans, onions and tomatoes at the market and wants to expand her business. Perina Lombero has a business sewing clothes and would use her loan to purchase more sewing machines.

loans.use: To expand a business

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea S. sells fish in the local market in Keo Lart Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Sok Chhim, also assists his wife on the fish-selling business. He usually goes to buy more fish for his wife to resell. Unfortunately, Mrs. Sophea S.’s business now faces a small obstacle because Mrs. Sophea S. does not have enough money to purchase more fish in order to expand her business. Thus, Mrs. Sophea S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 40 and the mother of three children, all of whom attend a local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more fish in order to resell, as well as to expand her business.

loans.name: Magsad

texts.en: Magsad has been in the farming business for  5 years. He was born in 1964. He is married and has 6 children.   Magsad is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region. He needs a loan of $975 to buy the fertilizer and seedlings needed to improve his farming business.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun P. lives in Keo Lart Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a dessert seller in the village. Her husband, Mr. Saroeurn Bil, is a motorbike-taxi driver in the village. They have four children, two of whom are employed as their father in the same business activity. The two remaining are studying in a state school. Although the family members work, the family condition is still in poor. Additionally, they live in an old house, and the roof always leak during rainy season. In order to fix the roof, Mrs. Oun P. needed to access a loan to buy zinc to fix the roof. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To access a loan to buy zinc to fix the roof.

loans.name: Khea

texts.en: Mrs. Khea S. is 30 and is a clothes seller in the local market in Sala Khom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Khea S. obtained a loan from AMK to start her clothing-selling business. Her business now is improved, so she wants to expand her business; unfortunately, Mrs. Khea S. has insufficient money to buy fashionable clothes to sell to her customers. Thus, Mrs. Khea S. decided to ask for a loan to buy them in order to resell, as well as to improve her standard of living. Her husband, Mr. Mano Khouk, is a motorcycle-taxi driver. Mrs. Khea S. has two children; both of them are attending school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fashionable clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sodon

texts.en: Mr. Sodon S. lives in Choeung Snar Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a widower with two children, both of whom are enrolling in school. Mr. Sodon S. is a farmer who raises poultry. His business now faces a small problem because Mr. Sodon S. does not have enough money for duck food; therefore, he needed to request a loan to buy more duck food to feed them.

loans.use: To buy more duck food.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort D. sells fish. She is married and has three children, but her husband's income as a fisherman is insufficient to support the family's living expenses.

Fortunately, there is high demand for Comfort's fish, so she is now looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to increase her profits. Thus, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for her fish by expanding her business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua B. sells salt and fish. She is married, but her husband's income is insufficient to cover their living expenses.

Fortunately, however, there is high demand for Efua's goods, so she is now looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to increase her profits. Therefore, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok K. lives in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a perfume seller. Mrs. Sok K. is a widow whose child is a driver. So in this family has only two members and they are in poor condition even though they have different business activities. Mrs. Sok K. and her child live in an old house where the roof is always leaking during rainy season. In order to fix the roof, Mrs. Sok K. decided to ask for a loan to fix it.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to fix the roof of the house.

loans.name: Lomuku 2004-A Group

texts.en:
Veronica S., the group leader, has a business selling flour and she has applied for this loan in order to purchase more flour to resell. Veronica is 30 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 6 and 20. Her husband is a builder and her children of school age attend school. Each week, Veronica makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Veronica is joined in her small group by Joice K., Tereza S., Magreat F., and Cicilia A.. Joice K. sells bread and wants to expand her business. Tereza S. currently has a business selling bread and cooking oil at the market but would use this loan to build a hotel. Magreat F. operates a business selling tea at a restaurant and hopes to expand the restaurant. Cicilia A. is currently in the business of selling food at a hotel but has applied for this loan in order to buy a taxi for carrying passengers.

loans.use: To buy more flour

loans.name: Gezira 2019-B Group

texts.en:
Monica L., the group leader, currently has a business selling local brew and has applied for this loan in order to open up a bar. Monica is 40 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 7 and 27. Her husband is a teacher and her children of school age attend school. Each week, Monica makes approximately 30 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Monica is joined in her small group by Rose P., Tereza W., Jackline N., and Flora K.. Rose P. also sells local brew but would use her loan to buy flour. Tereza W. sells local brew as well and wants to buy firewood. Jackline N. has a business selling charcoal and wants to stock more charcoal. Flora K. sells bread and has applied for this loan in order to buy cooking oil to resell.

loans.use: To open up a bar

loans.name: Cairo 2003-C Group

texts.en:
Rose K., the group leader, has a business selling tea and has applied for this loan in order to buy more sugar. Rose is 30 years old, married, and has two children aged 8 and 15. Her husband is a driver and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately 75 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Rose is joined in her small group by Rebecca Abuck, Mary A., Lilas T., and Agnes J.. Rebecca Abuck sells bread and wants to expand her business. Mary A. currently sells local brew and would use her loan to buy firewood. Lilas T. also sells local brew and would like to open up a shop. Agnes J. sells local brew as well but would use this loan to begin raising livestock.

loans.use: To buy more sugar

loans.name: Mony

texts.en: Mrs. Mony K. lives in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a perfume seller in the local market. Aside from this business activity, Mrs. Mony K. sells shoes. Previously, Mrs. Mony K. has obtained a loan from AMK to start her two businesses. Her business activities now are improved, so she wants to expand her business; thus, Mrs. Mony K. asked for a loan to purchase more perfume for her customers. The rest of the money would be used to buy more fashionable shoes to resell. Mrs. Mony K. is a widow with four children, one of whom is a driver while one other is working in Korea. A third is studying at a local school, while the youngest child is too young to work or attend school.

loans.use: To purchase more perfume for her customers. The rest of the money would be used to buy more fashionable shoes to resell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married. One of his sons and his family lived in Iran for eight years.

Ali came to Kabul one year ago and opened a photo copy shop. He still works in the shop and now he needs to expand his business. For this reason, he has requested an individual loan to complete his lease payments. He hopes that a larger shop will provide a good income to help better his family.

Ali is very happy because he has access to this loan and he is happy that these loans can help people around the world.

loans.use: To complete his lease payments

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha B. is a tailor in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Hay Vann, is a motorbike-taxi driver. Mrs. Chantha B.’s living condition is still poor because the family members can only generate a small income. In order to make Mrs. Chantha B.’s living condition more improved, Mrs. Chantha B. decided to ask for a loan to buy pigs to raise. The rest of the money would be used to buy more pig food. Mrs. Chantha B. is 29 and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending school while the two others are staying at home because they are too young. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise, and the rest of the money she would use to buy more pig food.

loans.name: Freedom Croop 2018-D Group

texts.en:
Anite P., the group leader, has a business selling tea and has applied for this loan in order to buy more sugar. Anite is 30 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 4 and 18. Her husband is a builder and her children go to school. Each week, Anite makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Anite is joined in her small group by Emelda L., Emelda K., Savina Y., and Jaslino K.. Emelda L. has a business selling clothing and would use her loan to buy more clothes. Emelda K. currently sells beans and flour at the market and would like to expand her business. Savina Y. operates a business selling beans and hopes to open up a shop. Jaslino K. has a business selling clothes but has applied for this loan in order to buy a motor-bike for special hire.

loans.use: To buy more sugar

loans.name: Vuny

texts.en: Mrs. Vuny M. lives in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a car repairer in the local village. Previously, Mrs. Vuny M. obtained a loan from AMK to start a small garage in the village. Her business now is improved, so she wants to expand it but does not have enough money to buy more car equipment for her customers. Thus, Mrs. Vuny M. asked for a loan again to deal with this purpose. Mrs. Vuny M. is a widow with three children, one of whom is a driver while one other is enrolling in school. The youngest child is too young to work or attend school.

loans.use: To buy more car equipment for her customers.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeurn S. owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Last year, Mrs. Khoeurn S. obtained a loan to get her small restaurant opened. Her business now is improved, but Mrs. Khoeurn S. does not want to expand it. She would like to start another pig-breeding business. Thus, Mrs. Khoeurn S. needs to access a loan again in order to buy pigs and pig food for this purpose. She is 46 and a widow with three children, one of whom is a cassette-player repairer while one other is car repairer. The youngest one is attending school.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig food to start another business.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha L. lives in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a mango seller and cricket seller. Previously, Mrs. Chantha L. obtained a loan from AMK to start her business. Her business now is more improved; thus, Mrs. Chantha L. needs to expand it. Unfortunately, Mrs. Chantha L. has insufficient money to buy more mangos and crickets, so Mrs. Chantha L. needed to ask for a loan again. Mrs. Chantha L. is a widow with two children, one of whom owns a beauty salon while the other is attending school.

loans.use: To buy more mangos and crickets to resell.

loans.name: Glory 2008-E Group

texts.en:
Roda K., the group leader, has a business selling food and fried meat. She has applied for this loan in order to build a house for her family. Roda is 40 years old and is a widow. She has four children between the ages of 6 and 22; the children of school age attend school. Each week, Roda makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Roda is joined in her small group by Martha M., Magreat D., Nejuwa J., and Florence P.. Martha M. sells bread and would like to expand business. Magreat D. sells tea and bread and would like to expand her restaurant. Nejuwa J. operates a business sewing clothing and would use the money to buy more sewing materials such as thread. Florence P. is sells charcoal and has applied for this loan in order to buy more charcoal to resell.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Barily

texts.en: Barily lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and he has a construction supplies shop. He works in the shop with one of his brothers and his father. He loves his business. Barily has been involved in this business for more than 5 years in Kabul. He wants to enlarge his shop, so he has requested an individual loan. With the loan, he will buy more supplies for his shop. A larger shop will increase his income, help his brother and his father and make a brighter future for himself.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a larger quantity of clothing to restock a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to retail in her community.

loans.name: London 2014-F Group

texts.en:
Hellen M., the group leader, has a small business selling local brew and has applied for this loan in order to build a house for her family. Hellen is 40 years old and is a widow. She has six children between the ages of 4 and 27; those of school age attend school. Each week, Hellen makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Hellen is joined in her small group by Medina J., Roda F., Joice A., and Mary K.. Medina J. has a business selling clothes and wants to increase the stock of clothes for sale. Roda F. currently has a business selling bread and would use this loan to begin a vegetable garden. Joice A. sells milk and biscuits and would like to expand her shop. Mary K. has a business selling charcoal and has requested this loan in order to buy more charcoal.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh D. is a 31 year old married mother of one. She sells grocery and grows crops to make a living, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband, Mr. Thoun Pheat, is 32 years old and also farms, earning approximately $5 per day.

They are requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more inventory for grocery sales as well as to purchase fertilizer to improve their crop yield. This loan will allow Mrs. D. to expand her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for grocery sales as well as to purchase fertilizer to raise their crop yield

location.town: Spean Krong Village, Kampong Thom Province

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her food products by expanding her business.

loans.name: Ahmed M.

texts.en: Ahmed is very grateful to Kiva for the last loan or $1200. He said that the loan has lifted him from poverty. Ahmed increased his inventory and diversified his business. He purchased palm oil and exported it to Guinea. With the income, he purchased a motor bike to provide transport services to the public, and he earns a net profit of $200 per month from the motor bike business. Ahmed also repaired his house and managed to send one of his children to college. He is very thankful to Kiva and would like to take more loans to continue expanding his business. He said that Le. 3,426,000 will help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To increase inventory and diversify his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in beauty products to retail in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for her fruits by expanding her business.

loans.name: Samweli John's Rubi Group

texts.en:
Samweli J., age 27, lives in Dar es Salaam with his six-year-old daughter. He manages a water distribution business that he started three years ago. He works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm.

His business currently returns profits of $262. He has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy a water tank, which is necessary for his business. He hopes for a new loan to buy a bigger water tank.

He will be sharing this loan with his group members, who are involved in several businesses, including operating hair salons, fishing, and selling cold drinks and food. These members form a group that is responsible for paying back the loan. Each member guarantees the others to ensure full payback.

loans.use: To buy a bigger water tank

loans.name: Freedom 2030-G Group

texts.en:
Awadia M., the group leader, has a business selling food at a hotel and has applied for this loan in order to buy furniture for the hotel. Awadia is 30 years old, married, and has two children aged 2 and 8. Her husband is a Minister for education, science and technology and her children go to school. Each week, Awadia makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Awadia is joined in her small group by Awadia Sabit, Grace E., Tereza S., and Mary K.. Awadia Sabit makes tea in a restaurant and would like to buy more sugar, tea leaves and milk. Grace E. currently has a business selling bread and has applied for this loan in order to buy cooking oil and flour to sell. Tereza S. sells onions and tomatoes at the market and would like to open up a shop. Mary K. sells beans and onions at the market and hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy furniture for a hotel

loans.name: Mir Ahammd

texts.en: Mir Ahammd lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is uneducated and he has a small business, a bakery. He is new in this busniess and he has 5 employees. He wants to enlarge his bakery, so he has requested an individual loan from AFSG. The loan will allow him to complete his lease payments and grow his shop. A larger shop will attract more clients and generate a good monthly income to help his family. Mir Ahammd also hopes that a larger shop will provide a good foundation for his business in the future.

loans.use: To complete his lease payments

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is educated, single, and she has a beauty salon. She is very talented for her line of work and is very popular in the area. However, she needs to change the designs of her beauty salon. Therefore, she has requested an individual loan to start working on her shop and complete her inventory. This will allow her to further her business, gain more success and help her family. She is happy because of this process, especially for women in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her soup by expanding her business.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mr. San M., and his wife, Mrs. Phan Long were married in 1980. They have two sons and two daughters. Two of their children are garment workers, one is a motorcycle taxi driver, and the youngest one is in school. The family lives along National Road number two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. San has been a motor remoque taxi driver for two years. A remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back. He carries people from his village to Phnom Penh, while Mrs. Phan cuts grass to sell as cattle feed. Mr. San is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to work.

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-At M., 37, and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Aum, 42, live on an Island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1988 and have one son and two daughters. One of their children weaves silk at home and the other two children attend the local school.

Mrs. Sam-At has been a silk weaver for eighteen years, having acquired the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Besides her silk production business, she raises pigs. Mr. Chamroeun has been a teacher for twenty years. Mrs. Sam-At is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase piglets for raising.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for raising.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget P., 51, and her husband, Mr. Seng Ry, 68, live in a Phnom Penh suburb. They were married in 1973 and have one son and seven daughters. Five of their children are married, two of whom live in the family home. Her other two daughters are garment factory workers.

Mrs. Nget and her husband have been farming since 1979. They grow rice and other vegetables, such as morning glory, wax melons, pumpkins, and cucumbers on their farm in the village. Mrs. Nget is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase rice seed, pay fees for plowing, transplant rice seedlings, and dig one well.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, pay fees for plowing, transplant rice seedlings, and dig one well.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. sells rice and stew to students. She is married and has four children, but her husband's income as a teacher is insufficient to cover the family's daily living expenses.

However, the demand for her goods is quite high, so she is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to increase her profits. Thus, she is seeking additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her food by expanding her business.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. Thy S. (photographed with the duck’s feed behind him), 51, and his wife, Mrs. Kan Chea, 51, live in a Phnom Penh suburb. They were married in 1981 and have one son and two daughters. Two of their children are married and raise ducks, and the youngest daughter is a garment factory worker.

Mr. Thy and his wife have been in the business of raising ducks since 1990. Currently, they are raising 550 ducks at the farm near the house. They sell the duck eggs at a market not very far from their home. He is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase feed for raising ducks.

loans.use: To purchase feed for raising ducks.

loans.name: Sakhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sakhorn O., 50, and her husband, Mr. Heng Leng, 56, live in a small village across from the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1978 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. Four of their children have full time employment and the other four are in school.

Mrs. Sakhorn has been in the business of selling silk products and mosquito nets for three years. She buys them from weavers in her village to then sell in a nearby province. Mr. Heng has been a carpenter for thirty years. The couple hopes to continue to increase their business so that they can support their children’s studies to the highest possible level. She is requesting her first loan, in the amount of US$300, to purchase silk products and mosquito nets for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk products and mosquito nets for resale

loans.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthoeun P., 25, lives with her parents on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is a widow with one son and one daughter. Both of her children are still young and stay at home.

Mrs. Chanthoeun has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her parents have been in the business of selling cows for twenty years. She is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk materials for weaving and to expand her parent’s business of selling cows.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and expand the business of selling cows.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Mrs. Simon Y., 39, and her husband, Mr. Pov Sat, 38, live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of their children are in school.

Mrs. Simon has been a silk weaver for twenty years, having acquired the skill from her mother. Her husband is also a weaver. They sell their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. They have two looms in the family. Mrs. Simon is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mr. Thol M., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Sam-at Tem (shown in the picture) were married in 2000. They have three children, one son and two daughters, one of whom is in school. The family lives along National Road number five, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mr. Thol is not in the picture because he was busy driving villagers to Phnom Penh and we took his wife’s picture instead of his.

Mr. Thol has been in the business of driving a motor remoque (a motorcycle with a trailer at the back) taxi for many years. He transports villagers back and forth from his village to Phnom Penh, while his wife stays at home to take care of the children. Currently, his motorcycle is very old and he needs to buy a new one. Therefore, Mr. Thol is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase a new motorcycle to continue driving a motor remoque taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for his motor remoque taxi business.

loans.name: Saleang

texts.en:
Mrs. Saleang K., 28, and her husband, Mr. Sina Koe, 27, live in a small village across from the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2001 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Their daughter attends the local school and the son is still young and stays at home.

Mrs. Saleang has been in the business of selling vegetables for ten years. She buys them from the Dem Kor market to resell at the Central market in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sina has been a security guard in Central market for ten years. The couple wants to buy a motorcycle to carry vegetables to sell and also use for the family's transportation. Mrs. Saleang is requesting her second loan, in the amount of US$1,000, to purchase a motorcycle to drive to work and to expand her business of selling vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to drive to work and to expand vegetable sales

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza J. is 20 years old and lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan, where she runs her own small trading business. Mrs. J. applied for her first MicroInvest loan earlier this year, right after learning about our organization and its advantageous loan terms and procedures. She used her loan to expand her business, which consisted of selling material that her customers used to make popular Tajik-style national dresses. Mrs. J. has since expanded her business so that she now also sells ready-made national dresses. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy seasonal materials and additional national dresses. She will repay the loan in eight months.

loans.use: to import seasonal materials and dresses for resale

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en: Mutabar T. became a client of MicroInvest earlier this year, when she applied for her first loan. She succeeded in paying this loan back on time while also expanding her business and her income. Mrs. T. lives in the high mountains of the Asht region of Taijikistan, where raising livestock and making yarn are the main businesses. Mrs. T. supports herself by making and selling yarn and warm socks in the local bazaar, where she has many repeat customers. She has been in this business for 10 years and knows it very well. Mrs. T. has applied for a Kiva loan to open up her own shop. She will repay the loan in eight months.

loans.use: to open her own shop

loans.name: Ndiaga

texts.fr:
Ndiaga T. is a single young man who lives with his brothers in the district HERSENT DE THIES. He is 34 years old and has been working as a tailor for a few years. He has a cantine in the Khelcom marketplace and has two sewing machines and a few apprentices. With the funds he is requesting, he wants to buy a new machine in order to finish his customers' orders and to better meet their demands.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

ndiaga T. est un jeune célibataire qui vit avec ses frères au quartier HERSENT DE THIES .il est agé de 34 ans et exerce la profession de tailleur depuis quelques années .il a une cantine au marché khelcom et dispose de deux machines à coudre et de quelques apprentis .avec la somme qu'il sollicite il veut acheter une nouvelle machine en vue de terminer ses commandes et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Javhar

texts.en: Javhar S.  is 47 years old and married with two children. He lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan, where he raises livestock. He is been in this business for the last five years, and also works in the local collective farm. Mr. S. owns cows and rams, and enjoys what he does because he likes raising animals and being around them.  Mr. S. has applied for a Kiva loan to expand his business by buying a pedigreed bull.  He will repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: to buy a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of drugs and integrate other services into her medical clinic.

loans.name: Ezinah

texts.en:
Ezinah is a nurse/widwife who serves clients mostly from the Manyatta slums of Kisumu. She is the proprietor of Mt Everest Medical Clinic. She offers general curative services, family planning, counseling, and maternal and child health services, and also runs a pharmacy and laboratory.

Ezinah requires $1200.00 to enable her to improve on quality of services in her facility.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To improve the quality of services in her clinic.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr:
Mr. G. is a metal worker who lives in the district of DIAMAG. DE THIES. He is a specialist in making doors and windows that he sells to customers. For the goal of improving his income, he is asking for this loan in order to buy raw materials for fabricating tents, which he is going place on site for family ceremonies or functions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

mr G. est un menuisier métallique qui vit au quartier DIAMAG. DE THIES.il est spécialisé dans la fabrication de portes et fenetres qu'il revend à ses clients .c'est dans le but d'améliorer ses revenus qu'il demande ce pret pour acheter des matières premières avec lesquelles il pourra fabriquer des tentes qu'il va mettre en location lors des cérémonies familiales.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make tents to rent out

loans.name: Ahmirza

texts.en: Ahmirza U. lives the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan with his wife and five children. As is the case with many of his fellow villagers, he raises livestock for a llving. He owns cows, bulls and several rams, and earns his income from selling their milk and meat. Because he has been in this line of work for 40 years, he is very experienced at what he does.  He also occasionally works at the local collective farm. Mr. U. has applied to Kiva for a loan to open up a shop from which to sell his goods.  He will repay the loan in six months.

loans.use: to open a shop.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is the proprietor of Major Medical Clinic based in Kipsaina Kitale. He is a trained nurse/midwife, offering comprehensive reproductive health services in his clinic.

Joshua attributes his success to hard work, perseverance, and financial assistance from K-MET/KIVA. He requires $1200.00 to enable him to purchase stock of drugs in bulk.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stock of drugs for his medical clinic.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Oisanam

texts.en: Oisanam N. was born in 1957 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married, has six children and supports her family by raising livestock and selling various products that her animals produce. Her husband helps her in this business. Mrs. N. also produces yarn and various milk products, and sells them in town while her children care for the herd. Mrs. N., who is very skilled at what she does becaue she has been doing it for the past 40 years, has applied to Kiva for a six-month loan to expand her business by buying a pedigree bull.

loans.use: to buy a pedigree bull.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson M. is a 36 year-old trained clinical officer. He is the proprietor of Makutano Medical Clinic based in the Meru Eastern part of Kenya. He offers various health services, such as family planning and maternal and child health, and also runs a pharmacy and a laboratory.

Jackson attributes his success to hard work, perseverance, and financial assistance from K-MET/KIVA. He requires $1200.00 to enable him integrate other services into his facility.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To integrate other services into his medical clinic.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Zijada

texts.en: Zijada is requesting 1000 KM to expand her farming business in the small village of Jaruške.  Like many women in this rural village of Bosnia, she supports her family by raising poultry, and selling eggs, milk and milk products.  She is requesting this loan to help repair her tractor, which she will use to plow the nearby field and plant vegetables.  Zijada hopes that this additional business will help grow her family's monthly salary.  She also hopes to grow organic vegetables, so that the produce will be healthier.

loans.use: Repair her tractor.

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr:
Matar K. is a young craftsman living in the district HERSENT DE THIES. He is married and has two children. His business consists of making camp-beds that he sells at the local market and to tourists. With this loan, he would like to buy raw materials to make beds in bulk before the rainy season.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Matar K. est un jeune artisan vivant au quartier HERSENT DE THIES .il est marié et père de deux enfants . son activité consiste à confectionner des lits de campagne qu'il revend sur le marché local et aux touristes .avec ce pret il veut acheter des matières premières pour fabriquer des lits en quantité avant l'arrivée de l'hivernage .

loans.use: To produce camp-beds

loans.name: Kisa

texts.en: Kisa is a 29 year old woman from Dubnici, a small village near the town of Kalesija. She is married and has two children. Kisa works in agriculture, poultry. and cattle-breeding. She sells eggs, milk, and milk products. She can earn about 300 KM monthly. Her husband works as  a seasonal construction worker. When he works he can earn about 400 KM monthly. Kisa will use this loan, in the amount of 600 KM, to buy chickens, which will be used to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim H., 40, lives in small southern village in the Imishli region. He is married and has two sons.

He owns a store where he sells spare parts and other products for automobiles. This store is the only source of income for the family. Salim has applied for a loan to purchase spare car parts that are in high demand from his customers. These additional sales will increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more automobile spare parts

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad S., 48, owns a grocery store in the small village of Imishli. He is married and has three children.

Fuad has more than twenty years of experience in this business. He would like a loan to increase the number of goods in his store, thus improving his sales and profit.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of food products for resale

loans.name: Amira

texts.en: Amira was born in 1974. She lives with her husband in a small village called Dubnica, near the town of Kalesija. Amira works in agriculture, poultry, and cattle-breeding. Amira sells eggs, milk and milk products. She earns about 300 KM monthly. Amira is using money that she earns to buy books, which are very expensive, for her two sons. Her husband is a seasonal construction worker. Because he does not work regularly, her job is important to their monthly income.This is her first loan at MCO WWI and it amounts to 600 KM. She intends to use this loan to buy more chickens to increase her family's monthly income.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Zarovsha

texts.en:
Zarovsha M. is a married, 45-year-old woman with four children.The family lives in the 'Internally Displaced People Settlement' within the Bilasuvar region.

She has been breeding sheep for meat production for more than 20 years Summer is high season for weddings and thus a high demand for meat. Zarovsha would like to meet this demand by using a loan to expand her sheep herd. Her business is the only source of income for her family and she is barely covering the basic family needs.

Zarovsha is asking for the loan to purchase fifteen sheep and fodder to feed them.

loans.use: To purchase fifteen additional sheep and fodder

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en: Rafael I., 48, sells milk to the local milk factory. He has more than 20 years' experience in raising cows. Rafael, his wife and their four children live in the southern region of Bilasuvar, in the Internally Displaced People Settlement. He works as a teacher in a local school and receives social support in the amount of $70 US as an Internally Displaced Person. But the combined salary of $30 US and social support is just not enough to cover basic family needs. To somehow improve his condition he started keeping a cow, but the milk from that cow goes to family needs rather than to the milk factory. Rafael thinks that he needs an additional two cows to expand his milk sales to the factory; they will increase his income and improve his life condition. For this purpose he is applying for $1200 US.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mauna West 2024-1 Group

texts.en:
Joice A., the group leader, has a business selling water at a hotel and has requested this loan so that she can buy more refrigerators. Joice is 35 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 4 and 15. Her husband is a businessman and her children go to school. Each week, Joice makes approximately 750 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Joice is joined in her small group by Suzan T., Janet O., Loice P., and Lona T.. Suzan T. sells beer at a bar and wants to expand her business. Janet O. currently sells food at the hotel and wants a loan to buy additional cooking oil and flour to sell. Loice P. operates a business selling local brew and would like to open up a shop. Lona T. has a business selling bread and has requested this loan in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more refrigerators

loans.name: Turbat

texts.en: Turbat G. is a 53-year-old farmer who sells milk and yoghurt to the local milk factory. He has experience in milk selling for more than 20 years. But before the milk factory opened he was selling milk to the local bazaar people and bazaar traders. He is married and has 3 sons and 1 daughter, and is very proud that all the boys help him to look after the cows. Turbat also works as a teacher in the local school and gets social support of $70 US as an Internally Displaced Person. But Turbat's main financial source is selling milk and he is focused on expanding his business and purchasing two milk cows. For this purpose he is applying for $1200 US to buy the two cows.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia M. sells various foods, including beans and groundnuts. She is married and has two children, but her husband's income as a teacher is insufficient to support her family's living expenses.

Fortunately, the demand for her goods is high, so she is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business and to, in turn, increase her profits. As such, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her food products by expanding her business

loans.name: Agamali

texts.en: Agamali Q. is a 47-year-old trader who sells food, vegetables and fruits in the southern part of Azerbaijan in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. He has more than 20 years of experience as a trader and is married and has three children. Agamali has rented a garage and most of the time he sells goods on the street. His dream is to build a normal shop and continue his work there rather than on the streets. For this purpose he is applying for $800 US.

loans.use: To improve his workplace

loans.name: Akouélé Léontine

texts.fr:
Born December 31st, 1968 in Aklakougan in Togo, Mrs. Akouélé Léontine is married and the mother of two children. Since 1999, she has been running a shop selling ready-to-wear clothing not far from Lomé’s main market. In her ready-to-wear shop (ETS LEONCE), one can find fabric, shoes, clothing, scarves, etc. She orders goods from China so that she can sell cheaply and allow everyone to be able to shop and dress. This is her second loan and she is seeking to borrow 500,000 Francs CFA to supplement her own financing in order to be able to buy five bulk bundles of clothing.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 31 décembre 1968 à Aklakougan au Togo, Madame S. Akouélé Léontine est mariée et a deux (2) enfants. Depuis 1999, elle a ouvert une boutique de vente de prêt-à-porter non loin du grand marché de Lomé. Dans sa boutique de prêt-à-porter (ETS LEONCE), on peut trouver des pagnes, des chaussures, des vêtements, des foulards etc. Elle fait sa commande depuis la chine afin de pouvoir vendre moins cher et permettre à tout le monde de pouvoir se vertir. Elle est à son 2ème crédit et sollicite un crédit de 500.000FCFA pour augmenter son fonds propres afin de pouvoir faire des achats de 5 ballots de vêtements.

loans.use: Purchase of five bulk bundles of clothing

loans.name: Lobanok South 2006-2 Group

texts.en:
Lina M., the group leader, currently runs a hotel and has requested this loan in order to expand her business. Lina is 31 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 2 and 8. Her husband is a security guard and her children go to school. Each week, Lina makes approximately 240 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Lina is joined in her small group by Elizabeth Foni, Asunta W., M. L., and L. W.. Elizabeth Foni sells beer at a bar and wants to expand her business. Asunta W. currently sells bread at the market and would use this loan to build a bakery. M. L. has a business selling vegetables and hopes to open up a shop. L. W. sells alcohol but would use the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To expand a hotel

loans.name: La Buena Nueva Group

texts.en:
Working to support her five children, Juana B. has started her own business of selling and refilling propane.  She lives on the outskirts of Samana in the Domincian Republic.  Juana has established a positive repayment record with Esperanza with her previous four loans that she has completed.  This particular loan will be used to purchase more propane canisters as well as the liquid fuel itself.  When she is not working, Juana spends most of her time attending to her four children (ages 1, 3, 5, and 10) who are still living in the house.  It is her goal to one day own the property that she is currently renting to run her business.

Juana Barett is just one member of the 5 person micro-bank, La Buena Nueva.  Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own.  The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

On behalf of Juana, La Buena Nueva group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase more propane and gas canisters for her business.

loans.name: Valeh

texts.en: Valeh M. is a 48-year-old man who sells dairy and breeds calves for meat production in the southern region of Bilasuvar in the Internally Displaced People Settlement. He has more than 15 years of experience in this field. His main source of income for his wife and four children is selling calves, and the cow is just for family needs. As summer is high season for wedding parties, Valeh would like to expand his business and sell calves during this period. For this purpose Valeh applied for $900 US to purchase three calves for $300 US each.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Possisso

texts.fr:
Mr. Possisso K. was born June 3rd, 1983 in Patatoukou in Amou prefecture. Single, he is a carpenter and woodworker in Lomé’s Totsi neighborhood. In 2005, he opened his workshop called “AMEUBLEMENT KEVINPOSS.” Because of his work quality, he consistently wins construction contracts and makes a good income. Currently he is lacking certain work tools. This is his first loan and he is seeking to borrow 300,000 Francs CFA to buy a drill, a sharpener, and an electric generator. The plan to buy a generator is timely because there is a failure to provide electricity in the Totsi neighborhood.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Possisso est né le 03 juin 1983 à Patatoukou dans la préfecture d’Amou. Célibataire, il est un charpentier menuisier dans le quartier Totsi à Lomé. En 2005, il a ouvert son atelier « AMEUBLEUMENT KEVINPOSS ». Compte tenu de son travail bien fait, il gagne toujours des marchés de construction et en tire assez de revenus. Présentement, il manque de certains outils de travail. Il est à son premier crédit et sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA pour acheter une perceuse, une meule et un groupe électrogène. La prévision d’achat du groupe électrogène vient a point nommé car il y a défaillance dans la fourniture de l’énergie électrique dans le quartier de Totsi.

loans.use: Purchase of a drill, a sharpener, and an electric generator

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. sells clothing, panties, mosquito coils, and cell phone unit transfers. She is single and has two children, yet her income is insufficient to pay for her and her children's daily living expenses.

Nonetheless, demand for her goods is high, so she is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business to thereby increase her profits. For that reason, she is seeking additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha M. sells fabric and clothing that she has sewn. She is married and has four children, but her husband's income from his job with Ghana Railway is insufficient to pay for all of their family's living expenses.

Fortunately, there is high demand for her goods, so she is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business to thereby increase her profits. Therefore, she is seeking additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Gonogorik 2020-3 Group

texts.en:
Hellen K., the group leader, currently has a business selling bread and has requested this loan in order to open a shop. Hellen is 24 years old, married, and has two children aged 2 and 8. Her husband is a businessman and her children go to school. Each week, Hellen makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Hellen is joined in her small group by Christine A., Cicilia J. and Mary L.. Christine A. sells sweets and chocolate at the market and wants to open up a bigger shop. Cicilia J. is currently operating a business that sells fish and would use this loan to import more fish from neighbouring countries such as Uganda. Mary L. sells local brew from home and wants to open up a bar.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes T. sells charcoal and local dishes such as gari, kenkey, and maize. She is married and has four children, but her husband's income as a fisherman is insufficient to cover their family's living expenses.

Fortunately, demand for her goods is high, so she is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to increase her profits. As such, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her products by expanding her business.

loans.name: Rock City 2030-4 Group

texts.en:
Jane K., the group leader, is currently in the business of selling bread but has applied for this loan in order to buy a photo-copying machine. Jane is 40 years old, married, and has two children aged 7 and 14. Her husband is a peasant and both of her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Jane is joined in her small group by Grace M., Sarah I., Marsilina K., and Agnes N.. Grace M. has a business selling charcoal and wants to buy a generator. Sarah I. has applied for this loan in order to import more beer for her bar. Marsilina K. operates a business selling local brew from home; however, she would like to begin selling clothes and would use this loan to buy inventory. Agnes N. currently runs a hotel and is requesting a loan to build a lodge.

loans.use: To buy a photo-copying machine

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr:
Mr. Essohanam E. was born January 13th, 1980 in Pagouda in northern Togo. He is single and has opened a business called “SARDES” which sells plastic chairs and tables. He started this business in 1998 with ten plastic chairs. Recently his business grew and he is welcoming many customers. Mr. Essohanam E. buys in bulk in Ghana and then sells to retailers before displaying the rest in his store. The first loan he is seeking from WAGES will allow him to buy 120 plastic chairs and 15 plastic tables.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur E. Essohanam est né le 13 janvier 1980 à Pagouda au nord du Togo. Il est célibataire et a ouvert un établissement « SARDES » de vente des chaises et tables en plastiques. Il a commencé cette activité en 1998 avec 10 chaises plastiques. Actuellement dans son établissement grandit et il accueil aussi beaucoup de clients. Monsieur E. Essohanam fait ses achats en gros au Ghana et vend aux détaillants avant d’exposer le reste dans son établissement. Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite auprès de WAGES lui permettra d’acheter 120 chaises et 15 tables plastiques.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic chairs and tables

loans.name: Bismark

texts.en:
Bismark N. is a carpenter. He is married and has two children, but his wife's income from the goods she sells is insufficient to pay for the family's living expenses.

Nevertheless, Bismark is encouraged by the fact that the demand for his goods is high, so he is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding his business in order to increase his profits. Therefore, he is seeking additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for his goods by expanding his business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. sells various foods, including rice, canned tomatoes, and other such provisions. She is married and has three children, but her husband's income from selling bulk fish to hotels is insufficient to cover the family's living expenses.

Fortunately, there is always high demand for her goods, so she is hoping to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to increase her profits. Thus, she is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is very grateful to all Kiva lenders who made her life better as compared to a year ago. She had a small kiosk, but with the loan she increased her stock, earned more income, and purchased a motor bike for transport services in the city. Her income increased, and she diversified her business. She now supplies retailers, especially women, with clothes, sandals, headscarves, and other African prints. Zainab invested part of her income to repair the family house. She is very thankful to Kiva, and she said, "My business, family, and life have changed for the better because of Kiva." Zainab would like to continue building her economic status and is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 3,426,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase her wholesale inventory

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
