Ama W. sells fish and owns a canoe. She is married and has two children, but her husband's income as a fisherman is insufficient to adequately cover her family's living expenses.

However, demand for her goods is high, so she is seeking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business and, in turn, to increase her profits. For that reason, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. sells fish. She is married and has two children, but her husband's income as a taxidriver is insufficient to cover the family's living expenses.

Fortunately, there is a high demand for her goods, so she is now seeking to expand her business to capitalize on such demand and, in turn, to increase her profits. Consequently, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the increasing demand for her goods by expanding her business

loans.name: Arinzechwkwu

texts.fr:
Born on October 14, 1964 in Umunze in Nigeria, Monsieur Arinzechukwu O. is single with four children in his care. In 2002 he opened a telephone center called “TELECOMMUNICATION CENTER." In his centre he sells mobile phones, telephone accessories and bottles of gas. He also has a telephone kiosk.

This first loan that he is requesting will allow him to purchase 20 Nokia cell phones and three bottles of gas.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Né le 14 octobre 1964 à Umunze au Nigeria, monsieur O. Arinzechukwu est célibataire avec 4 enfants à charge. Il a ouvert un centre de téléphonie qu’il dénomme « TELECOMMUNICATION CENTER » en 2002. Dans son centre, il vend des téléphones portables et ses accessoires, des bouteilles de gaz. Il dispose également d’une cabine téléphonique.

Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir 20 cellulaires de marque NOKIA et 3 bouteilles de gaz.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and bottles of gas.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame A. sells detergent and washing soaps. She is single, and her income is not sufficient to cover her living expenses.

Luckily, there is high demand for her goods, so she is now seeking to expand her business and to thereby increase her profits. As such, she is asking for additional capital in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Women In Need Group

texts.en: Salley C. is 37 years old and married with 6 children. Married to a police officer whose salary is insufficient to meet all the family's needs, Salley had to start a business to generate income for the family. She sells palm oil and produces tie-dye materials in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. With her previous loan, Salley was able to increase her income by 25%. This enabled her to meet her children's school requirements and other family expenses. Like Salley, the other group members are also engaged in food selling. The members would like to expand their businesses and are therefore requesting a loan of Le. 4,000,000 (Le. 800,000 for each entrepreneur).

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for their businesses

loans.name: Bianeth

texts.es:
Bianeth and Roberto are a young married couple and are parents of an enchanting girl named Anaí, who is the light in their eyes and the driving force that pushes them to make progress. Bianeth sells fruit in the small towns that border the city of Juliaca and, with this business, is able to cover an important part of her household expenses. While she does this, her husband Roberto works as a construction supervisor. Both are making an effort and are succeeding at improving their quality of life. In addition to these professions, this diligent couple rents out tricycles, earning income that is important for the well-being of their home. Bianeth would like to increase the variety and quality of her products and is certain that making this investment will optimize her income.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Bianeth y Roberto, son una pareja de esposos jóvenes y padres de una encantadora niña llamada Anaí, quien es la luz de sus ojos y el motor que los impulsa a progresar, Bianeth se dedica a la venta de frutas en los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad de Juliaca y encontró en este negocio la manera de cubrir parte importante de las necesidades de su hogar. Mientras ella se dedica a esta labor su esposo Roberto trabaja como maestro de construcción y entre ambos con esfuerzo están logrando mejorar su calidad de vida, adicionalmente a estos oficios esta diligente pareja se dedica al alquiler de triciclos, obteniendo ingresos indispensables para el bienestar de su hogar. Bianeth tiene en mente aumentar la variedad y calidad de sus productos y está segura que haciendo esta inversión optimizará sus ingresos.

loans.use: To raise capital to increase her merchandise and profits

loans.name: Tanekasu Group

texts.en: Isatu K. is very grateful to Kiva for the loan of $175. Isatu is a group leader, and because of her honesty in repaying her loan on time, SMT, with her approval, recommended other group members for a Kiva loan. The group members sell foodstuffs in the market of Magburaka and have been managing their businesses for more than 3 years. The members use their income to supplement their families' income. They are grateful for the loan program and are requesting a loan of Le. 1,600,000 to increase their inventories.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of rice, onions, peanut butter, palm oil, chili pepper, and salt

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica A. sells provisions for a living. She is married and has four children, but her husband's income from driving a taxi is insufficient to cover the family's expenses.

Fortunately, there is high demand for her goods, so she is looking to expand her business and to thereby increase her profits. Accordingly, she is asking for additional capital so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional provisions

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
The business of buying and selling cheese is the most important source of income for Margarita’s family. Since she established her homestead, Margarita decided to settle in the city of Juliaca. She purchases her merchandise in the district of Taraco and sells the goods at wholesale in the Túpac Amaru market in Juliaca. While she puts a lot of effort into this activity, her hard-working husband works as a foreman. Between the two activities, Margarita and her husband try to provide peace and well-being to their three beloved children. The couple would like to give their children the gift of an education. At this time, Margarita needs your support to increase the amount of her investment and, in this way, to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de compra y venta de quesos se convirtió en el ingreso económico más importante de la familia de Doña Margarita quien desde que formó su hogar decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca.Margarita adquiere su mercadería en el distrito de Taraco y los vende al por mayor y menor en el mercado Túpac Amaru de la ciudad de Juliaca, mientras ella pone su mayor esfuerzo en esta actividad su laborioso esposo trabaja como maestro de obras y entre los dos tratan de ofrecerles tranquilidad y bienestar a sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desean entregarles el regalo más grande, educación.En esta oportunidad doña Margarita requiere de tu apoyo, con el fin de acrecentar el monto de su inversión y de esa manera incrementar sus beneficios.

loans.use: To raise capital to offer more cheese

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Tatesuple Group

texts.en: Abdul K. is 45 years old and married with 6 children. He sells cigarettes and candies in Magburaka town. With his previous loan from SMT, he expanded his business and also established a food market stall in Bagburaka town for his wife's business. The 2 other group members also sell the same items. They are therefore requesting a loan of Le. 2,800,000.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of cigarettes, boxes of matches, candies, etc

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda and Justino are a young couple, but their incomes do not allow them to finish high school. Since they came together, they have only thought about getting ahead and providing for the well-being of their two-year-old daughter, Sonia. They left their native town, Pusi, with the hope of improving their quality of life. Now, with strength and determination, they are succeeding. They make beautiful, comfortable chairs and collapsible tables that they distribute in various furniture stores in the city of Juliaca. This couple wants to secure a loan to invest in the purchase of more materials and fulfill their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda y Justino son una pareja de esposos muy jóvenes pero sus posibilidades económicas no les permitieron concluir sus estudios secundarios, desde que se unieron sólo tuvieron en mente salir adelante y ofrecerle bienestar a su pequeña niña, Sonia de 2 añitos de edad.Salieron de su pueblo natal, Pusi, con la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida y ahora con esfuerzo y empeño lo están logrando.Se dedican a la fabricación de hermosas y cómodas sillas y mesas plegables que distribuyen en las diversas mueblerías de la ciudad de Juliaca, el deseo de esta pareja es obtener un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de materiales y cumplir sus deseos.

loans.use: To raise capital to purchase more raw materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Madame Edoh A. was born on November 30, 1962 in Lomé. She is a married with four children. She has sold fabrics in the large market in Lomé since 2001. She buys the fabrics in the big market warehouses and displays them for sale at a profit.

This first loan that she is requesting through Kiva Field Partner, WAGES, will allow her to buy 25 rolls of high-quality fabric. With the income from this enterprise she will thus be able to help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Edoh est née le 30 novembre 1962 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Depuis 2001 elle est revendeuse de tissus au grand marché de Lomé. Elle achète les tissus dans les grands magasins du marché et les expose afin de pouvoir vendre et gagner aussi un bénéfice.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite auprès de WAGES lui permettra d’acheter 25 rouleaux de tissus de qualité supérieure. Ainsi avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra aider son mari dans les dépenses de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy 25 rolls of fabric

loans.name: Fuente De Esperanza (Source Of Hope) Bank Group

texts.en:
Elisabet is the mother of four children, the last of whom was born only a few days ago. She has two businesses - one selling chicken and the other selling clothing. Esperanza International has given Elisabet two loans already, both of which she has successfully paid back. With her third loan, Elisabet hopes to continue growing her businesses so that she can better provide for her family. One day, she dreams of having her very own house and providing her children with the best education.

This loan will also fund the business efforts of the other women in the group.

Please note: The man in the photo is Elisabet´s husband. He appears on her behalf because she is still at home resting with her new born baby.

Note: This is a group loan. Each woman in the group helps to support and guarantee the loan.

loans.use: To grow her two businesses and support her four children

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juanita, as her friends and clients lovingly call her, is a hardworking, charismatic and popular woman, thanks to her small but important soft drink business. Through the success of her business, she is able to help her husband support the family expenses. This young mother has just given birth to her youngest daughter, which has motivated her to continue working hard and persevering. With her two daughters and small cart, Juanita leaves her house for the main streets of the town, where she sells her soft drinks. Thanks to the income she earns through this business, she is able to offer her family economic security. At this time, Juanita asks you generous people for a loan with which she will buy larger quantities of raw materials to increase her soft drink sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer.

Juanita, como cariñosamente la llaman sus amigos y clientes es una mujer trabajadora con gran carisma y popularidad, gracias a su pequeño pero significativo negocio de venta de refrescos viene apoyando a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar, actualmente esta joven madre acaba de concederle la vida a la menor de sus dos hijas convirtiéndose en un motivo más de su esfuerzo y constancia.En compañía de sus hijas y de su pequeña carretita abandona su hogar para dirigirse por las principales arterias de la ciudad de Juliaca, ofreciendo sus refrescantes y deliciosos refrescos en forma ambulatoria, gracias a este negocio que le otorga un ingreso indispensable a su familia tiene la dicha de ofrecerles tranquilidad económica.En esta oportunidad Juanita recurre a vuestros generosos corazones para solicitarles un préstamo ya que tiene pensado adquirir insumos en grandes cantidades para incrementar la producción de sus refrescos.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to increase soft drink sales

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: We Never Perish Group

texts.en: Mabinty is the group leader and has accessed loans from SMT twice before. A hardworking woman and a mother of 5 children, her hope is to be able to provide for her children's need. Her previous loans aided her to expand the business and increase her income. She sells rice, palm oil, vegetables, and peanut butter. She plans to rent a stall in the market to run her business. Mabinty (left) is 35 years old and married. Both Mabinty and Isatu sell in the open market in Magburaka town and are therefore requesting a loan of Le. 1,400,000.

loans.use: To purchase more goods and generate more income

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga and Alejandro are the parents of two young children who have become the center of their lives. Since their marriage, they have worked hard to provide safety, tranquility and above all education for their children. For these reasons, this diligent and creative couple has decided to begin making handcrafted shoes in their own workshop. Aside from this job, on the weekends Olga buys and sells cattle to earn extra money to use in the creation of her workshop. However, due to the recent surge in demand for her shoes, Olga needs to buy a large quantity of raw materials to complete these orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Olga y Alejandro son padres de 2 pequeños niños que se han convertido en el principal impulso de sus vidas. Desde que se unieron trabajaron arduamente con el fin de brindarles seguridad, tranquilidad y sobre todo educación a sus retoños, es así que esta diligente pareja por iniciativa y creatividad propia decidió incursionar en el oficio de elaboración de calzados, iniciaron de manera artesanal pero poco a poco fueron implementando su tallercito.Adicionalmente a esta labor Doña Olga los fines de semana se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, los ingresos que obtiene con este oficio le permitieron implementar aún más y en poco tiempo su tallercito, pero ahora viendo la cantidad de solicitudes que tienen se ve en la necesidad de adquirir gran cantidad de materia prima y así cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of a large quantity of raw materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia lives on the street Mario Mercado Vaca Guzmán of the zone Bautista Saavedra in the town of El Alto. She lives with her husband and her four children; 16, 12, 10, and 2 years of age. She owns a carpenter workshop where she and her husband mainly manufacture suitcases and trunks which they sell to middlemen at different markets in the town. The loan will be spent on buying a sewing machine to improve the time of production and thus the volume produced. This is the third loan with Impro, and the second through the KIVA program. The evaluation shows notable progress in the increase of her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Julia vive en la calle Mario Mercado Vaca Guzmán de la zona Bautista Saavedra en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 16, 12, 10 y 2 años respectivamente. Posee un taller de carpintería de madera donde junto a su esposo, elaboran principalmente maletas y baúles que venden a los intermediarios en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de maquina de coser, para mejorar el tiempo de producción y por consiguiente el volumen de producción. Es el tercer crédito con Impro, y el segundo que va por el programa KIVA; en la evaluación realizada se pudo constatar que tiene un progreso notable en cuanto al incremento de su mercadería.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine to manufacture parts of suitcases and trunks.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela lives in La Florida in the Munaypata sector of La Paz, Bolivia. She is single and lives with her parents.

In the evenings she works as a cashier and during the day she sells cosmetics on comission.

She will use the microloan to purchase construction materials to create a separate room for herself in the terrace of her parent´s home.

This is her second loan with Impro and the credit evaluation qualifies her to receive the microloan.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to create a room for herself in her parent´s home.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Her scarce economic resources did not stop Mrs. Leonor from starting her projects. This diligent mother is aware that to reach her dreams she must work hard and maintain her business of buying and selling pigs. She acquires her animals in the districts of Taraco and Samán. After feeding them and increasing their weight, she sells them at a higher price, earning a considerable income. While Mrs. Leonor occupies herself with this noble profession, her husband takes advantage of the employment he is offered, and between both of them the couple is able to cover their home expenses. This responsible and dedicated mother counts on your loan, which will allow her to purchase a greater quantity of pigs and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Sus bajos recursos económicos no fueron obstáculo para que Doña Leonor concrete sus proyectos, ésta diligente madre es consciente que para alcanzar sus sueños tiene que esforzarse y perseverar en su negocio de compra y venta de porcinos, adquiere sus animalitos de los distritos de Taraco y Samán, luego de alimentarlos y engordarlos para que adquieran un adecuado peso y talla los vende a precios más elevados obteniendo un considerable porcentaje de ganancias.Mientras doña Leonor se dedica a esta noble labor su esposo Marcelino trata de aprovechar los diferentes trabajos eventuales que se le presenta y entre ambos cubren los gastos de su hogar, en esta oportunidad esta responsable y dedicada madre desea contar con vuestro apoyo, apoyo que le permitirá mejorar su capital de inversión

loans.use: Purchasing a greater quantity of pigs.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Estrellas Brillante (Brilliant Stars) Group

texts.en:
Ysabel is the mother of three children, ages 5, 14 and 16. She has a business where she sells clothes and shoes. She wants to be able to send her children to school and proviD. them with a better life. By investing the money she will receive from the loan in her business, she hopes to grow her clothing sales and pursue her dreams for her family.

The loan will also help the other group members fund their business enterprises. The photo shows all ten women at a group meeting with their loan officer.

Note: This is a group loan. The women in the group help support and guarantee the loan for one another.

loans.use: To help grow her clothing business and support her three children.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German has a taxi operating with the Emperador radio taxi company. His home is located in Villa San Antonio Bajo, a neighbourhood of La Paz, Bolivia.

This is the second time he requests a microcredit from Impro and he plans to use the money to maintain his taxi´s motor and get a change of tires.

His work and experience as a taxi driver give him the opportunity to request this microloan since he has proven himself a responsible individual with his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Maintenance of his taxi´s motor and change of tires.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco works as the technical director of the Club Bolivar’s football schools and he is responsible for his two children. He lives in the area of Miraflores in the city of La Paz. This is the second time he requests a loan with Impro, and it will be spent on a costly medical treatment for his son who has started suffering from anaemia and he does not have sufficient resources for the treatment. His work and responsibility give him the opportunity of obtaining this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco trabaja como director técnico en las escuelas de futbol que tiene el Club Bolívar, tiene dos hijos que están a su cargo. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el mismo que será destinado para el tratamiento medico de su hijo ya que está con principios de anemia y necesita una gran colaboración y no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para ese tratamiento. Su trabajo y responsabilidad le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.

loans.use: Costs related to medical treatment for his anaemic son.

loans.name: Cerafina

texts.es:
Mrs. Cerafina is a caring and diligent mother and a humble person. Since her daughters began studying, the home expenses have increased, and as a responsible mother she sees it as her responsibility to accommodate this change. Due to the advice of her friends and unconditional support from her daughters, she decided to dedicate herself to buying and selling groceries, clothes, and merchandise, which she acquires in the city of Juliaca and sells in a local mine. Her business, Doña Cerafina, requires a great sacrifice, as she must travel long distances to sell her merchandise. At the same time, the business brings her satisfaction as her efforts have materialized into earnings. Mrs. Cerafina thinks that increasing the number of products offered would considerably improve her income, and therefore is asking you generous people for a loan to help fund this investment. Mrs. Cerafina promises to return the loan in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Cerafina, es una madre cariñosa, diligente y humilde de corazón, desde que sus hijas empezaron a seguir estudios superiores los gastos de su hogar se incrementaron y como madre responsable se vio en la necesidad de incursionar en diferentes actividades.Es así que por consejo de sus amistades y apoyo incondicional de sus hijas decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de abarrotes y ropas, mercadería que adquiere al por mayor en la ciudad de Juliaca y los vende en la mina rinconada, este negocio a Doña Cerafina le resulta sacrificado pero satisfactorio al mismo tiempo, sacrificado porque constantemente emprende largos viajes para llevar y vender su mercadería y satisfactorio porque gracias a su esfuerzo logra obtener buenas ganancias; Doña Cerafina considera que aumentando su capital de inversión mejorarán considerablemente sus ingresos, es por ello que recurre a vuestra generosa persona y promete rembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses.

loans.use: Increasing capital to offer a greater number of products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
Adelio has a workshop where he makes piñatas out of plastic, working together with his wife. He lives in the Gran Poder zone of the city of La Paz. This is the fourth time that he has solicited a loan in IMPRO, and the second loan where he has asked for support through Kiva. He now would like to open a store where he could offer a variety of party products, for events such as birthdays, weddings, baptisms, etc. His history shows that he is a top-notch customer, in other words, he has complied with his previous loan payments. The loan would be designated to purchase the raw materials (paint, plastic, ribbon, paintbrushes, etc.) necessary for making his piñatas.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Adelio tiene un taller donde elabora toda clase de piñatas de plastoformo y trabaja con su esposa. Vive en la zona de el Gran Poder de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que solicita el apoyo de kiva, ya que su perspectiva es poder abrir una tienda donde pueda ofrecer todo articulo de fiestas, como ser cumpleaños, matrimonios, bautizos, y otros. Su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago se sus cuotas. El crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima ( pintura, Plastoformo, cintas, pinceles y otros) necesaria para la elaboración de sus piñatas.

loans.use: Purchase of paints, plastic, ribbons, paintbrushes, etc., for his production of party piñatas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a collection of shoes to replenish her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand a small business by adding kitchen items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to produce candies and arepas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beauty products to retail in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest a blender and raw materials for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana plays the role of both mother and father to her three dear children. Since her husband passed away, she has taken over the reins of the household and works tirelessly so that her children are not in want of anything and can continue with their educations. This is how she decided to grow her business of buying and selling sheep wool and alpaca yarn, a business she had started with her beloved husband with many dreams and aspirations. Now she and her children want to run the business. She acquires her merchandise in the small towns neighboring the city of Juliaca. After compiling a good quantity of goods she sells them at wholesale to textile mills, thus earning a good income for the well-being and peace-of-mind of her family. The wish of this exemplary mother is to obtain a loan which she plans on investing into her enterprise. Your support will help make this hard-working family’s dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Juliana es padre y madre D. sus 3 queridos hijos, desD. que su esposo falleció tomó las riendas D. su hogar y trabaja arduamente con el fin D. que sus tres queridos hijos no pasen privaciones económicas y puedan seguir sin problemas sus estudios superiores.Fue así que decidió sacar adelante su negocio D. compra y venta D. lana D. oveja y fibra D. alpaca, negocio que emprendió junto a su amado esposo con muchas ilusiones y proyectos y que ahora doña Juliana y sus adorables hijos desean impulsar.Ella adquiere su mercadería D. los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad D. Juliaca, luego D. reunir una buena cantidad los venD. al por mayor a una empresa textil, obteniendo considerables ganancias para el bienestar y tranquilidad D. su familia.El deseo D. esta ejemplar madre es obtener un préstamo ya que tiene proyectando invertirlos en su negocio.Tu disponibilidad y apoyo permitirá concretar los anhelos D. esta laboriosa familia.

loans.use: Increase of capital to grow her capacity to buy and sell merchandise.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad was born in Arequipa but, for family reasons, she now lives in the city in Juliaca with her two small children. To help meet their living expenses, this industrious mother decided to outfit a small space in her rented home to open a grocery store. In a short amount of time, she has gathered regular customers with a variety of needs. It’s for this reason that Soledad finds herself needing to implement and increase the stock for her store. Thanks to the income from her business, she can meet her home's expenses. However, Soledad thinks that investing in her enterprise will help her meet her customers’ needs and increase her income even more which would, as a result, improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El Departamento de Arequipa, es la ciudad natal de Soledad, quien por cuestiones familiares junto a sus 2 menores hijos radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, esta hacendosa madre para cubrir los gastos de su hogar decidió adecuar un pequeño espacio de su vivienda alquilada para abrir una tiendita de abarrotes y en corto tiempo ha logrado acoger asiduos clientes con innumerables solicitudes, es por ello que Soledad se ve en la necesidad de implementar y aumentar el stock de su mercadería.Gracias a los ingresos que obtiene con su negocio puede cubrir los gastos de su hogar, pero doña Soledad considera que invirtiendo en su negocio podrá satisfacer todas las necesidades de sus clientes y mejorar aun más sus ingresos económicos y por ende su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Increase of capital to augment the products she offers.

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
Nieves is a 56-year-old woman who lives in a very poor community called Mata D. Palma, which is on the outskirts of Hato Mayor. Nieves lives with her husband and 15-year-old daughter in a small home. She started a small business two years ago selling homemaD. food to her community members. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more flour, oil, plantains, and chicken. Nieves operates her own `fritura,´ a small business that makes homemaD. snacks, such as empanadas.  In the Dominican Republic, it is very common for people to buy a snack on the street corner as they walk to work, their homes, or simply when they are out and about. The money from this loan will help Nieves to buy enough ingredients to make the food necessary to meet the demands she faces. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more stable with the help of this loan.  The profits she makes will enable her to better proviD. for her family.  On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Nieves herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

The loan will also help fund the businesses of the other group members. 

About Group Loans: In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults on the loan.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, plantains, and chicken

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa, a mother that is humble at heart as well as economically, was born in the city of Ayaviri but has lived in the city of Juliaca for the past two years. Since she formed her home, she has focused completely on her family as well as on the small grocery store that she installed in her home. Thanks to much effort and devotion, she has been able to implement her enterprise. Now that her little store is frequented often by her neighbors, she wishes to finish improvements to it and meet her customers’ needs. With this project in mind, and your generous support, she will be able to meet her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Luisa, es una madre humilde de corazón y de recursos económicos, es natural de la ciudad de Ayaviri y desde hace 2 años radica en la ciudad de Juliaca. Desde que formó su hogar se consagró completamente a su familia y a la pequeña bodeguita de abarrotes que adecuó en su domicilio y gracias a su esfuerzo y entrega poco a poco ha ido implementando.Ahora que su tiendita esta siendo muy visitada por sus vecinos desea terminar de implementarlo y satisfacer cada una de sus peticiones, con ese proyecto en mente y vuestro generoso apoyo espera cumplir sus objetivos.

loans.use: Increase of capital to expand her products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Takarsu Group

texts.en: Abdul Rahaman is the Takarsu group leader. The members are all school dropouts due to a lack of school fees. The members have accessed loans from SMT twice and have expanded their businesses. They own stalls of general merchandise in Magburaka town. As young people, the members have ambitious future plans for a better life and therefore would like to expand and diversify their businesses to meet their goals. Abdul is 21 years old, and his plan is to pursue education through distance learning while running his business. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 3,426,000.

loans.use: To purchase various items to increase stock

loans.name: Fifty - Fifty Group

texts.en: Abdul K. is 35 years old and married with 4 children. As a leader of the group, he demonstrated honesty in repaying his previous loan promptly. He is happy that the loan enabled him to increase his stock. Like other group members, he would like to further expand his business and is requesting a total loan of Le. 1,900,000.

loans.use: To increase inventory of cosmetics

loans.name: Kafe Semiria Group

texts.en: Amidu C. is the Kafe Semiria group leader and is married with 7 children. Fifty years old, Amidu sells second-hand clothes in Magburaka town. With his previous loan, he increased his stock by 3 bails of clothes and generated more income. His business is the major source of income for the family, and he was able to meet his children's educational expenses. He would like to increase his inventory and use the income/profit to invest in agricultural production. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 2,800,00 (Le. 700,000 each) to expand their various businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more bails of used clothes and generate more income

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
The desire to continue with her studies is Ruth's motivation to work hard at her business of selling cosmetic products. She started in this venture thanks to one of her relatives who invited her to enter into the business. Ruth offers her beauty products at her place of study, as well as to the general public. Thanks to her efforts, dedication, and persuasive nature with regard to sales this activity has turned into an important means of income which helps her cover her educational expenses. This smart, hard-working young woman wishes to obtain a loan and invest the funds to obtain better results. This would provide her also with more peace of mind.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El empeño de seguir adelante con sus estudios superiores es el motivo que tiene Ruth para esforzarse en su negocio de venta de productos cosméticos, se inició en esta actividad gracias a uno de sus familiares que la invitó a incursionar en este negocio.Ruth ofrece sus cosméticos de belleza en su centro de estudios y al público en general, gracias a su empeño, dedicación y don persuasivo para las ventas esta actividad se ha convertido en una importante fuente de ingresos que le ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su educación. Esta joven inteligente, dedicada y emprendedora desea obtener un préstamo, dinero que le permitirá obtener mejores resultados luego de su inversión para su tranquilidad.

loans.use: Increase of capital to grow the amount of merchandise she offers for sale.

loans.name: Kick Poor United Group

texts.en: Yeabu K. is very grateful to Kiva for her first loan of $175. She is one of the first Kiva clients in Magburaka and has diligently paid back her loan. Yeabu said that she has benefited a lot from the loan, as her business expanded and profits increased. With the profit, she was able to meet her children's educational expenses. With 7 children, she needs to work hard to generate income for their needs and supplement her husband's income. She is the Kick Poor United group leader, and their goal is to kick poverty out of their families. The group said that a loan of Le. 1,900,000 will enable them to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of rice, palm oil, beans, chili peppers, etc

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Konike Barina Group

texts.en: Issa K. is 38 years old and married with 2 children. He owns a small stall of merchandise in Magburaka town. Issa K. is a Kiva client who completed his loan repayment, and he is also a Konike Barina group leader. The group works so cooperatively and assists each other in purchasing the goods in Freetown on a rotational basis. The group would like to expand their businesses and is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 2,400,000 for the purpose.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory, soap, cigarettes, candy, etc

loans.name: Lesbia

texts.es:
Lesbia Soltera works in a food store. She is 27, lives with her children in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood and is single and has three underage children. For three years, Lesbia has worked in her brother's food store to earn a salary with which she has been able to improve her house.

She would like a loan to buy construction materials to continue to make improvements to her house, and in the future she hopes to start her own food store to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ian, Kiva volunteer.

Lesbia S. trabaja en un negocio de venta de comida. Tiene 27 años de edad, habita junto a sus hijos en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es soltera y tiene 3 pequeños menores de edad. Desde hace tres años Lesbia trabaja en un negocio de venta de comida propiedad de su hermana por el cual devenga un salario, y con éste ha podido mejorar su casa.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para poder seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa de habitación. En un futuro espera poder llegar a poner su propio negocio de comida, para poder mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to continue improving her house
